I was able to find replacement pads from a third party for around eight bucks. No big deal, but I feel like this was a little too obvious of a mistake to make so easily.
If you have a Mac, this mouse is a must! Do not get that Magic Mouse!  It will give you carpal tunnel!!!!!
Battery life is excellent, feature set is outstanding. Fits nicely in hand, build quality is excellent. Best mouse I have ever owned. Highly recommended.  Seller did well as arrived quickly.

I recently purchased this mouse because I am a visual effects artist. This is hands down, the worst mouse, I have ever used. The fact that it does not work while plugged in with the USB-C cable is completely idiotic. Why in hell would you prevent the mouse from working while plugged in?  The reason this is a problem is because the bluetooth connection is extremely laggy. The mouse is constantly sticking when working in Maya and Houdini, it is really bothersome. For how expensive this mouse is, whoever signed off on preventing the usb cable from allowing the mouse to still be used should be fired.Garbage.
Great mouse! A must have!

Coming from the first-gen MX, this is probably an overall downgrade.First of all, it really isn't all that comfortable. Its profile is significantly taller than previous versions, and you definitely feel it. While it is tolerable after a while, I really don't enjoy using it.Secondly, scrolling is now noticeably less responsive. Unlike previous versions, switching between smooth and tactile scrolling is now automatic and controlled by software instead of a mechanical button. While this is a neat party trick, be prepared to wait a good 100-250ms from when you move your scroll wheel to when it actually does something on screen.
Using this mouse for several hours will cause you pain and most likely a carpal tunnel problem, it is to heavyweighted! Be aware!
Good quality made. Ergonomics is excellent. But if your left handed like I am. It does feel weird having to use my right hand. Would reccomend
I ordered Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless Mouse, but only the box was MX Master 3, while the mouse inside is actually MX Master the first version.Highly not recommended.
Hands down the best mouse I have ever used!

The receiver that came with mine can't be used more than a foot away from the mouse without stutters every few minutes. It's out of return policy now so I'll have to buy another one receiver. Really disappointed.The mouse itself is great though.
The last I’ll ever need. I had the Mx Master 2 and all of the plastic scroll wheels, now I love the professional feel of the metal.

I did not purchase from Amazon because I'm outside of the country, but I have used the Logitech Anywhere 2S for a while and was originally going to upgrade to the MX Anywhere 3. But I pulled the trigger and gave the MX Master 3 a shot because of the reviews and the customization of the mouse functionality. I'm so impressed with this mouse -- it works amazing with my late-2019 MBP 16" via Bluetooth and also via the unifying receiver. I really thought it was going to be too big and uncomfortable for my hands before purchasing compared to the MX Anywhere 2S I still have, but it took me literally about 5-minutes to get accustomed to it. Bottom line, if you're on the fence about purchasing the MX Master 3, seriously just go ahead and buy one. It really is that good. And no, Logitech is not paying me to say this either. 5-stars.

This could be a great mouse but it has a fundamental flaw, the scroll wheel. How is the average review above 4 stars is mind boggling. The scroll wheel either does not scroll a page enough or in the case of zooming in/out zooms too much with a single "click". In the end I found this scroll wheel just not working. It is a finicky thing and I don't know why it is so hard to use but it just doesn't work right compared to the $25 mouse it replaced. My scroll finger is getting tired working so hard. Bad scroll ergonomics.Other more minor complaints but ones that should not be in a $100 mouse: - The ergonomics of the forward/back buttons could be improved. With some practice I mostly get used to them. But they could be more pronounced and they feel a little high. - Software: why do you keep creating new software, Logitech? My Logitech Keyboard uses different software than my old Logitech wired mouse which uses different software than the new Logitech mouse. For the love of humanity, your products should have a consistent experience. I used to think buying Logitech would mean I get a more integrated solution but no it is more fractured buying products from the same company. - Software settings: the Logitech Options doesn't even allow changing basic settings of the mouse. If you want to change the number of lines the scroll wheel moves then you need to go to the Windows settings. Why? - The "SmartShift" feature takes a bit of tweaking to get working right and I still don't find it works great. - For a "professional" series mouse there are no advance customization of the buttons. Yes, you can customize a single function for a button which provides many options on what it will do. And yes, you can customize behavior for different applications (which I haven't found that useful). But you can't create macros and you can't create "key combinations". For example, it would be great to hold shift and use the horizontal wheel to adjust volume. But no, it is either configured to do horizontal scrolling or volume control ... not both with a hotkey. Seems limited for a top of the line mouse.It's a shame, the other features make it a great mouse: USB-C rechargeable, otherwise good ergonomics, and high precision tracking. But the vertical scrolling issues and the poor software are inexcusable on any mouse that costs more than $25 much less $100.

Amazing product, would highly recommend to anyone who needs performance and reliability. The battery life is out of this world, I haven't charged it since I've bought it almost a month ago. The software helps to link the products and customize them. Works great with the MX Keyboard and both can use the same receiver. Excellent for use between Windows & Mac. Great, great buy!

This one feels much nicer then previous generation. However, still has the same defect on MacOS. Configured functions of buttons just sporadically stop working. After some time it magically starts working again.

I bought this to upgrade my MX Mouse (1st Gen). I hesitated to spend another 100$ for a mouse - I don't game and it's only a mouse - but I caved in.
The ergonomics are improved, especially the back/forward buttons on the side and the texture of the mouse is more comfortable in the hand. The USB C is a nice plus as well.Is it "worth" the 100$? I don't know, but I like my new mouse.
it might be unconfortable at the begining but once you get used is great

Well put together.  It has a great feel and the battery lasts forever!  Obviously, it would be nice if the dongle had a storage spot on the mouse itself.  But the feel and performance more than make up for it.

Great ergonomics. Well balanced weight distribution. Premium feet. Long lasting battery life. User friendly companion app with Microsoft 365 + Teams button customizations.Overall great mouse for daily office needs. Very satisfied with my purchase.

I wanted to like this mouse, but I just can't.  Sure, it's comfortable and has all the features I was looking for, but it just doesn't work properly in a Linux environment.  I haven't used Windoze for over a decade so I used to having things not work the same.  Running Mint 20.1 this mouse will randomly stutter and freeze.  This is unacceptable while trying to edit video (or anytime really).  This product is advertised as being Linux compatible, yet there is no software from Logitech to do so.  This has been a problem with them for many years.  Check for yourself, do a search for Linux support on the Logitech website.  You will see generic canned responses and sidestepped issues among the many complaints.I also only get about a week before I need to recharge the battery, no where near the advertised life.I have a week left in my Amazon return window.  It's going back.  It's just too expensive to let it sit around unused.  I would have been fine with the price had it fully and properly worked like it was advertised to.  To charge $100 for a mouse that the company KNOWS doesn't do what they say it does is unacceptable.  This was my last ever Logitech product.  Now I have to find something else that works.  More downtime from work due to their misrepresentation of their product.
I've had this mouse for a while now. The sensor isn't as sharp as it was when I first got it.
Best mouse I've ever used

Tracks very smooth and reliably on any reasonably flat surface. Switching between free-wheel and ratcheting modes on the main wheel came in more handy than I thought. The optional Logitech mouse software provides outstanding customization of the mouse buttons and wheels for individual programs, you can even invert the scroll direction for the thumb and/or main wheel. Switching between computers is really easy.
Def the best mouse on the market for excel. Able to customize the buttons and scroll horizontally on spreadsheets is awesome.
Too big for my hand

This mouse was a replacement of my all time favorite mouse--the Logitech Performance MX.The MX Master 3 felt good and it fit very well in my large hands.  It was very comfortable.  The mouse was too light in that it would frequently slide off the mouse pad and even spin in place when I removed my hand from it.  I eventually became annoyed with having to constantly reorient the mouse.  The mouse was responsive both using the USB and bluetooth connectivity.  My biggest concern with this mouse was that the left button does not have a distinct response (feel) when clicked.  There was motion but no "click".  In some cases, the left-click did not even register.  My previous mouse left button failed so this was a big issue for me.  It felt to me as though the left-mouse button was designed to fail.  I returned this mouse.
Bought new, but seal was broken and the sticker protecting mouse is contaminated.

The reviews said one of the best mouse for professional work but the scroll wheel sucks. When I scroll down, it after scrolls up in the end. Better than the cheaper mouse but the scroll wheel is defiantly a flaw.
the best mouse for productivity

Purchased this along with a slew of other things for a new home office setup. Every part of it feels extremely high quality. The scroll wheels are, or appear to be, metal, which gives a nice tactile feel to them. Also love the ability to jump between devices which will come in handy as I work from multiple laptops. Yes, a little pricey for a mouse but for the quality and functionality, it will certainly pay for itself.
Simply the best mouse I have ever used. Worth the extra cost.
Love love love it!! Just wish it was an easier way to map the buttons for each programs.
works really well but the size seems to be built for large hands -- and mine are not:
This is the only mouse it fits my hands and provides great support. I am very happy with it.I recommend you buy it from Amazon because Logitech is very slow with shipments.
Not pleasant to receive a damaged package, will see if the functions are damanged
Easy to set up I’d like I don’t have to change batteries out just charge it’s a good mouse

Never got the unifying receiver to work. Tried it with 3 different windows pc's, I guess it is a good thing I bought it to work with my tablet which is bluetooth. Not worth the money though, I cannot suggest this product. The whole reason I paid extra for the mouse was so that I could switch it between my tablet, laptop, and desktop seamlessly, however it does not offer that at all. It is a pain in the ass. I could get it to work, but by the time I download all these special drivers, install special software so their overpriced mouse can work, it is easier to grab a 5 dollar wireless mouse and plug it in.

This mouse has been very smooth and responsive...nice full size for my hand, lots of functionality.
Really pleased with it...
It's great. A little lighter than the previous versions which I preferred but still fantastic

Although I just returned it (big hassle to do so). It's still a great mouse my only reason for returning it was I didn't realize I already had an extra one. I really do love this mouse and I spend close to 5 hours a day using a mouse in photoshop.

This Mouse is built well and ergonomic were needed. If you are planning to buy this for your M1 Macbook however I would not recommend this and advise you to look elsewhere. The mouse is very laggy and and the scroll wheel is a chore to use. Even after fully charging and putting on the given dongle it did not solve the issue. I tried the mouse with my PC which works great however that wasn't what I needed this for. Also this mouse is NOT for gaming.
This is definitely the best feeling mouse I've ever met. Absolutely worth the price... plus the logitech flow is awesome! Using it between 2 laptops and an iPad.
I like the ergonomic feel of the mouse
awesome mouse, solid metal scroll cylinders, very responsive, works on any surface!
Pretty useful mouse
This mouse is my favorite by far and I have tried nearly all by Logitech and many others. Many productive features and very comfortable.

It is both ergonomic and functional. You can program buttons with a wide choice of options. Another nice feature is the mouse is extremely quiet. Installation and setup was very easy. What I find quite amazing is with all the buttons, I never accidentally hit one of those programmable buttons. A mouse is a mouse and then there is this mouse,  a mouse that looks great and combines function with smooth operation.I have it connected via the USB dongle connected to a USB 3.0 hub that connects to my computer. Using the unifying software makes it easier to install mouse and MX Keys keyboard. Of course, that is when connecting via USB as opposed to bluetooth. Overall I think this mouse pairs excellently with the MX Keys Keyboard.

I have large hands and this mouse fits me very well.  I have had carpal tunnel problems and this ergonomic mouse seems to bother my carpal tunnel the least of any mouse I have ever used.  It also has an abundance of features which make using it a pleasure.  I am sure that for someone who works with a mouse all day everyday it would be an even more attractive device.
This is a garbage 100$ mouse, thumb scroll wheel does not perform horizontal scrolls.

This mouse is a complete failure and a regret every penny I paid for it.First, it has been advertised as the "ergonomic" mouse, and I started getting sharp pain on me hand "between my thumb and index" and next to my litter finger. I have been using the magic mouse 2 for three years and half and I never ever had similar pain until I got this "ergonomic".Secondly **most importantly** the scrolling on this mouse is an utter disaster. The scrolling is not accurate, and in many times, you will have to scroll again as it does not pick it up every time.I came from  magic mouse 2 and I thought the grass was greener. TO BE RETURNED
The mouse could be bigger for ergonomics, but it is better than my Microsoft Sculpt Ergonomic mouse. So far it has proven tough and reliable having fallen twice with no apparent damage.
Works good and feels good in the palm. Battery charge lasts a good while.
My work improve since I have it

This mouse is a dream come true--not only can I switch between up to three computers with a button push, but it is incredibly comfortable and there are so many handy functions.  I took away a star, however, because the setup instructions are completely useless.  Typical of Logitech.  There is software called Logitech Options that you must use to configure this and the MX keyboard.  In addition, when you try to set this device up with another computer, there is exactly ZERO information on how to do that.  I finally got it done by trial and error, but Logitech needs to hire someone who can write complete documentation and then include it in the package!  However, once set up, this is a great mouse!

I've 2-3 versions of every MX since the MX2 including the portables. I upgraded to this from an MX2 that I loved but wanted to upgrade to usbc. This mouse has the WORST battery life I've ever experienced outside of those 1st gen Apple Magic mice or whatever that died every week. It is TERRIBLE. My MX2 lasted what feels like 2-3 months. I hardly remember ever charging it.I must charge this mouse once every 6-9 days. It's so bad I keep a use brick in front of it to charge it.I really can't think of any positives over the MX2.Also, do NOT get the grey. It is the most difficult mouse I've ever had to keep clean, it gets disgusting looking in a week and I'm not eating cheetos and mountain dew at my desk.  The grey is way more of an "IBM" / Battleship dull grey than it looked in the pictures to me. I kinda like it but it's quite a bit different from the pic.
Absolutely love this mouse. 10/10.
class="cr-original-review-content">Recomendado al 100%
Loved the responsiveness of this mouse and I could use it all my three laptops.
Absolutely love it! Great for switching between a work laptop and gaming computer. Pairs nicely with the MX Keys keyboard too!
best mouse everergogreat options to configureit allows to work between 2 laptopsI've always think is expensive and I've never seen it less than 99$ but great mouse
It keeps getting disconnected from my laptop. Definitely doesn't give me the smooth experience I was hoping for

I've loved this series of mouse since the first one. I've owned every single one of them.Everything is the same except for the side buttons. I love the change. It feels sturdier unlike the previous version where it wobbled a lot, and the button is distinct so I had less problem feeling the buttons.

I'm happy w/ this purchase.  I'm not using anything close to the capabilities of it, but like the comfort of it in my hand...the tracking of the cursor...& the overall performance of it.  Would purchase it again, if needed.
A little big but battery lasts a long time and is comfortable.

I bought mine directly from the Logitech website since I hear a lot of issues about receiving counterfeit items on Amazon. With that being said, I'm very happy with the upgrade. It feels very nice in the hand, scroll wheel is very quiet, if not completely silent. It's not too heavy and not too light, feels like a solid build. The stainless steel used on the scroll wheel feels nice, and helps with using the free scroll. The thumb wheel on the side might be stainless steel as well because it feels very high quality as well. Being able to customize the functions of the gesture button and thumb wheel is super nice to have, didn't know what I was missing out on.
Bought it for the mag scroll.Kept it for the excellent battery life.
I like the way this mouse, which is bigger than others I have had, fits in my hand
Have enjoyed this mouse for a while now. Side scroll is useful in excel, coding, and Lightroom too. I love the custom ability with this mouse and I'm definitely going to use this for ages!
An excellent mouse, a little short on battery life.
Amazing mouse for a daily use.
very pleased - extremely accurate and responsive
Best mouse I’ve ever used!

This is THE WORST mouse I have ever used in my life.  The cursor skips and jumps all over the place.  The scroll is always too fast. It doesn't seem to like ANY surface I put it on.  Also, I use a standing desk that has a separate platform for the keyboard and mouse which I like to have inclined very slightly for ergonomic purposes and the mouse SLIDES all over the place.  Can wait for the OG mouse I ordered to arrive.  What a piece of junk, and overprices at that.  And the batter life; it's fine but having to plug it in is a pain in the rear.  I'd rather just replace the batteries.

Scroll wheel skips excessively. Not sure if it is a hardware or software issue, but it is unacceptable for a product that costs how much it does and is pretty great in every other way. Same behavior with Bluetooth or universal plug and regardless of charge level.

Software is great, cool design, durability is solid, button placement is good. However, the "ergonomic" structure hurt my hand for a week after just a day of use. The issue is that the "hump" (the peak height of the mouse) is so far to the rear and at such a steep incline. Your wrist MUST be an inch or more above the mouse surface, otherwise your wrist will feel very uncomfortable and quickly painful. That's a fail, which is a shame because it's otherwise perfect. So if you are one who likes to rest your wrist, look elsewhere.

Good mouse, though a $20 wireless mouse will work just as well save for less buttons, and might even have a better warranty.Logitech is price gouging given their near-monopoly for wireless mice that look nice and work on glass. However, I will be looking at the Microsoft Arc Touch, which seems to accomplish the same things, while providing a 3 year warranty and looking bomb.Cya, Logitech.

I work full time on both Mac/Windows laptops now and really started despising the ergonomics of Magic Mouse (MM2) . The shape and size of the Apple MM I think Apple must use children's hands to design mice. This Logitech mouse fits my hand well in a more natural position for my hand and thumb and stopped all the hand cramping and arm pain from using the required crab-pincer grip with the MM. While I miss the built in functionality of the MM that Apple won't share, the Logitech has a side scroll and a hefty scroll wheel for verticle scroll with a free scroll too. The side scroll is nice on the Apple MM and the It works with The triple multi device swap is nice though I wish they could move the device swap button to the top somewhere. The USB-C charge port is in the front not underneath like Apple's "innovative" underneath port which renders the mouse useless until you can get enough charge to get by. Overall I'm glad to have switched and relagated the MM to selling to someone else.
Very nice but sometimes it stops working for a minute, then it starts again. You would think a mouse that cost so much would work all the time!

The scroll wheel doesn't register if you scroll too quickly. This results in a very awkward feeling experience. There is no way I could ever use this mouse for work / productivity. This is apparently a known problem. There is a lengthy reddit thread about it. The mx master 2 scroll wheel works fine but everyone seems to have problems with the mx 3, even people who have owned multiple mx3's. Pity because other than this it's a great overall mouse.

I do quite a bit of CAD work as an engineer and am constantly on multiple computers.  Mouse feels comfortable and works well.  I have the keyboard as well.  This is a pretty slick way of controlling 3 machines with just a single mouse and keyboard.  I definitely recommend using the setting to hold control to switch between computers.  I originally had it where if I touched the edge of the screen it would jump over to the other computer.  This started causing issues since it takes a second for the mouse to jump over to the other machine.  With the Control button, it won't go over unless I want it to.  The only down side is that if you have a VPN on one of the machines, it sometimes stops working.  You then have to use the keyboard "1, 2 or 3" buttons to switch which is not a big deal for being able to switch seamlessly between 3 machines.

I wanted to upgrade my stuff - this looked like IT. IT hurt my hand to use. I went back to my cheap little mouse and got an inexpensive touch pad. I'm happier with my new touch-pad and old cheap mouse.

Takes 1 second after starting scrolling for the mouse to respond, and sometimes it doesn't register at all. The mouse is very comfortable though. Very sad about the scroll wheel, I'll probably switch back to my 15$ Microsoft mouse.

The mouse works great on my desktop. On Mac, both regular Bluetooth and the USB key are extremely unreliable. Every few seconds, the mouse does not track at all and loses connection. Even when connected, the tracking isn't smooth at all. Installing logi options doesn't fix it either.

My hands are fairly large.  I usually grip the mouse with my palm.  The mouse fits great in my hand.  The rubbery feel of the mouse is great.I love the scroll wheel.  Scroll slowly and you get tactile feedback for precision.  Give it a good spin and it'll spin freely,  taking you quickly to the top or bottom of the page.But the best feature by far is the secondary thumb scroll wheel.  I don't think I can use a mouse without this feature from here on out.  Being able to navigate left and right in excel, Vision, CAD, etc... such a simple idea but a huge quality of life enhancement.Honestly best mouse for productivity I've ever used.  Very highly recommended.  The only thing I wish it had was a docking station for recharging.  But it can easily go over a month on a single charge,  so not a show stopper.

I thought the first unit I got was faulty, but after discovering the inconsistently-working scroll wheel I noticed other people having the same issue with this mouse, in the reviews.  I got a replacement, and it's exactly the same.  It's a design flaw, not a malfunction.Both scroll-wheels are affected.  Equal flicks and movements of the wheels produces different results.  Sometimes wheel spins do almost nothing.  I've also noticed right-click button not responding occasionally.  I'm pretty turned-off by Logitech after this waste of time.For $100 bucks this mouse should be perfect, but it can't even get the basics right.

The “magnetic technology” for the scroll wheel is literally so bad. We get it, magnets are cool, but removing the existing working and amazing scroll wheel from the original MX master and 2S and replacing it with magnets was a terrible design choice. “If it ain’t broke don’t fix it”. The magnets provide absolutely 0 resistance when in ratcheting mode. You can barely even tell the difference between ratcheting mode and free spin mode. And as a result, the sensitivity of the smart shift feature feels set at one point regardless of how you set it. Everything else is good, but the mouse has been ruined. If you don’t mind micro usb, just get the MX master 2
Ergonomics are terrible.

Extra buttons translate poorly when using remote sessions to other windows machines, or from inside apps like GOTO MYPC or WEBEX.  You just have to be careful, or button presses will result in random letters appearing inside those sessions.

This is the best keyboard and mouse ever. It feels amazing to type on and is smooth and responsive! I can connect keyboard and mouse to three separate devices and toggle back and forth between them with one click. Phenomenal!! Do yourself a favor and spend the damn money. They are both well worth it!! Highly recommend the keyboard and mouse!!

It has a very loud and grating click sound. I realized that I subconsciously try to avoid clicking because I hate the sound so much.It's also really tall? I keep knocking it off the desk when trying to grab it because I forget how tall it is.The scrolling wheel is just okay. It's supposed to be a major selling point but I don't care for it. I'd rather have a normal scroll wheel that doesn't scroll on its own momentum for days.The 3-device pairing is a killer feature. And it pairs really well with the MX Keys (which I have).
This mouse completes me....

Best multi-functional multi-device mouse.  Logitech Options software is necessary to unlock all the features and perform firmware updates.  Paired with the Logitech MX Keys, this combination is simply superb.
constantly drops connection.
Awesome work all day, no issues, the battery is great today was the first charge since I start to use it. I still checking all the functions

I'm Mac user and I bought this product having in mind the productivity benefits that are promised with this mouse. Unfortunately I didn't have a good usage experience. The mouse loses the capability to use Mac's gestures and this problem dissapears after a while without a apparent reason (I'm using bluetooth connection). It's very frustrating, specially when I have a lot of work and the gestures are gone...I'm totally dissapointed with this purchase and now I'm looking to get another product.

Both scroll wheels are a huge step up overall (harder to middle click in free mode though), side button placement is better.  Ergos better for me.Unfortunately:1. The 2s had multiple dots to show charge, so a low battery never snuck up on you.2. You could use the 2s while you're charging it.Put those two drawbacks together with the 3 (can't keep tabs on the battery life, and can't use while charging) and I keep having to switch back to my old 2s while charging.This mouse is very nearly actual garbage.  Buy the 2s or wait to see if they don't ruin the 3s too.
This mouse is great amazing. I wouldn’t use for gaming. I use it for programming (scrolling).
This mouse is top, I have like 3 months with it and I haven't charged it yet, best quality item.
really liked the scroll wheel, amazing button feels, overall it's really good
I absolutely love this thing. The battery life is amazing, it's extremely comfortable in the hand, and very customizable. Worth every penny.
the best mouse I have ever had, Super argonomic, recommended 100% for those people who spend long hours working on the computer!

I was surprised to see how small this mouse was. I thought it would be much bigger. It seems sturdy, but returned it due to its size. I have large hands and have been on the look out for a larger mouse and this is not it.

Possibly the most well-designed mouse out there. The "grip" is extremely comfortable, the scroll wheel is a pleasure to use, and the battery-life has endurance to spare, only requiring a recharge every few months. There's a notable difference in feel from when I pick up my old MX Master 2S. No problems with the software or the dongle / bluetooth connectionI've had mine for over a year with absolutely no issues (using a PC). If you've got the money for a $100 premium mouse, I'd recommend one, but it's a closer call if you already own an MX Master 2.Most notable improvements from the MX Master 2:- smoother scroll wheel- more accessible forward / backward / gesture buttons- better overall ergonomics

The power suddenly stopped turning on in 6 months. I contacted the support center during the warranty period, but it is not covered by the warranty just by opening the cover. I asked the support center to investigate the cause of the broken, but it is not accepted at all. It is unclear why we can provide good products without investigating the cause of the breakage. Please note that the mouse may break in 6 months.
Liked the product very much

This mouse looks nice and feels nicer. Once you get to feel its wheel, you won't ever want to go back to other mice. The battery lasts a long time: I recharge it once every month and a half or so, and I use this every day for work and gaming. There isn't any noticeable latency with the computer as well. It feels as responsive as a wired mouse.This is pretty expensive, but it's worth it. I've had it for over a year and haven't had a single issue with it. If it breaks down, I'll for sure buy the same model as a replacement. I even got one for my wife!

I bought this mouse to scroll through pdf documents.  As I cannot scroll through one page without scrolling instantly through thirty others to the bottom of the document, this product is completely unusable.MX Master 2s is by FARRRRR the superior mouse, it doesn't even come close.  What an absolute crock of crap.

- The Flow feature that is supposed to let you move between two Macs does not work nearly well enough to be functional.- The thumb gesture button is very hard and unnatural to engage; gestures are supposed to be light, while this is the hardest button of all to push on the mouse.- Otherwise, a functional mouse.
Perfect
It’s just awesome, no complaints.
Great quality.  Very precise!  A bit overpriced.

This is a mouse that is getting awesome reviews on various sites, so maybe my expectations were too high. My main application is office use. I was looking for a mouse that would fit my hands better than a previous generation Logitech Anywhere that died on me recently.Ergonomics: there is a thumb rest integrated to the mouse. It didn't work for me as the friction where the thumb rest is noticeable after a couple of hours of regular use. Also, the horizontal scrolling wheel is not naturally easy to reach, sames things for the thumb buttons, when the hand is resting on the mouse and the thumb on the thumb rest.Feel: the mouse feels too heavy.,The worst thing is the main scrolling wheel. When the ratchet is on, you can feel the (loose?) magnets rattling and bouncing off. This completely disappears when the ratchet is off, but it was a deal killer for me. I even suspected there was actually a defect with the mouse I got. Apparently, unlike the new Anywhere 3 mouse, you cannot adjust how hard the ratchet notches feel. Also, the new Anywhere 3 doesn't exhibit the rattling/bouncing behavior, although it has the same automatic freewheeling SmartShift feature as the Master 3.Noise: the rattling & bouncing sound of the wheel in ratchet mode was really annoying to me. Maybe there was a defect with the unit I had.I returned the mouse suspecting a defect and ordered the Anywhere 3 model that is perfect.

Picked up this mouse after wanting an upgrade from my MX Anywhere 2S. I liked most everything about this mouse except for the scroll wheel. I was skeptical about all of the reviews pointing out issues with the scroll wheel; however, it really is that bad (for me at least). I tried configuring the scroll wheel to try and get it feeling good to no avail. The input is very inconsistent, especially when trying to make fine movements.It's a shame, I love the mouse otherwise but the scroll wheel makes this mouse unusable for me.  I had to return it and stick with my MX Anywhere 2S.

I loved this mouse for the first year or so... but there were always minor issues, like the functions not working, like side scroll, or the additional buttons. I have Logi Options software, the most recent version, everything the newest, upgraded, and my goodness I finally had to accept reality today and shout out loud, "THIS MOUSE SUCKS!!!!" -- I don't care how awesome it is and how much I love it when it actually works.The problem is more than 50% of the time it only functions as a normal 2 button mouse! And when that happens, I spend so much time trying to fix it, or getting annoyed and having to use my trackpad in addition to this "2 button mouse" in order to do things like scrolling down or side scroll.Seriously, Logitech... get your GD act together. Charge more for a mouse if you have to, but make sure it effing works! I must have spent several hours just trying to troubleshoot this mouth in 2021 alone.

I use the mouse for everyday office tasks -- Word, Excel, mail, etc. -- as well as for more precise & demanding work -- photo post-processing, CAD (multiple platforms), etc.  I's accuracy & speed are excellent & the plug-in charging is very beneficial.  Great product!

DO NOT PURCHASE!Yes it’s amazing! All it’s features are amazing! I agree but a couple month after I’m not sure if it’s the sensor but it’s lagging to a very great extent! It’s completely unusable. Again I’m not sure if it’s the Bluetooth or sensor here but the device just stops working altogether. The computer recognizes it but it just ceases to work!!! Which is fine for a $5 mouse but not for such an expensive essential piece of hardware. So now I have to get a new mouse and I’m paranoid as **** because I have clients waiting for their jobs and what if it happens again. So thanks Logitech for the mental health issues caused by your product! And I’m outside the 30 day warranty so thanks for the terrible investment too.

Sloppy and imprecise. Hard to be quick and accurate with it. Scroll wheel has a delay every time you go to use it. Side scroll wheel only works half the time, if you’re lucky.  Whatever you do, DO NOT install the excel add-in, it has messed up all kinds of things in my excel, most of which corrected when I disabled the addin. The flow software for multiple computers is very buggy.Insane this thing cost me this much money. A $10 mouse works better than this piece of junk.

Mouse moves fast and accurately. Scrolling is effortless. Great for excel work. I'm sure it could be a good gaming mouse, but doesn't seem like it's tailored to that as much as dedicated gaming mouses.

Also, besides feel, I like the feel of the wheel in the friction mode, the silent detents feel right to me. I haven't tried the other functions yet but was writing another review....I went through two Logitech M510s and I like this Logitech much better.

The buttons and wheel feel really smooth. I have been using it now for 4 weeks and still have not had to recharge it.I cannot say anything about gaming as I don`t use it for that. But I understand lots of people use it for flight simulators.
class="cr-original-review-content">Es un rato muy ergonómico, no se descarga fácilmente y es liviano.

I have to say there’s a lot of getting used to this if you’ve used the original model.And it may seem like it’s not comfortable. But as you use it more and more, it’s amazing how you don’t even notice you’re holding it in your hand as it’s very very lightweight.A word of warning, be sure to keep in mind the price as it’s quite expensive.But if money isn’t an issue, I’d highly recommend it
class="cr-original-review-content">Es el mejor mouse que he tenido
Amazing product, click click click and keep clicking. Oh and the scroll wheel…. OMG! No traps needed in this house for this mouse.

on paper it looks goodm but didn't fit my needsi can't stand how the lower polling rate feels, it just feels choppy coming from a 1000hz wired mouseheavy, and just feels clunky to me. Im used to lower sensitivity so i lift my hand a lot while mousing around, and this was awkward for meit does feel good, and well built. love the metal scroll wheels but the thumb one feels gimicky. if i need to pan around excel/cad i usually just use the scroll drag. really wanted to like this mouse but just not for me

By adding the ergonomic bump under your left thumb joint, it bumps your wrist up, at an award angle. I have average hands, and my fingers land on the last 1/4 of the mouse buttons, making them difficult to click. If the ergonomic bump was removed, I think it would be fine.The cursor refresh rate is way to slow, and makes the mouse feel feel heavy and soft, instead of crisp and responsive.I have been looking forward to upgrading to an MX master, and now that I have one, I am incredibly disappointed.

As far as I can tell, the main difference between the MX3 and the MX2s is the scroll wheel. While the machined steel feels much nicer, there's some sort of issue that causes the scroll to momentarily lag on my MacBook, making it unresponsive and frustrating to use.This tradeoff isn't worth the $40 price increase over the MX2s. I returned this and bought the previous generation.

Best Mouse I have ever Owned! I’ve had all Logitech models including ergonomic and none ergonomic… gaming… etc I’ve had magic mouses… Corsair s… none  compare to the great ergonomics of the guy!! Recommend it 100%

After much research I bought the MX Master 3 and after a few months of use I have the following takeaways:PROS:- Wireless and holds charge for at least a week after using 5hr per day AND USB-C!- Sleek and very comfortable/ergonomic. I really appreciate the heavier weight.- Bluetooth connectivity is reliable and switches fast and reliably between Windows, iOS, and Android.- Free spin scrolling feature is addictingly useful. I miss it when using other mice.- The side scroll and forward/back buttons are well placed and usefulCONS:- The mouse keep charge by shutting off when not in use (that's good), but the mouse takes about a second to turn back on when I start to use it again after a pause. The pause is noticeable, but not enough to make me use any other mouse.OF NOTE: I use Bluetooth on my Windows machine and when I accidentally turn off Bluetooth - which I do fairly often - I'm left with no connection to turn it back on (my keyboard is BT too) funny, but noteworthy.

I was sent a heavily used mouse that is not even the correct model. It did not even have a charging cable in the box, really disappointing that you can’t even get new product for the price of this mouse.

Does not have easy switching nor you can configure that in setting. You need to lift the mouse everytime. And when lifting the mouse middle scroll is freely scrolling and causing pages to scroll unwantedly, causing again to switch back that device to adjust the page....happening frequently.
Leaving the above drawback, everything is good, that build quality and features. I love to have this strongly built mouse if it has easy switch option since I work on multiple devices and switch very frequently
Great product!

Very comfortable mouse to use for long periods of time.  Size is just right for me and I really like the fact I can pair it with 3 different devices.  Seems very well made and for the price it should be.  Only time will tell how well it holds up but so far it is a winner.  Battery life seems great and no big deal to recharge when it goes flat.

So, the wheel does have two modes - "free" and "fixed". Fixed feels like a standard scroll wheel, and free allows it to spin easily.The problem is that even when in the "fixed" mode, when you scroll at a moderate speed, it loosens and "switches" to free mode. As in, you suddenly stop feeling any feedback, and your wheel is just spinning without your knowledge.Absolutely unusable for games. I can't believe the wheel is THIS bad when it's apparently the main selling point for this piece of trash.Returned within one day. Never buying from Logitech again.

This mouse is great. Fits nicely in my hand, made of quality materials, and Logitech Flo is amazing. I use this paired with my Logitech keyboard to move between my work laptop and personal computer. It's effortless.

Great for working editing audio or video, but some behaviors like switching the wheel mode or pressing the thumb button doesn't works fine, I think that with these mistakes it is a very expensive product.

Love this mouse! Saved me from a KVM. I can bounce between my desktop and laptop with a simple click. Love the USBC to charge instead of AA batteries. Feels great in my hand and feels very fast. I heard it isn't great for gaming, but i haven't felt any lag so far.
This mouse has a great feel, and features. Very programmable, and excellent battery life, this is a must!

Let me get this straight, this is my second set of MX Master 3 mouse, so I know what I'm talking about. The first one lasted about 1-2 years and then the mouse's bottom sensor just wouldn't do the job. your mouse arrow will just go completely crazy on your screen, there is no "recalibrate" option from the program and it was way past the return date, so I smashed it after it ruined an important project. I decided to give it a second shot since I like the shape/feel of it, but guess what, this one's response is even worse, the sensor went off after one week and I keep having trouble on the lagging/ responding of the mouse. I tested my girlfriend's 12 bucks mouse from staples on the same computer and don't have any problem...... Now it's past the return date again and I'm stuck with it!

A lot of money for a mouse but it is worth it.  High quality comfortable and configurable.  The floating wheel technology for scrolling is amazing. I’m not a gamer, use this for mostly Microsoft office work and it is great.

Bought this mouse to use it with DaVinci Resolve on my MacBook Air M1, and it's just fantastic.
Horizontal scroll is a breeze, and pairing was really easy. It also comes pre-configured for most used apps as Final Cut Pro, Photoshop, Lightroom, Safari and Office 365.Only con is the lack of information on the box. You have to download Logitech Logi Options software in order to make full use of the mouse capabilities, but that I learned after some browsing, it wasn't stated on the box nor anywhere.
she using for programming stuff, and it's really awesome.
Very acurate. I can not use the tablet for sime reason it dies not work. I needed simething accurate to work on editing my pictures. This is the mouse you need....
Excellent ergonomics. Nice customization options. Only complaint - customized options sometimes don't function.

It's such a shame that this mouse falls short in exactly the function I needed it for. I've been using the apple Magic Mouse for years but mine finally packed in. It seems there are not a lot of mice out there that have a decent horizontal scroll option, something necessary for any video or music production software. The Magic Mouse does it very smoothly, you just scroll left and right with your finger and it is precise. The MX master 3 has a thumbwheel that doesn't even register half the time and when it does it is anything but precise, it skips around and by the time I've found my place on the timeline again I may as well have not bothered using the thumbwheel. It is very disappointing considering the price of this mouse, especially since the rest of the functions are really great. It's a shame that the thumbwheel seems to have been added just as a gimmick.
Refer to the review by JK: "1.0 out of 5 stars Worst Mouse I've Ever Owned in 35 Years of Using Mice" (Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020).I don't have much else to add.

I love this mouse. I use this on my video editing pc and I love it. The side scroll is awesome. Being able to configure the buttons for different applications it a huge plus. Anyone that has davinci resolve know that it tends to crash if you haven't saved in awhile. So having the button configured to save I made it a habit to just click it after every change I make. The only knock I have is that if you are using on a computer without the dongle it can be sporadic.
Awesome mouse!  Scrolls super fast and battery seems to last forever between charges.

I have 3 different computers and once paired with all of them I was able to use it with any of those in an instant with the button. Battery life is phenomenal, I have been using it for several months now and I charged maybe 2-3 times so far and when I do its done in an hour or 2 so its not noticeable at all. The buttons and clicks also just sound and feel quality especially the scroll wheel. Totally worth the price!

This mouse has some nice bells and whistles. It fits nicely into my hand. It has additional buttons for convenience. Logitech has even created profiles for different applications where different buttons map to different applications with a per-application configuration. It's nice that it can use either Bluetooth or USB. It has a rechargeable battery built-in, so no more buying batteries. And, it can be turned off to preserve the battery charge. The left mouse button can be too sensitive. What's really missing is the ability to create my own per application profile or settings that Logitech didn't provide (or at least I haven't found a way of doing it yet). What I really find irksome is the scroll amount associated with the scroll wheel. It scrolls too much for a small amount of wheel movement. Especially in small windows and dialogs boxes. I have to actually move the mouse and use the scroll bar which defeats the purpose of having a scroll wheel in the first place. The poor scroll behavior really makes me miss my MSFT Arc Touch mouse. Quite surprisingly, Logitech hasn't provided a setting for configuring how many lines to scroll for each scroll-wheel ratchet notch. This setting is available on the Arc Touch mouse. Neither does the scroll amount adjust with the speed of the scroll wheel. It should scroll less when spinning the scroll wheel slowly and scroll more when the wheel is spun faster. It has a fixed scroll amount regardless of how fast/slow you spin the wheel which is also annoying when I want to scroll large amounts and am trying to spin the wheel fast. Hopefully, Logitech would fix that.
Working flawlesslyStill holds up well after 1 year

obviously the killer feature on the mx mater 3 is the magnetic scroll wheel--buttery smooth infinite scrolling (with option to toggle to ratcheted)---it is just awesome! also, the battery life is insane!sadly, just about everything else on the mouse is terrible:--side buttons are flat and stiff, nearly impossible to find or click quickly & consistently;--with the long battery life comes a mouse that feels like you're dragging a brick around after a few hours of work; the weight issue became unbearable for me and I just had to switch to something else
Very happy with it. As a student it’s almost overkill in some aspects, but works beautiful for excel, using multiple windows, and just long study sessions. I love it.

the most stupidest design I ever seen, I have to turn flip the mouse everytime to change the desktops.turn the mouse upside down click to button to goto the next screen.and you cannot assign that button to a different button or shortcut key.they suggest you to install a software etc for this feature, but my laptops are in different netowork.so i stuck with mouse flipping.

class="cr-original-review-content">Este mouse es bastante cómodo y con funciones acertadas para trabajos recurrentes y de precisión. Adicional con el respaldo de esta excelente marca de la cual tengo muchos dispositivos.

The texture on this mouse is great, ergonomics fit my hands well - I no longer have pain in my wrists, the mouse wheel can be configured to be a free-wheel or tactile feedback with a notched wheel feel. The other buttons are handy, especially the horizontal scroll wheel.

This mouse is amazing. I probably use less than 20% of the functions available and would have gotten away with a cheaper model in the $50 range.  If you have the cash (or budget), then I highly recommend it.
Works great for me as a power user. Many programmable and configurable features most single computer users won’t exploit.

A year later and I still love this mouse. I haven't come across a single issue I can complain about. I use it for more than 8 hours a day. I've gone for a few months without charging. Battery life is nothing you'll have to worry about with this product. Works on most surfaces except clear glass due to the technology. The mouse is activated by covering the laser to create darkness.

I am disappointed with the Linux compatibility. The compatibility is only for the basic mouse features. At least make a Logitech Options app for Ubuntu. The features that make this a premium mouse are not available so I ended up returning the mouse. My pinky also went numb after several hours of use.

I can’t emphasize enough the importance of a good mouse.  I had an Apple Magic Mouse and HATED it.  The MX Master 3 is worth it.  I have had it for half a day now and will use it for my Windows laptop and my Macbook Pro.  It is so easy to switch between devices.  Just a great mouse.  Friggin perfect
Game changer. Use in DAW.

Giving 1 star because I received a used mouse. There is a scratch on the body top and signs of use at the bottom (see pictures). I don't know if this is Amazon's or Logitech's fault, but this is unacceptable.
An excellent non-vertical mouse. It did not provide relief of my wrist pain as vertical mice have. If wrist pain relief is your goal - try vertical mice.

After reading a multitude of reviews and a dozen or so YouTube videos, I decided to pull the plug on the new MX 3. The MX Keyboard is a staple in my Mac based studio where my private world revolves around graphic art, writing, and music composition, and my professional world around software engineering. I spend 90% of my day with my hands on some form of controller. I have enjoyed many Logitech devices over the years but this is my first foray into their higher end devices preferring Apple's magic trackpads in the past.
To begin with, all the reviews are spot on concerning the MX 3, it is an amazing device.. however, the ergonomics did not fit my Medium hands. As a pianist and guitarist my hands have an abnormal amount of reach compared to many but my index finger just could not fully reach, cover, or comfortably operate the MX3's main scrolling wheel. In short, the height of the palming area of the mouse is too high for me.Yes, the MX3's all steel wheel and magnetic feedback are better than the 2S, but aside from the heftier weight, I preferred the position of the main scrolling wheel as well as all the buttons on the 2S including the placement and composition of the thumb scroll. I chose to disengage the ratcheting feedback on the 2S and personally love it.Ergonomically the 2S is far better for my particular hands. The 2S is slightly shorter in height and slightly wider in width. My farthest right 2 fingers have more to rest and hold onto compared to the MX3, and strangely I also found the bottom left button and left buttons alongside the horizontal thumb scroll wheel were better placed for my needs. The MX3's approach of the left "fwd"/"bwd" buttons are a better concept but their placement was just not correct for me.Although this review is as much about the MX2S as for the MX3, I had a hard time finding many reviews covering both. Hope this helps someone.I also purchased the new Anywhere 3 and also love it.. in fact I may find that I actually prefer it, time will tell :D.
Very worth the refund and upgrade to the 3. Feels so much better on the hand than the awkward position on the prev model.

I replaced my VicTsing Full Size Wireless Mouse with this Logitech MX Master 3 and I'm glad I did. The VicTsing Mouse had issues only after a couple months of owning it. The scroll wheel stopped working. It would start to scroll down on a page, stop, and then page back up where I was originally at. I thought it was an OS issue but it was the mouse because this Logitech Mouse has no issues scrolling. Also, the VicTsing mouse started to have issues with the left click button. It used to have a nice crisp "click" sound but started to have a dull and hollow "click" sound. The VicTsing mouse was inexpensive but a complete waste of money.I read very good reviews about the Logitech MX Master Mouse and I'm very glad I got it. The things I love about this mouse are:• Functions like a corded mouse! There is no lag at all.• The ergonomics feels great with my hand. I work 8 hours a day using this mouse and it feels very comfortable. I  have big hands and it fits really well.• The scroll wheel works great and it feels very sturdy.• The battery life seems like it will be very good and I really like how it charges with a USB-C cable.• There is no need to turn this mouse off.  It will go in sleep mode after it has not been in use for a while and  when you move it for the first time, the battery LED indicator will light up for a few seconds. Mine lights up  green so I assume that means it still has a full charge. I haven't had the mouse long enough to know if the LED  indicator lights up a different color when it's time to charge it.

If this mouse would keep the connection via Bluetooth, it would easily earn five stars. However, it does not. I don't know why this mouse loses its connection with Bluetooth using PC Windows10 or Apple computers, but the dongle works great with Windows10 computers.
Bought as a gift and he loves it!!
I had the logi mx anywhere 2 before upgrading to this one. First full size mouse and i love it. never going back to any other mouse

This mouse is simply amazing.. For anyone who multi tasks I don't think there is a more customizable mouse on the market.  When you download the software you can customize everything button, rollers and the software interface is easy to program and esthetically pleasing.  There's literally hundreds of ways to customize all the functions fir any type of user.I'm not a gamer but I presume this has to be one of if not the most customizable pieces of hardware on the market with the exception of a joy stick.  For an office user who uses multiple spread sheets, word documents and publishing software and needs to multi task between all of your work this mouse will do everything you could possibly need and more.As for me, I don't use very much of this mouses potential at all. The reason I purchased it was because it looked really cool and seemed to be well built so coming from a consumer who doesn't mind spending a little more and making a big splash, I am extremely impressed.  It is extremely well built and feels very solid when in use. It's ergonomically perfect and extremely comfortable to continuous hourly use. It can be used with the USB dongle or with blue tooth if you need to free up a USB port. The battery life seems to last forever. I've been using it for over a month and I'm at 99% of battery life.  In the unlikely event your battery goes dead you can plug the charge cord into a USB port. Bottom line, if you don't mind spending a little more on of the most programmable mouse on the market weather you're a full out gamer, a 10K office working or code writer or just someone who wants a totally cool, bullet proof, comfortable cool looking mouse, this is for you.  If it fits any of these parameters you can't go wrong.
There are programmable buttons that made it easy for everyday use.
Awesome product

I tried this on the Mac. I am currently using a MX518 and thought that the MX Master 3 would be a better productivity alternative to the MX518. I was wrong. There is no way to turn off the mouse acceleration which leads me to a lot of miss clicks. The scroll wheel would sometimes ignore scrolling if you scroll too slow, but if you set the scroll faster, it scrolls too fast. The thumb buttons are harder to reach, feels sharp, and too small. The palm button is far out of reach. The size of the mouse is somewhat smaller and much heavier than my MX518. It does not cover my whole palm if I use a wrist pad and partially covers my palm if I don't use a wrist pad. Mac installation is not straight forward. It requires you to enable security on apps that I couldn't search for. I only gave it 2-star because of the build quality.

I've been using travel mice for many years, so this giant isn't too comfy for my hands.  But I got it to avoid the cheap mice's failing wheels and buttons.This one seems to hold up, and I LOVE the programmability, and the thumb wheel is very useful for size scrolling, or resizing a webpage on the fly.Recommended.

Perfect productivity mouse, just purchased this mouse a couple days ago and it’s been the best mouse I’ve ever gotten. It has intuitive features that lets you do more than just what a typical mouse does. I greatly would recommend for productivity uses.

I have been skeptical about spending so much money in such an item like this.100 bucks for a mouse!But you really get what you pay for. The quality and the hot keys the mouse comes with are really really appealing.
100 dollor level mouse can not do well in roller. bad experience.1. slowly go up and quickly go down in same roller distance.2. mid roller loose3. drop frame sometimes.4. heavy

I want to like this mouse, in every way it seems great. It feels nice, has nice features, but the one thing that dropped my stars is that I spent the entire time putting up with laggy, skippy, jumpy cursor.I've changed software and updated many times since I purchased. Tried removing software. Moved my dongle to half a dozen locations around my desk, different ports, the list goes on. Advanced tweaks in the Device Manager (Windows 10).Nothing seems to fix this mouse, the cursor jumping around sporadically sometimes. Obviously it will do it during higher CPU operations like first opening a large web page, or opening an app, etc. But these jitters usually only last a couple seconds for the thing to open. However, other times I'm not doing much, just typing, writing code, reading a page. It will get jittery and just keep doing it, skipping across the screen, making me click the wrong things, making it hard to center on a link, etc.I'm done fighting with it. I connected my older M705 Marathon Mouse until I can find a solution. At least to my memory, I didn't have this kind of issue with my Marathon, I've used it like 5 years straight.I'm not trying to bag on Logitech, since the Marathon is also theirs, and my G915 wireless keyboard.A bunch of YouTubers seems like the G915 and MX Master 3 combo but it certainly didn't work for me, I'm out of options.If Logitech has an answer to this, I'm all ears, or if they can patch drivers or whatever it takes to make the wireless more solid, I'll wait. I can't return it now, so I'll hang on and hope for the best.Maybe others have a solution and I'll change my tune if it works!
After carpal tunnel surgery this is the most comfortable mouse I've ever used!
This thing is amazing. Best mouse I’ve used. I haven’t tried it for any gaming, but for office work it’s phenomenal.

As you can see, pic, I am testing several mouse to get a good fit for prolonged periods of photo editing and creating life-videos. the Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless Mouse is very comfortable - after a few house of use, my hand is not as fatigued as using the "Logitech Wireless Anywhere Mouse MX for PC and Mac", which is not a bad mouse, just a bit small for med/large hands for prolonged periods.I can with confident recommend the Master3 Advanced mouse. Check it out at several YouTube vids to gain more insight.I just got it a few days ago; and will continue to put it through my digital paces and update this review if necessary.
Awesome mouse

So far this mouse works fine but I have for few weeks only. I can easily switch control between 3 devices which I use simultaneously (yes, I have 3 computers I work with all the time).My year-old m720 triathlon stopped working after a year. So I bought this one as its replacement. I will see how long this one will work.

This mouse is great. It's comfortable, ergonomic, and high quality. It's huge, so if you have small hands it may not be for you. The software for device switching is easy to use and seemless. Very satisfied.

Secure copy paste between different PCs!nothing to dislike,30+ years of using  different keyboards, mice.For work this is a great mouse. / keyboard check out the matching keyboard.for gaming i like a different type.

Background - I purchased this mouse early in my freshman year of college. Prior to that, I was using an older Logitech M310 mouse. However, it started to become unreliable, so I started to search for a replacement. In searching for a mouse, I desired an ergonomic, bluetooth mouse with a horizontal scrollwheel. This happened to be the only option on the market that fit those requirements. I was not disappointed with the purchase.Wheel - The primary wheel has been even more useful than I anticipated. I did not realize how much time I spent scrolling until I started using this mouse. The horizontal wheel has also been a revelation in my computer usage. In using Microsoft OneNote, I can use that wheel in tandem with the regular wheel for 2 axis scrolling. Meanwhile, if I have Spotify or Chrome open, I can use the horizontal wheel to control audio volume. Having this extra utility has been very convenient.Sensor - Additionally, its sensor is fantastic. It is very accurate, and with adjustable DPI settings, can be adjusted to your preferences. I have not used it on glass, but have successfully used it on some surfaces other mice would not track on (such as fabric or carpet).Software - My only complaint is that the software Logitech provides can be occasionally finnicky, althought it is generally reliable. The primary issues occur if you have the mouse on for a long time (say, 8 hours), as it seems to forget the customized actions I have set for certain buttons in certain applications. That said, a simple turning off and back on of the mouse rectifies any issues. I have not tried its multidevice capabilities, so I canot speak to that.Battery - The battery has been wonderful. This is my first rechargeable mouse, and it has proven to be remarkable. I have charged it probably 3 or 4 times total after using it for hours per day for 7 months straight, and has provided me with warnings each time it needed charging.Ergonomics - This mouse's ergonomics are fantastic. Prior to purchasing this, my wrist hurt after using my computer for more than 2or 3 hours. Now, I hae used my laptop for periods of 10 or more hours with no wrist fatigue. Conincidentally, the ergonomics also make the mouse visually unique. I have gotten numerous compliments on this mouse by my peers.Summary - Overall, this mouse is easily one of my favorite pieces of technology. If you are looking for a gaming mouse, you may want to look elsewhere. If you are an engineer using CAD all the time, you may want to look at the 3dConnexion CadMouse. However, if you are looking for a very high quality mouse for general computer work and productivity, this is a fantastic option, if not the best.

In order to switch over to another computer using this mouse you must turn the mouse over and press the corresponding number associated with the computer. The problem - I move between computers quickly. Because of this,  I am constantly turning the mouse over and it requires 2 hands. This creates a lot of wasted time. I cannot imagine why Logitech would not place the change button on top. I no longer use the mouse. Expensive lesson for me. Frustrating.

I'm not a computer expert, nor a gamer, but I use one quite a bit. I wasn't looking for a new mouse, I was totally satisfied with my basic wireless Logitech. I watch a lot of online technology videos and just about all of them kept raving about the new MX3 wireless mouse. I decided to give it a try and I'm really  liking it so far. Since I was already familiar with Logitech products, setup was a breeze (just download the Logitech options software). This mouse is already configured by default to run just about any app that's designed for it. You can also change the defaults to personalize the mouse, which I've already done, to your liking. Ergonomically, it fits my hands to a tee and the scroll wheels are AWESOME ! It's not cheap ($99) but it has almost limitless potential and I feel like I'm only beginning to scratch the surface.Very satisfied !
Good mouse for productivity.

I have had this mouse for about a year now.The brilliant: horizontal scroll and the regular scroll. I work with many large documents and medical "images" that I have to scroll through. Being able to basically scroll through without having to make that same repetitive motion helps save my fingers from becoming fatigued (it's also quite and quite satisfyingly smooth). The "flow" feature to switch between multiple monitors/computers with a single mouse is really brilliant. If you have a use case for it, you'll enjoy it and it's easier to set up than the software/network version I was using before.The good: it is sensitive and precise. It allows for subtle movements well and does not jump around. The battery life is perfectly adequate for my needs, I charge it every now and then when the light indicates. The size seems fine for me, not too large, not too small. I have slightly above average hand size for a man. Bluetooth set up is a breeze.The OK: the back and forward buttons are positioned a tad too high to be comfortably used. I have to tilt my whole hand up in order to reach. For someone using a mouse 10-12+ hours a day, those kind of movements are not comfortable.The not great: the button for the thumb rest platform is too small of a target and positioned too far back to easily click. It requires a kind of "rolling" maneuver to hit it with my thumb "knuckle". I essentially do not use any of the buttons on this mouse for these reasons. I also wish it had better mapping options.The unknown: I do not game so can't speak to its value for that. Its durability seems fine for the past year, but no idea if it holds up well going forward.Overall: 5/5 for me. It's too good at the things I really care about to knock it down to 4 stars. I enjoy using this and even if it lacked the buttons entirely, I'd still be very happy with this mouse, so I just pretend they aren't there. They don't get in the way and I never accidentally click them.

Feels like the lexus of computer mice. It feels incredible in my hand, very comfortable and nice. Buttons are reprogrammable and the wheel is very cool, love the option to switch modes.One flaw, and this is a big one for me: I work in Autodesk Maya and I frequently use the middle mouse button to drag things around in the viewport/graph editor. Using the middle mouse feels a bit stiff and takes a lot more effort, as compared to my cheap old walmart mouse. However I reprogrammed one of the thumb buttons to be the middle mouse button and it's a lot more manageable. I wont dock a star for this because I know most people wont have to deal with this and it is an excellent mouse.

I had to replace my Logitech Performance MX mouse after many years of reliable service and the MX Master 3 looked like the best choice for me. I'm not a gamer and spend most of my time in spreadsheets. For me, it' was definitely the right choice. I've had it for a few months now and have only charged it once. It feels very comfortable and the buttons are all placed conveniently. I'm very pleased with it.and would highly recommend it..

I have never spent this much money for a mouse, but I am so glad I pulled the trigger. I was experiencing a lot of wrist fatigue and this mouse has completely alleviated that problem. I have not yet learned all the functions so can't speak to that. It was worth the price and the battery goes a long time before needing a charge. I noticed some reviews talked about problems with dropping Bluetooth connection, I have not had that problem.
Great product.Working very well.

My home work space consists of my 32" Samsung UHD curved monitor, 16" MacBook Pro, and company issued Dell Latitude 7390. I use an HDMI switch between the computers and monitor since I usually don't use my laptop until after work. I was using a Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse, but I had to remove the IR receiver and place it into whichever laptop I was using. This lead me to search for a bluetooth solution and I came across the MX Keys and MX Master 3. The setup was simple. One can link up to 3 computers. My MacBook Pro is linked as #1, Boot Camp running Windows 10 on the MacBook is #2, and my work laptop is #3. Now, when I want to transition from my work laptop to my personal one, I select the number on the keyboard and mouse and tap the HDMI switch and I'm done. My workspace is simple and efficient. it was well worth the investment for me since it simplifies my productivity.

Another great mouse from Logitech. This mouse is comfortable and easy to use. The USB-C charging makes it easy to keep charged up and the battery life is fantastic. There are so many way to customize the various buttons through the app and it is compatible with just about any device.

class="cr-original-review-content">Es un muy buen dispositivo. La batería dura bastante, no he tenido problemas en cuanto a la conexión por Bluetooth. Sus botones extras se hacen muy utiles al momento de navegar por algún sitio o documentos. Puedes usarlo en casi cualquier superficie. Y a diferencia de otros mouses puedes cargarlo mientras lo usas. En definitiva una muy buena compra.
Absolutely the single greatest mouse I have ever used! I love that I can use it on up to three devices with the push of a button!

Well constructed and feels good in the hand. I'm pleased with the side buttons, but the scroll wheel will, annoyingly, switch to free rolling if you scroll fast enough, even in ratcheted mode.Purchased this mouse primarily because of its advertised ability to switch seamlessly between multiple connected devices. This is an absolute lie. The button to switch between devices is on the bottom of the mouse, meaning in order to switch between connected devices, you have to stop what you're doing and flip the thing over to access the button. I'm baffled that this design made it past the earliest stages of product development.
This is a great Mouse. You can customize all the buttons, works via BT and USB. The only caveat for me, is that the mouse is a little bit heavy

While this mouse is very nice and great for ergonomics with a lot of features, Logitech still has not been able to overcome the bluetooth connectivity issues they have had for most all their mice. I had the same issue with the MX2. Hence the 3 star rating.First day out of the package it paired and worked great. The next morning, the mouse sporadically connected and disconnected from bluetooth. My PC showed as paired but flickered back-and-forth to connected. Turned the mouse off and back on, unpaired and repaired and still no joy. Software is updated but no cure there either. For a $100 mouse you would think they would have things worked out. I can only use it with the included dongle. If you don't mind not being able to rely on the bluetooth feature then this is a great mouse.
This should of been done a loooong time ago. The ability to use the same mouse for multiple PC’s with such ease is very nice.

This mouse has terrible connection issues. The movement is very jittery even when using the included receiver and when it's less than 1 meter away. This seems to be a common issue, not with mine only. I have no idea why it got rave reviews everywhere you look. The ergonomics are also bad, but that's subjective. Only good thing about it is the battery life, it lasts weeks without charge.
Just check out the real reviews. In my opinion this is the best everyday work mouse. Ergonomic and precise. Bluetooth connectivity to Windows 10 was trivially easy.
The best mouse i have ever use!

Product description says full charge lasts up-to 70 days, but in my experience it was more like 25-30 days. It's not a big deal for me personally (as it charges to full in like an hour or two and is still fully usable while wired) and is pretty much the only "complain" I have (and even then, only b/c it doesn't match the product description). It's very ergonomic / comfortable to use. I use it with Linux and it works very well (using logiops and/or solaar tools you can configure sensitivity, scroll wheel resolution and all the extra buttons as needed + monitor battery status, etc).

This mouse is fantastic, but I had to dock a star.  The issue is the right mouse button.  It is way too easy to accidentally click the right button while using this mouse.  I use a fingertip-style grip, sometimes switching to a claw grip.  I have fewer issues with a claw grip, but fingertip and palm grippers beware.  Style a fantastic mouse, but expect that you will accidentally hit the right mouse button.  The button travel is very low and the way the mouse is set up pushes your hand to lean on that side.
3 in 1 worth the money.  I have three devices connected and can switch easily between them.  Love it. Ergonomic design is wonderful and very comfortable on hands.  Highly recommended!

This is a great mouse, quality and functional. It's paired with an MX Keys KB and pairs easily with other computers. I have and am experiencing some lag issues, skipping etc but I don't think it's the mouse's fault, believe it's an issue with an 8 year old Dell desktop. I'm working through it, messing with programs that may interfere and it DOES seem to be helping...but it's an awesome mouse. Pairing with Photoshop, Audacity etc is a breeze. I haven't used this to game on though, can't say how that'll work out. I've always had great luck with Logitech and Logitech G products. I know some haven't but...I've never had an issue. I also have a Logitech Trackball Ergo, a Logitech G502 and they perform like a champ, every day. I can't help but recommend....completely.

When plugging in the mouse to charge nothing happens, mouse is dead, no batteries to replace. I have owned 20$ mice and 100$+ mice, and never in my life has a mouse died. This is the first mouse that i've ever had die on me in 30 years, and it died in less than 2 months. Back to using my previous mouse -- G9X, which has lasted 10+ years.

Eztremely happy. I uograded from a $30 mouse and the difference is huge. It feels better overall, it has rxtra buttons that click the way you need and most important its signficantly more accurate than my “jelly comb” mouse.The scroll wheel, improved design, and usb-c make it worth the extra few dollars compared to the old version
I am a software developer, this mouse is awesome for coding. Mouse wheel goes into free spinning mode, you can scroll through source code very quick.

I bought this one and got to know there is a different one for Mac. I am a Mac user. Do I have to return this and get a Mac one or this will also work? However, I am having features issues with the device.1. Bluetooth connect. Device works like a normal mouse with lag on scrolling. Logi Options cannot detect a device.2. Used dongle to connect and Logi Options did connect the device but the lag is still the same.Please advise.
I purchased this mouse to use with MacOS. It has great shortcuts and the software for the mouse is initiative and easy to install. My productivity has greatly increased using this mouse.

I work on two systems ( Mac and Windows ) due to my work and the transition they provide is amazing and  it goes well with the Logitech MX keyboard, the transition is smooth, the material is durable and very comfortable.

Switching between devices simply does not work. I've installed all of Logitech's software, the latest versions of drivers software, etc. etc., and if after a couple hours paired with one device, it's impossible to switch back. Logitech offers only two solutions (clear out and reset all your bluetooth settings—doesn't work); and use their supplied dongle, which frankly is ridiculous. Basically, you're spending a hundred bucks to get a lateral scroll wheel. Cool. If I could return this piece of junk, I would.

To note: this mouse is smaller than the MxMaster 2s, so those with freakishly large hands (or just larger than average) may want to steer clear. That said, I found it very ergonomic to use, and the side buttons are positioned much more sensibly now.

I get it, this mouse is expensive.  However it lasts over 2 weeks without being charged, feels great, is super smooth and looks professional.  The software is easy to use, and I do not have the scroll wheel issue others talk about.  This mouse is almost perfect, almost!  If the multi-device switch was easier to access it would be amazing.  The other issue is that the click is very loud.

Absolutely fabulous mouse. Vastly less stressful work with this than a conventional mouse. Your palms wraps around well and sits comfortably.The price is a bit steep, yes. But if you work a lot on a computer and can afford to spend a few extra bucks, I'd totally recommend it.
