Pros: easy to use. Both of the receiver and Bluetooth connections work very well. The scrolling on both direction are smooth.Cons: the size is kinda tiny for me. The weight is a little too light to me. The sensitivity gets effected when the mouse pad’s color is not pure white/black.
it broke after 5 months of use. dont buy. (I didn't drop it or damaged it at all)

I'm most certainly the target demographic for this mouse. My gaming desktop is windows 10 (of course), and I have a MacBook I use for work. I often find myself switching back and forth with very little effort. This thing can even pair to my phone! (though I find that the MX Keys keyboard is far more relevant for phone use).I've bought 5+ Razer mice and roughly 3+ Logitech mice (mice designed for FPS, MMO, etc..), this by far and away has the best grip/feel to it. The additional buttons are well placed, easy to rebind, and are completely sufficient for all my gaming related key-mappings. For work (software engineer), I find the gesture pad highly useful for swapping screens on my MacBook + additional monitors. I actually get a lot of use out of the side scroll wheel as well.Stop thinking about it, just buy it. You won't regret it.

The sole purpose of spending many dollars on the MX keys and Mouse was for the easy-switch.  Even with Flow, it does not work well.  I expected better from Logitech!  First, my mouse is not following easy-switch, second, using flow going from y stream book to Mac the Keyboard does not follow. Next the design of putting the switch button on the bottom of the mouse is a horrible idea!  At least if you are going to use software for functions, give me the option to set Duo fn to switch!Now lets just talk about flow and options.  I have a work computer that I am not allowed to installed software on.  So even if flow worked as expected I can not use for my work notebook.  Going from work notebook to mac is 98% of the switching I do.  Logitech, it would have been so much easier to have the mouse pair with keyboard and keyboard and mouse pair with computer.  Even if you have to pair both with a computer, have the keyboard "EASY-switch" tell the mouse to follow.   I really thought I could at least get flow and easy switch to work from my steam book and mac, but that has been fruitless as well.   Now I have wasted so much time trying to get this all to work together, I am unable to return it all.  I will be posting this as a review on Amazon.

I use it for work and the mouse shape is great. The middle scroll wheel is super fast and spins forever. Really comfortable. Super responsive and the battery lasts forever. I have not used it for gaming though. I would think you would find another mouse for that. No complaints.
Easy to configure and comfortable for long periods of time!

Excellent update to the original MX Master.  Gentle contours, excellent battery life, 3 different systems that it can be paired with, and overall a hugely pleasant experience for a business/creative oriented mouse.  Highly recommend.

I heard many good reviews about this mouse so I thought I should give it a try. I cannot comment on gaming or battery life because I don’t play game and I try it only a few minutes. This is my issues.
1) This is not ergonomic for me at all. I started hurt my arm and shoulder after I tried around 15 minutes. The arc is too high and the mouse is too big for my hand. If I place my hand to easily reach vertical scroll wheel, I cannot reach the thumb button easily because it’s too far.2) I am not a fan of the horizontal scroll wheel on the side. I wish to have horizontal scroll wheel at the same as vertical scroll wheel.3) Although you can set the button for each program you work, you cannot set “Paste Value only” for other programs rather than in Excel. You also cannot set a keystroke macro for this mouse to set “Paste Value”.4) Last but important is that the serial number on the bottom of the mouse and on the box is different. Also, it’s different than the serial number I saw on “My Order” page. So, I am concerned about the authenticity of the product.I want to like it so much but I think I need to return this mouse. Hope I will get a refund.
Bought this to replace an old ergonomic mouse and was very pleasantly surprised. Looks goofy but fits and works well.

Okay, first, I have big hands. So while this is probably perfect for someone with normal hands, I find it to be just a little on the small/light side for my tastes - My Logitech PerformanceMX mouse is a little bigger/heavier. With that said, the MX3 is currently my go-to mouse for long days, for two reasons: it partners well with my MX Keys keyboard and the tiny USB-A Unify dongles allow this mouse (and the keyboard) to easily be shared across the computers on my desk with a button press on the bottom of the mouse and on the keyboard, eliminating the need for multiple keyboards.Unify also allows the mouse/keyboard to automatically "flow" from one screen to another, if the computers are on the same network (sorry, if one of the computers is running a VPN, this will probably NOT work).Overall, very happy with this mouse.
nice design

This mouse is everything i hoped it would be. The functionality and customization is unlike any other mouse I've used. It feels high quality and is incredibly comfortable. I have medium - medium/large hands and this mouse fits my hand incredibly. I think this mouse is capable of fitting any sized hand. It literally feels like an extension of my hand, and works flawlessly.
Better thn the mx master 2 in every way. Better button design, ergonomic .

Why no Linux software?Overall I like it. Scroll wheel is too far forward, but other buttons are placed well. Much larger than every other mouse I have tried, this is a good thing. I can actually rest my hand on the mouse and use it. Smaller mouses require me to arch my hand, which becomes uncomfortable.Scrolling is not great. This may be due to the smart scroll feature? Have only used on Linux so far and there is no software for it. I am hoping on my Windows work machine, installing the software will make a positive difference.
Pretty much connect to bluetooth and it works. I didn't install any extra software. Much more ergonomic than the apple magic mouse or trackpads.

I bought it for its free-wheeling wheel, which I like. But I was disappointed that there's no provisions for creating customizable programmed buttons, you can only choose from the setups that they pre-programmed for only a few applications. I also wish there was a button to adjust the mouse's tracking resolution. I've experienced no dropouts or lag in operation. Can't comment on gaming or battery life.

I use M1 Mac, have been using Magic Mouse 2. I love the design of Mx3, I also have the MX Keyes ( which I highly recommend the keyboared). However, the mouse, not so much for Mac. Although it connected using the dongle and bluetooth, and sometimes it would seem it is ok, when tasted how smooth it is against the Magic Mouse 2, it doesn't stand a chance. The only thing that it beats the Magic Mouse 2 within the Mac world is the Ergonomic, it fits good on the hand...especially big hands. anyway, I had to return it, unfortunately I'll have to stick with the Magic Mouse 2 for now...maybe next one...

I have terrible carpal tunnel and I use an Imak glove to offset nerve pain.I have tried various "ergonomic" mice that are vertical, and it's just too much of a change to get used to that I eventually just go back to the classic mouse.This mouse has nailed it. It has a slight tilt to it which offsets your hand just enough to relieve the pressure. The thumb rest is perfect and allows you to comfortably maneuver the mouse.Clicks are very tactile and nice and has a nice premium feel to it.Well done Logitech! Finally, a mouse I can use comfortably!!!

I picked this up in part because I needed something better for general use while on my laptop, it was a bonus that it is designed with designers and artists in mind and even has special profiles for Photoshop and Premiere, which is what I use my laptop for most days.It also helps that it has a good feel and has enough buttons for general gaming if I want. It has excellent battery life and the flow function is great when transferring files from my laptop to my big desktop at home and vice versa.

I really really wanted to love this mouse. I'd read so many positive reviews on it. It did have some negative reviews on the scroll wheel. It is a known issue, there a plenty of forums on it but, I wanted to give it a shot. Sadly as much as I loved all the convenient features on it like the software, the customization with the function buttons, and the ergonomics of it. In the end the scroll wheel was what did it for me. I used for two days and just couldn't stand it. Especially using it for work were I had to scroll though pages of information. I noticed a drastic difference on how the scroll wheel works for my Dell work computer VS my Mac. It works better on the Mac but, still has some issues.  I tried adjusting the settings in the Logitech software app but nothing was working for me. In theory the MagSpeed feature is great, but this is what hinders me from giving this a 5 star review. Not to mention the premium price tag on it, you'd think Logitech would have everything figured out perfectly on it. Which is why I give this a 3 star review. If you work on older software for hours at a time this mouse might not be for you.

Using it about a week. Comfortable enough but does not work on all surfaces. Using it on my roll-top desktop, almost ready to go back to my old corded mouse just because it has a ball. May have to replace it. Tried it on a legal pad; works sometimes.2 months in:  this piece of crap will barely work.  Very particular about the surface used on.  Bells and whistles, but I just need something that works.  And this ain't it.
I love how my hand and thumb rest on the mouse. Extremely smooth. Best work mouse I’ve bought to date. Horizontal scroll wheel is a game changer.
I had given up on wireless mouses but, a friend of mine bought me this one and I MUST say...It is AWESOME!!! Definitely recommend this one for all mouse lovers out there.

This is a great little mouse. Looks great, very comfortable, I'm happy with the battery life and how quickly it charges. Love the type C port, love that you can unlock the scroll wheel and let it free spin. It's nice that the wheel has some weight to it as well. If you're a developer this thing is great for quickly navigating long blocks of code. It also worked immediately on 20.04 Linux Mint.My one complaint is the texture on the buttons and on the palm grip area are absolute magnets for dirt. I like to think I wash my hands really well, but this thing makes me second guess that. The ridges on the wheel also pick up a lot of dirt. It's a small complaint, but it is the only one I have.

- The shape/design is comfortable to the hands- Good weight and sturdy- Works well in many different surfaces including glass- Long battery lifeAs someone who has a mac for personal use and a windows-OS laptop for work, this is definitely the best mouse for both!
liked it

I will use it for all purpose especially for work.  The MX Master 3 is comfort, large size, high-quality and responsive buttons and wheels, and able to configure them for different Apps.  It has two short-comings, IMHO.  (1) It is higher than my old mouse so the wrist has to bend more.  Need a wrist-rest to be comfortable for long-time use.  (2) It does not have support for the 4th and 5th fingers to rest on.  My old mouse have places to rest 1st, 4th, and 5th fingers.  It is really comfortable when I have to use mouse for a day-long time.  As shown in the photo, I made a pinky-finger rest for my new MX Master 3 to prevent the fingers from rubbing the desktop when moving the mouse.  It was made with package tape and a piece of the black slippery sticky paper peered off from the bottom of the new mouse.UPDATE 3/29/21: it's heigher than normal mouse and I can not find a comfort way to hold it.  After have used for a while, my palm near the 5th finger hurts always after using the mouse for a while, since that side of the palm has to bend more inward which hurts the muscle by keeping it in tension.
It is a great mouse and definitely worth the price
Great mouse especially paired with MX keys.
Product is great although I’m not sure if I got the unboxed one. Seemed like it’s been used a bit.
Design and photo editing...5☆Flight simulation

I am giving this four stars becuase I like the mouse but I have small hands so this is a little big for me and not comfortable.  other than the fit it works great but I think I will be sending it back and find something smaller.
I do some modeling designs its works amazing to rotating and zooming comfortably since I have a big hand. It came carefully packaged. I'm really happy.

I have had three of these mice (two older versions and this one) all of them have serious lag issues that just sort of happen for no reason. Both in the receiver and Bluetooth. It's so infuriating. They're expensive mice, but I 100% urge you to look elsewhere. I've tried all the forums and no one really has an answer. Not even Logitech. It seems they blame who ever built your computer and the computer manufactures blame Logitech.If your mouse suffers from stuttering or  lag... it may go away, but it will always come back. It's so bad I can't even do my job, so I had to go back to a $10 mouse. At least that actually works. Trust me - you're better off looking somewhere else, unless you want to play the stutter game with Logitech.

I use it with my work and personal macs.There are two very nice features that make me fully recommend it to other users.The extra buttons replace the trackpad gestures very well.The ability to sync with 3 different computers and switch between computers with the push of a button.

I love the ergonomics of this mouse.  I love the battery life.  I love the weight.  I love that I can have two different mice on the same dongle, and have three different devices per mouse.  I bought this one after also using their MX vertical mouse and finding that it seemed to work better over my finicky PCoIP work from home system than other wireless mice did.  Smoother, with fewer incidents of stuttering.I switch back and forth between this and the vertical mouse to keep my arm from getting sore throughout the day, which is why I like that they both can work with the same dongle.  I just grab the one I want and turn it on.  Or, if I want to use one with my laptop I just push the button on the bottom of either mouse to toggle it to a different device.The thing I don't like is the weird scroll wheel.  If you scroll it too quickly, it goes into some kind of hyper scroll mode.  The tactile feedback of the scroll wheel goes away and the wheel spins more freely.  I have never found it terribly useful, and more often than not it happens too late or at a weird time when I'm changing programs and something I don't want to be zooming or scrolling does just that- like a web page suddenly zooming out until I can't read anything or thumbnails shrinking away to nothing.  On my own computer I can turn that off using the Logitech drivers, which is cool, but on my company-managed linux box I'm stuck with default drivers, so the mouse does what it will.  I work around it, and it's obviously not too much of an issue, because I'm giving it four stars.  But I wish I could disable it permanently.As to the battery life- I don't think I have ever actually run the batteries down on either of my Logitech MX mice. I usually just think, "man, have I charged my mouse at all in the last couple of months?" and throw it on the charger before they ever run out. But maybe that's because I turn them off when I'm not using them.

I went from a Goldtouch ergo vertical mouse to this one. This mouse feels more comfortable in my hand, and I think my clicking accuracy is much better now. I'm not sure long the battery lasts yet, but I give it an overnight charge I've a week. The build quality sense better than the Goldtouch as well.

The only reason I did not give the "Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless Mouse" an overall five-star rating is the cost.  I paid $99 and feel that is much too high.  I don't use it for gaming and that is why I did not give it a five-star for gaming.
The hype is real!
Easy to switch between 2.4G and Bluetooth.  Great shape.  USB C.  Scroll can be smooth or notched.  Feels great.  Couldn't imagine a better mouse, ever.

Coming from using the Logitech Performance MX for several years (fav mouse of all time) I'm equally happy with and disappointed with the MX Master 3. I don't like the rubberized coating and the texture of the hard plastic. I don't like how sensitive the right mouse button is (it keeps triggering just from my sausage fingers resting on it).I do like the build, the side wheel, the thumb button and forward/back buttons. The middle wheel is nice except it doesn't handle successive rapid movements well on my machine (not sure if unique to mouse or my setup). Can't speak for battery life yet but I'm disappointed that it's non serviceable, at least without a screwdriver. Love that it's USB C.Tracking is good.Overall, it's a decent mouse but it feels more like it should be 70 instead of 100 bucks and the ergonomics of the Performance MX were better suited to my hands. Maybe I'll grow to love it. Otherwise I'm going to sell it and buy three more Performance MXs for the long haul.

Love the functionality of the Master 3, and I adore the flow capability. Very responsive and accurate.Only drawback is the angle of holding it. Just a few more degrees would make this mouse shine in the light of ergonomics - not as steep as the MX Vertical, which takes it too far, but just a few degrees more than what the Master 3 already has.But if you're used to the dimensions of a typical mouse, the Master 3 is a wonderful addition.

It was great until it completely stopped working for no apparent reason after 6 months.  Now the mouse will not charge or turn on at all.  Logitech support is completely useless and their website for filing warranty claims does not function.  Purchase from another manufacturer if you don't want to have to buy a new one in 6 months.
Best I’ve ever had
WORKS ON ANY SURFACE
I'm glad I got this mouse...so easy to use and it's so smooth when I scroll or doing things on photoshop! Finally a mouse I can work well with!

Coming from a Logitech G9X (a weighted gaming mouse), the lightness of the mouse and tallness of the hand positioning took about a month to fully get used to. Now that I'm used to these things, the mouse is very comfortable for daily use but you definitely want to have a separate mouse for gaming. The clicks are definitely stiffer than the G9X (also another reason to keep a different mouse for gaming) but I don't notice it anymore.I almost bought the MX Master 3 Anywhere mouse instead because its smaller in the palm but now that I've given this a proper chance I'm used to it and love it.LOVE the 3 device switching ability. I have a Macbook Pro (using bluetooth), my PC (using the included logitech dongle) and my TV (bluetooth) mapped. The switching ability on the MX Master 3 and MX Keys is super smooth and convenient. Wish the button wasn't on the underside of the mouse though, I switch a lot and need to pick up the mouse every time, so that is an opportunity Logitech has for the MX Master 4.I don't like the side scrolling wheel position as it's awkwardly positioned for my thumb. There is also a slight lag to side scrolling initially. i'd prefer they kept that feature on the main wheel, that was great for me.The textured rubberized coating on where your thumb rests feels nice but is suspect, I've seen some users report it disintegrating and turning to a sticky mush over time, not sure if that is a rare defect or due to people cleaning their mouse with rubbing alcohol or something that hurts the finish. Hoping mine doesn't have that flaw with time, being careful not to get it dirty.Love the charging and battery life. I've owned it forover a month and use it everyday all day and haven't needed to charge it yet.I'd recommend it if you work from home or aren't gaming. Very solid if you give it a chance.

I was initially hesitant to purchase this mouse as my experience with Logi has been very, very inconsistent, however I needed a mouse for my home office that could hold up to 50+ hour work weeks and wouldn’t need replacement for several years. Since the media reviews as well as the reviews on here were extremely positive, I decided to chance it. A year later, I’m very, very glad I did. This may well be the last mouse you will ever need to buy. The angle at which you hold it make take some getting used to, as it is angled much less than some other ergonomic mice on the market, but it is comfortable to use for a ten-hour work day and definitely won’t go flying out of your hand accidentally. The internal battery will last you a good month, month and half at least if you power it off when not in use. The ability to pair to three devices is an awesome feature, and it works significantly better than I was expecting. The vertical scroll wheel is arguably this mouse’s party piece, and it is satisfying to watch it scroll for a good minute before the brake kicks in if you give it a good flick. If you really want to get the most you can out of this mouse, I would recommend installing Logi’s Logitech Options software as it offers some very nice customization options. That said, this is a solid mouse without the companion software, but the software adds a lot more value to it.

This mouse is great if you are looking for a wireless mouse. The scroll wheels are great.
The wired cable is only for charging and does not make this a wired mouse. Dealbreaker. Functions terribly on PC. Do not buy this for a PC.

This mouse is expensive, but it is worth every penny! I use it for editing and graphic design, and its great for both. The extra buttons are totally customizable with all adobe software and pro tools.

Bought this mouse for work-related use (I do mostly coding / browser stuff). When I first got it, I honestly thought it was ergonomically pretty uncomfortable -- but after some time I got used to it and I do actually like it for the most part. The MX Master design is pretty great in general.The only thing that gets me about this mouse is the scroll wheel. I mean, the fact that it's metal/grippy and works electromagnetically is so cool -- but it does NOT map 1:1 with how much I spin it. I've honestly tried adjusting just about every setting and almost every mode kinda suffers from this -- I really think they missed the mark here. It's especially bad when rapidly switching scroll directions. I was hoping I would get used to it, and I sort of have, but it still upsets me even after a few weeks.
This mouse is freaking amazing. I love how it fits my hand, how is functions. It is perfect!
Best mouse ever!

I bought this specific mouse along with the Logitech MX Master Keys Keyboard because of the multi computer support and the Logitech Options FLOW feature with this mouse. Used with a Mac M1 and a PC the FLOW feature does not work reliably from the Mac to the PC. It works fine in the other direction. Logitech Support has not been able to help resolve the issue.
fast ship great mouse
You can not use Flow in Linux, USELESS and MISLEADING advertising!!

This electromagnetic combo-wheel is awesome, and the side scrolling wheel works about 50% of the time.  The right-mouse button is overly sensitive and you cannot rest anything on it without false-clicks. And it still feels like cheap plastic.  I dunno what they could do to improve on that, but for 99 bucks, the false-clicks and lightweight feeling are underwhelming.At the current price-point, I would NOT say it is 3x better than my Logitech Marathon Mouse, for 30 bucks.And FYI, the side-scrolling wheel isn't supported by every app.  In fact a lot of them don't support it at all, and the ones that do vary wildly in their implementation.  Some will be slower than molasses to scroll left and right, while others like Excel are so hyper-fast, it is almost unusable.Sticking with my 3-star rating.It's a solid 4 if it were half the price.
Meets the hype.  Would buy again.

I bought the Logitech MX Master 3 mouse from a local office supply company in July of 2020, and it's one of the best computer accessory purchases I've ever made.I was debating between it and the Logitech MX Vertical, and ultimately decided against the Vertical because of limited features (no tiltable scroll wheel or alternative) and issues with being able to reliably click on either of the two buttons without pushing the mouse around, being able to hold down on the button and move the mouse around comfortably, etc.Without a doubt, the MX Master 3 is the absolute most comfortable mouse I've ever owned. It's also the fanciest, and I've owned mice from Apple, Kensington, and other manufacturers over the decades I've had a computer. It's super comfortable in my hand (I have decently-sized hands) and one of the best single features of it is the magnetic scroll wheel.My primary OS is Linux Mint, and so I was initially a little hesitant to drop about $100 on a mouse which may or may not be fully supported, since Logitech doesn't write software for GNU+Linux. On any platform, the only physical function which doesn't work without installed software is the ability to switch between multiple computers. Also, the magnetic scroll wheel works perfectly well, but you have no way to adjust when or if it switches between ratcheted and smooth scrolling. However, there's a program you can install from the repositories called "Solaar", and this enables you to do all the basic things, which includes battery level monitoring, connecting and disconnecting Logitech devices from a single unified Logitech USB receiver, and fully controlling the magnetic scroll wheel.One of the major touted features with the MX Master series is the ability to customize all the mouse shortcut functions and certain behaviors to do different things depending on which program you're actively using. That is, it can be customized to do certain things for "just Photoshop" and then swap this for other capabilities for "just Illustrator" and again for "just MS Word", and so on. I don't want to downplay any of that, but since I don't use any of those sorts of programs, I can't comment on how well that works. Solaar does not implement any of that functionality, so unfortunately I cannot replicate that in GNU+Linux.But, as I said at the top, this is the finest mouse I've owned, and I wouldn't trade it for anything.

This mouse solves all the issues with the original MX. The original MX mouse side buttons were impossible to find without lifting your hand off the mouse and "feel" for them. MX 3 , ain't no searching. Lift your thumb slightly, there you go. BAM. This will save me a lot of time. This was my biggest issue with the original MXThe texture of the mouse and flywheel.. omg. feels like a Bently in my hand. Thanks, Logitech!

This mouse replaced my MX Master 25. I like the new application-specific features, and the thump-accessible control layout is more intuitive. Two defaults need to be switched, making the button below the wheel the middle button and pressing the wheel to be mode-shift between free and click. Otherwise, it's great out of the box.FWIW, I hope the things that contact skin are easier to clean. Time will tell.

This is a great wireless mouse for using in my office, especially combined with the MX Keys keyboard. It's really well put together and feels great in the hand. Overall I am really happy with this purchase, the best feature for me is the Flow feature, which allows me to just roll to the edge of the screen and have it switch between controlling my laptop and my desktop in my office. Great feature.

This is my favorite mouse I have ever used due to gesture controls, linking with ergo keyboard, shape, button placement.  But one thing that is a common issue among the community and from what I have found has been a long-time bug with the horizontal scrolling on windows.  Was weird getting it to work and now only works part of the time and will only work in other applications if I use it in web browser first.  Very peculiar but I only found this out because other people told me to try it as thats how they get theirs to work.
Amazing battery life and total value for money.
Gaming
Love the feel and use, but have had nothing but trouble with charging.  I'd return it in a minute.....

I can't use the thumbwheel in VS Code.Installing their software / customizations made things not work.For an expensive professional mouse, this is super frustrating.I'm supposed to be doing my work, not debugging your terrible drivers.Difficult to get the unifying received to work as well.

Love this mouse! Use it for 8+ hours a day no hand fatigue and the finish is great. Logitech flow is also very handy and I like that I can have this synced to my computer at home, work, and laptop and just have to hit a button to cycle through when not using flow. Also been using it for a few weeks and battery life is still above 50% with all day m-f use

This MX Master 3 mouse just feels right in the hand. I love the weighted feel of the scroll wheels and the available buttons on the mouse. The ergonomics are great and I just can't say that I have ever used a mouse that was this nice to work with. Very satisfied.

Like I said in the title, this is the last mouse you’ll need. This thing has features up the wazoo. Along with all the programmable buttons that can be customized per application, this thing can seamlessly switch from one device to another like they’re connected by a magical force. If you have any doubts, throw them away and buy this thing, you’ll love it.
Best mouse I have used with business apps as well as photo editing apps!

If you are migrating from the smaller magic mouse  (or similar) it will take time to adjust to the new size. I unconsciously and consistently knock it off my desk because of the elevated height of the new mouse. scrolling and clicking also feels flimsy compared to the magic mouse but it's a familiar feeling since I use a PC with a generic mouse daily. This is where the Logitech Flow is awesome... I only need one mouse for both platforms.
Works every time
I have been working with Logitech Performance MX mouse before. This one is better. Lighter and easier to navigate. Love it.

This mouse is able to connect to three devices simultaneously.  When using a MX Keyboard,  It's like an extended desktop when I go toward the edge of the screen it can switch computers like a transparent KVM.  I love being able to drag drop files from one computer to the other.

5 stars on ergonomics, feel, features, hyper-scroll, customization BUT...1 star on switching between computers without using FLOW (their software, available via their Logitech Options control panel).For those with a personal computer and a work computer that is locked down and/or VPN's into your workplace, there's no way to map the "device switching" button (on the bottom of the mouse) to one of the buttons on the top.Result: Every time you want to switch between devices (not on the same network/subnet), you have to PICK UP THE MOUSE, TURN IT OVER, THEN PRESS THE BUTTON ON BOTTOM (to toggle between device 1, 2, or 3).Imagine having to flip your keyboard over every time you want to switch between computers.This design flaw/oversight is unbelievable to me, especially since they (a) manufacture another mouse with a button on the top labeled 1/2/3 to switch between devices (and, yes, I have FLOW installed on both computers) and (b) their MX Keys keyboard has 3 buttons that allow quick switching between devices.

Bought this as a Christmas gift for my partner and he absolutely loves using it for editing in photoshop & premiere. It fits nicely in your hand and doesn't cause cramps after hours of use. His only issue with it is that it doesn't respond fast enough while playing seige, so he usually switches back to a wired gaming mouse for that.Still would highly recommend it though!
Perfect for productivity which is why I purchased this mouse. I wouldn’t purchase it for the sole purpose of gaming.

I used to male fun of “computer geeks” and their expensive mouses. Never again! Im using this all day due to online teaching. I use this mouse all day ling. What a relief. Night and day compared to the garbage mouse that I was using before.

I know it works well because when I use a normal mouse, my arm and shoulder pain return.It worked so well my wife took it from me and I had to order another!Highly recommended for WFH use and office use.
I'm a software developer and use my mouse for a living.  This is by far the best mouse I have ever used since my very first in the mid '80s.
Good
Good quality and a lot of features

I wish I bought this mouse long ago!  It's great!It's a very quick press of a button (underneath), and I switch from one computer to another.  Very cool and useful if you multitask with multiple devices!One minor complaint that's really more of a "wish list" item for later models - The mouse comes with a wireless feature.  You plug in the USB receiver to the computer, and the mouse connects without the need for Bluetooth.  That's great, but what if I'm not using that piece?  (I may use it, but rarely.)  I don't want to lose that very tiny USB receiver.  Here is my suggestion:Put a small slot for the very small USB receiver.  (I've seen it on other wireless mice.)  That way the USB piece would always be with the mouse if and when needed.Still, this is the best mouse I've ever had.  Money well-spent indeed!
Love it!
I like the built in switching for use on multiple computers and also the free scroll wheel.
The first one was malfunction, I asked for a replacement. The second one was good. A little bit big for small hand people.

Overall seems good.Scroll wheel is silent, which is great. But its scroll wheel is also quirky, and not always in a good way.If you spin its scroll wheel fast, it spins for an extremely long time (easily 10 full seconds). So you can scroll far with very little effort. But it also means that you constantly have to stop the wheel from spinning to avoid accidentally scrolling long after you originally meant to scroll. For example, dozens of times per day I found myself accidentally scrolled to the bottom of a page because I switched tabs after scrolling to the bottom of an earlier page. I'm sure I would have learned to use it better over time, but I gave it at least a week and it kept bothering me very frequently.Additionally, I often found the scroll wheel to behave poorly at short distances, which really annoyed me. In certain scenarios (I couldn't fully figure out when) it sort of just failed to scroll as far as it should. I think it was probably related to the automatic scroll mode switching. For example, maybe if you scroll a short distance too fast it mistakenly goes into its long-distance mode, which scrolls a shorter distance per wheel rotation. In any case, it was really annoying.
Very smooth
Been in love with this mouse ever since I got it. It's been 11 months now & still works like new. ❤
This mouse offers a lot of functionality but just was not comfortable in my hand.  I ordered the smaller Logitech MX Go Anywhere 3 instead.
Excelente producto

This mouse changed my life. I spend about six hours a day with a hand on my mouse for work. That’s 1/4 of my day. 17% of my life. The comfort, efficiency, luxury feel, and customizability make me a believer. Helped me get more done in VSC, Excel, SQL Studio. Game changer. 10/10 highly recommend!

I have used Logitech products since a mouse had a wire.  I bought the Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced because I assumed it would have the same high quality I had always found in Logitech products.  This is a $100 mouse. the battery only lasted about six months.  It longer holds a charge.  It now is a paper weight (for that it works well).  I tried to buy a new battery for it only to find out it can't be shipped to Hawaii.  I could buy a new mouse with a battery and have it shipped but not just the battery..  I did try all the trouble shooting information.

Using this mouse for gaming is a disgusting meme. It has a low polling rate and just has way too much latency to ever be really accurate. Not only that, you can buy a much better gaming mouse for it at a higher price. It's a productivity mouse that has a lot of built-in functions for apps. Use it for work. If you want to game and work, just buy an ergonomic gaming mouse. Better yet, buy both of them for different purposes.
This mouse works really well for mac system especially if you are connecting your MacBook to a monitor. Can't live without it now.
Love that I can use the same mouse and keyboard on two different computers, and this mouse is very ergonomic with tons of options
This is a really nice, programmable mouse. Fits well in the hand, rechargeable with USB C-mini. Single charge lasts for weeks. Accurate tracking.
This mouse is one of the best purchases you can make. Great product at a great price. Can easily use on 3 different devices.  I love this thing

I've been using Logitech mice since the three-button corded Mouseman--I still use--I use 2-to-3 mice at one time.  In addition to the Mouseman corded, I use a VX Revolution and a VX Nano mouse--USB mice.  I needed a Bluetooth mouse for my new iPad, ergo I got this mouse.I listened to a reviewer who recommended the MX Master 3 with the Unifying Receiver rather than the Apple version of the same mouse--because it would function with Apple and yet include a USB dongle for other use.  He was absolutely correct--it still worked totally with the iPad and could work with my Windows PC with the USB Receiver.  So why get the Apple version only.My VX Revolution  has 10 programmable buttons, the VX Nano has 8 buttons, and this MX Master 3 has multiple programmable buttons as well, which was what attracted me.  The feel is good, and it is very easy to use, with greater precision--almost as precise as the corded Mouseman.I am able to switch between three devices, my Windows PC, the iPad and another.  Works out really well.  This $100 mouse is worth it.  Get a case to protect it.  I am using it more with my Windows PC than the iPad, what it was initially intended for.

You can connect to 3 PCs but the buttons on the bottom so reaching for another mouse is faster.You can map all kinds of thing to the different buttons but not the switching to different PCs. Seems crazy but ok. It's heavy and too tall to rest your hand on, hurts my hand forcing it to tilt to the right. So lifting it up and clicking the button on the bottom many times a day is not fun. The size and shape and weight force you to lift with your wrist and not your fingers so again picking up the front many times a day to keep tracking the mouse pointer in the same direction is not fun.This large heavy mouse has no place to store the USB (Not USB C) adaptor.Soft touch rubber will stain and not last long. Every mouse I've had with it peels at some point.Mouse wheel is nice idea but is randomly not seen by Windows and is quiet until it stops with a clunk.At least you can replace the batteries if Logitech still makes them by the time you need them and they don't cost more than the mouse.
Save yourself... just buy it, your wrist and hand will love you. Price seems high but when you work out price per use it will all make sense. Thank you to the designer(s).

It fits your hand if you really move your hand forward. The biggest problem I have is the buttons are loud, sound cheap, and ridiculously sensitive. You can not let your fingers rest, even feather light wise. Previous series were better. Thumb wheel is a nice idea, but doesn't seamlessly work with all applications.Might need to return it.
This was everything I’ve ever wanted in a mouse. It’s sleek, ergonomic, and has side scrolling at the tip of my thumb. The price is a little high but certainly not for something you use everyday.

This is the best mouse I've ever used. It looks cool, feels great and makes sense when you are using it. I enjoy it, if you are thinking about this and one that is half the price just go with this one you will like it enough to justify it. So we are clear I use this for work and general computer use I do not use for gaming so I cannot speak to how it works for that.
Great mouseSmaller than the mx master 2S

Purchased 11/23/20; Just holding the mouse with normal pressure, frequently triggers the right click. It is too sensitive. I have purchased numerous Logitech mice and keyboards in the past years. None of them last very long. You need to have several on hand to keep one functional.
Didnt realize my old MX Master was so worn out.  Happy with my new MX
A great mouse.  Period.  Been using the Logitech MX Performance Mouse for years.  This mouse is 1000% better than that mouse. So glad I made the purchase.

Updated from the MX Master 2S because that version used rubber around the thumb wheel and it started to come off.  The MX 3 is just as good and no longer uses rubber around the wheel but machined metal.  My one complaint is that the mouse is just so darn slippery.  Maybe that will change with more use.

Logitech nailed this mouse - the best for serious users.  Other high end mice haven't made the bar (tried dozens) and this one finally dethroned my 10 year old logitech MX.  I hope this newer mouse lasts as long!

Bought the second one days after using the first. One for work, one for home.The only thing that would be cool would be for the side to side switches on the scroll wheel for switching between virtual desktops. Wound up using the side buttons for that.

The scrolling mechanism is bad. Once you tried it, you will understand why. Everytime you scroll down and scroll back up, the scrolling back up often doesn't register. Very frustrating.This is not just this mouse. Even the MX anywhere 3 does the same. They are both using the same "NEW" technology.
It works fine, but the shape may not fit everyone's hand, just feel a bit off compared with my previous Sidewinder.

The mouse itself is comfortable, ergonomic, and has great features (like the side-scrolling wheel and the forward-backward side button). However, I have seen a lot of issues when connected to my new MacBook Pro 13" with the M1 chip both when the MX3 is connected with Bluetooth and the USB receiver. The mouse's tracking will jump around constantly, especially when playing video games, and will lag sometimes. Once these issues are fixed (which could be an issue with the M1 chip rather than the mouse itself) I would definitely give 5 stars.

Replaced my decade old MX Performance mouse that I loved until it wasn't tracking anymore. This mouse works as well as the old mouse (better probably!) is much lighter, and can easily swap between my 2 laptops. The bluetooth connection means no more fear of losing the little dongle bit, and I am very happy with it.

This mouse was highly recommended for Adobe Creative Suite programs. I find that the installed "profiles" often don't do what they say they will and the battery life on this thing seems poor. I keep a Kensington trackball nearby for one this thing fails, which occurs about weekly. I'm trying to get used to it, but I may just admit I wasted a lot of money on something that I think pretty much overpromised its capabilities.

I didn't think a mouse could be magic but here we are. Bought this after seeing it multiple times in "top recommended accessory" videos for my new Mac. 3 second of retail therapy later and what do you know this mouse is awesome. I use it all day on a Lenovo and switch it over to a Mac with a push of a button. It's great, I love all the buttons and how they work with the Mac. Not very proficient with it on the Lenovo yet but I'm learning. Glad I bought it.

Owned two prior versions of this mouse.  Each generation is better and better.  The included transceiver dongle works with the mouse and my Logitech Ergo K860.  The two look made for each other.  Saves a USB port and allows me to put the second transceiver into my laptop.

Everything that bothered me about the 2S is fixed.- The main scroll wheel has a much better feel.- Forward Thumb button much easier to use- Gestures seem better (using it for: press "copy", press/move "copy"Master 3 tops the list of best mice in my experience since 1988.

This is by far the best mouse I have ever owned. When I saw the price tag initially I was a bit skeptical. How good can a wireless mouse possibly be, right? Boy was I wrong. I love the hybrid-ergonomic shape, very comfortable. It is a great starter mouse for someone like me who has used a standard mouse for their entire life and isn't ready to go fully sideways/ergonomic yet. The mouse wheel is absolutely gravity-defying. It is practically zero friction, it will just keep spinning and spinning! It makes scrolling on large webpages and excel documents so much easier. The wheel is completely silent too, which is nice. It also has excellent battery life. I have had to charge it 3 times in the 4 months I have owned it, and I probably could have waited longer in between. I don't use the customization features much, but I'm sure they are great for those who have use for them. My only complaint is that the Logitech program/drivers may cause some computer issues for some. For example, when I try to shut down my computer I sometimes get an error popup regarding the Logitech overlay still being active. There is also a Bluetooth-related part of the drivers/application that invisibly pops up on the computer at random times which can minimize and interrupt what I am currently doing, which can be frustrating. Overall I love this mouse, and would highly recommend it to everyone.

What really keeps this device from perfection though is the software side of things. The Logitech Options software is okay for customization, but it lacks certain features that makes no sense. By default the thumb resting button press is set to TASK VIEW, however when I want to customize the gestures I cannot select TASK VIEW as one of the options available.Also there is a bug probably in the current version that makes some of the buttons double click in every press, and this is very annoying cause the solution is to unpair and repair the mouse to windows.

I've been using the Magic Mouse 2 since mid 2017 and finally decided to sell it and put it towards this mouse after I experienced the MX Keys. It took a few hours to adjust to this mice but now I've been using it for over a week and it is awesome. I see absolutely no cons about this mouse.

I used a performance Mx before and I thought that was great. This is definitely an upgrade that's miles better. I didn't realize how heavy that mouse was. This mouse is light, ergonomic, and performant. I haven't tried gaming yet but i suspect it'll be great!
Using it on macbook pro 15in.

I am a 55-70 hours per week desk jockey at an engineering firm. I spend 90% of my day elbows deep in 2D and 3D CAD programs. I have been using the MX series for years now. I am lucky enough my company with provide these for me when I ask for them. I could ask for any brand or model and they would provide it, but I choose the MX Master 3 and MX Keys. I usually charge the mouse on the weekends, yes it lasts that long. The MX Keys needs charged twice a week since I leave the auto key illumination on. The feature I love most is being able to switch between three systems. Because you can connect via Bluetooth to your laptop, you can connect to multiple devices that have Bluetooth enabled. I have three laptops at my home office (COVID Protocol), my company laptop, my client’s provided laptop (I am contracted out to my client, so they provide a laptop to make working in their systems easier), and my personal laptop. The keyboard and mouse have a button labeled 1-2-3. Just select the one you want and go to work. I can swap on the fly when I need to.

Good luck getting smooth cursor movement and a reliable connection.  Millions of features are pointless if the connection endlessly breaks.The software has no connection related info so you are on your own.  I guess it would be pointless to add since when the connection weakens, you can't use the app anyway.One the PC processor goes under load, the connection weakens and the mouse is unpredictable.The forward back buttons are strangely too far back.  The most used "back" button requires you to slide your hand back from the resting position.Not sure what the battery light is saying.  Sometimes it's lit green, sometimes off.  No paper manual provided.Not sure what the forward button on the bottom means.  Is it a toggle between USB/BT or just BT on/off?The slanted form factor is easy to hold but places your palm weight on your small wrist bone (pisiform).  I see problems with this over time.

When you spend as much time on the computer as I do, a good mouse is essential.  My last Logitech lasted 10 years.  Bought it here on Amazon as well.  All buttons and controls are placed well.  This thing will read off of any surface.  Very ergonomic.  Feels great.Logitech costs more, but it is so worth it.

To date I've owned the each iteration of the MX mice. They get better overall with each iteration, but each iteration also has it's missteps. The MX 3 is no exception, it's the best one yet.Positives:* Easy to set up with nice configuration options.* Comfortable to use.* Moved the forward and back buttons back to under the horizontal scroll wheel. (So glad they moved back to this the location on the MX 2 was terrible)* Auto-magic switch between infinite and step scrolling. Loved this feature from the MX 2 and it's only been made better.* Uses USB-C now!* All metal scroll wheels. Easier to clean and don't show wear like MX 2. In addition the horizontal scroll while is bigger and easier to use.Cons:* Got rid of the battery charging status from MX 2. Now it's just a single LED, so it's harder to tell when fully charged.* Can't switch the computer the mouse is controlling from Logitech Options. (This should be added, it's so convenient with the MX Keys to do this.)* Could be slightly larger, this would improve the ergonomics for myself but likely hurt others. (Can't win them all.)
Bought this for sharing between computers feature. Even though I am properly paired it wont let me move on to customize my mouse.
Had ordered the compact version, it was too small...had it replaced with this model. I absolutely love it. One Dongle to control them all.
I use it everyday, is very ergonomic!

I have a Mac running Big Sur 11.1 and I just received and setup the Logitech MX3 (with its latest software) that I bought due to its Photoshop-specific functionality, but Photoshop (latest version of Photoshop CC) shows an error message that it can't load the Logitech 8.36.40 extension. Logitech says their latest software has the 8.36.76 extension. This has been a known issue in both the Adobe and Logitech community forums for well over a month.

First, let me say that I love the Logitech's Keys (keyboard) with the MX Master 3 Mouse combo! It took a while to set up with my iMac and Windows 10 devices. There's some issues here but a quick update to the Logi Options firmware fixed the issue I was having with using Flow between my Mac and my work Windows PC. That being said, here is my review of just the mouse.The mouse was initially comfortable but I quickly realized that my ring and pinky finger were being curled in, which makes the comfort sub-par for me. I typically have "medium" sized hands (as gloves go) and this mouse is slightly too small for my liking. It's not a deal-breaker but I wish there was a bit more surface to the right of the mouse, like my previous trackball mouse which allowed me to put all my fingers comfortably on the mouse itself. Currently the right-side drops vertically so my 2 fingers have to curl in or just drag on the desk; both which are slightly uncomfortable, especially for long use.I've only been using this mouse since I busted it out of the box today but the build quality and matte finish are very nice. The scrollwheel is also a good as others have mentioned and spins nicely, allowing me to speed-scroll long pages.To Logitech - I would give this mouse a 5 out of 5 stars if it had more surface area on the right. Although it would make the mouse larger, it would greatly improve the comfort level for any users that have a medium or larger hand.So far so good. I'll update if anything changes but right now, I'm quite enjoying the Logitech keyboard and mouse combo.UPDATE:Too good to be true. While the initial switching option was nice, it's a bit buggy and I can't get it to work consistently and not sure what the issue is. So as of now, I'm having to switch manually using the buttons :(.UPDATE2:I haven't found any solution or update to solve the issue with flow not always working but a soft restart appears to help.UPDATE3:I may have found a "better" solution/setup. The mouse/keyboard is connected to the Windows PC via the Unifying Receiver and connected to the Mac via bluetooth, the switching/connectivity is consistently more stable. So far, its gone all day and works approximately 80% of the time. Still hope Logitech has an update to remedy this but so far so good...-ish.UPDATE 4:Been several months and I haven't had any success getting Flow to work again with my Mac/Windows PC setup. Even after numerous tries, restarts, uninstalls/reinstalls, and support community, nothing works. I've brought my rating as now it's nearly as inconvenient as having 2 sets of keyboard/mice. Quite unfortunate. As of this last update, if you want to pair Mac and a Windows PC, please take note.

For reference, my hand size is 7.75 inches from wrist to middle finger, and 3.75 inches across at the point where the thumb meets the palm.I had the following problems with the Logitech MX Master 3It was too hard to grip –  other mice from Logitech and Microsoft have had a sticky rubber grip that I was subconsciously expecting here, but the MX Master 3's grip is different. It does have some kind of textured rubber, but it's harder to the touch, and didn't necessarily make grip easier for me.The other problem was the finger movement. The Logitech mouse I have is small enough that I use my middle finger for minor scroll wheel movements, but automatically switch to the index finger for more extended scrolling. This proved to be much more difficult due to the heft of the MX Master 3. I felt like I had to consciously make a choice to either keep scrolling with my middle finger, or make an explicit movement and switch to the index finger. Also, the thumb-based horizontal scroll, albeit optional, didn't really help much as scrolling with my thumb got painful fairly quickly.Hence, I returned this mouse. I really want to like it, but doesn't seem like it's the mouse for me.
In a sealed MX Master 3 box, Amazon sent a used / damaged / perfumed MX Master 2.

This is the most ergonomic mouse I've ever held. I'm coming from the MX Anywhere 2s and wow what a difference. The scroll wheel is incredibly quiet and also effective and feels great to use. There's absolutely not lag whatsoever from bluetooth and the mouse is fluid like water. I can't recommend this enough for people doing professional work, gaming, or just want an amazing functionable mouse. This is another product that shows why I continue to be a Logitech customer! Fantastic job!

If you are tossing around the idea of getting a more premium mouse this is the one. I am very pleased with it. The feel and functionality are NEXT level hands down. I have not used it for any games so that I cannot comment on. However as a general productivity, business, designer mouse YES and YES.
The mouse wheel will make you wonder how you ever did anything without it.
Aswome for excell and cross laptop use

THIS is the ultimate mouse for productivity. I absolutely love this mouse and sadly can’t go back to any other. The quality of the mouse and battery life are great. I highly  recommend this mouse to family and friends. I actually gifted one to my mother and she loves it!

Probably the best mouse i've ever used.  You can use this thing with the wirelessly either via bluetooth, or with usb receiver (which is included).  I love that you can program every button to (do specific things) within different apps.  I mostly do work from a laptop, but I prefer using a mouse.  Its super comfortable, and really ergonomic.  The batter life is awesome on this thing, I have yet to charge it, and its been over a week of continuous use.  The best part is the the scroll button.  It can zip thru multiple pages with ease, or go line for line with precision.  Sure there are other cheaper mice you could buy, but if you want a quality product, with a name you can trust, this Logitech Mx Master 3 is the one for you.

Feel great in hand, but inconsistent scrolling on mac. Disable smart shift doesn't fix the issue.
A $10 Logitech B100 scroll better than this mouse, for me, thats unacceptable.
I love this mouse it is extremely comfortable which allows me to get my work done easier and more efficiently.

THE best mouse I ever owned, upgraded from a Mx Master.  Logitech took the same great ergonomics, but added distance between the left-right scroll wheel and the thumb rest (see pic), to avoid accidental scrolls.  New top wheel kinetics are great, the clicker is smoother now, plus, even in click mode, if you launch it fast, it will disengage the clicker and launch in inertial free spin mode.  Great to scroll long distances, no need to disengage the click anymore.  But the genius is, see my setup, the mouse can be paired with 3 different computers (including a mixture of PCs and Macs; see last picture, bottom button with 3 lights above it), and with the "Flow" technology, when scrolling to the edge of the left or right-most screen attached to one computer, it will seamlessly switch to the next computer.  So I can just swipe my mouse through my 6 screens (3 computers), in one movement.  Even better, I can copy from one computer and paste into another.  And I also bought the companion keyboard, see other review, as soon as I click on a text box in any computer, the keyboard links to that computer and allows me to type there.  Only 2 small niggles, 1) the "gesture" button under the thumb is a bit stiff and position sensitive, and 2) the keyboard only switches after you click in a text box, not when the mouse moves to the computer.  But the mouse is so vastly superior to everything else out there I have to give it 5 stars.  Gave it 4 for gaming because I just don't game.

I've been a Logitech user for 20+ years. I always loved their gear. I was super excited to get this mouse to replace my trusty MX Pro mouse that recently developed issues with the primary button after about 8 years. This new mouse is a NIGHTMARE.
The awful SmartShift scroll wheel is impossible to use. One gently flick and I'm 100 pages down a document. It doesn't click or ratchet anymore, it constantly unlocks to smooth scrolling and I'm lost in my document. Scrolling is literally impossible now.I thought, "no problem, there must be away to disable this useless crap." So I installed the Logitech Options app, and yes it does disable that garbage. But it also replaces mousing and scrolling for the entire system. This has two huge drawbacks. One, I'm constantly nagged with permissions requests in macOS to allow this mouse to "control my system", which I granted, but the even bigger problem is once I set all the permissions to finally be correct, the mouse is still broken. If I zoom into the screen using Control+scroll wheel, an accessibility feature that I use constantly, the mouse suddenly has no idea where the cursor is anymore. And the scroll wheel doesn't work. It scrolls lists or windows that are nowhere near where my cursor is, and will not scroll what I'm hovering over. The app is completely broken in terms of knowing where the cursor is and scrolling whatever object is under the mouse cursor.I have no idea how this mouse has such high reviews. I guess I'm the only one that uses the screen zooming feature. The worst thing is, all of their new mice have this insane "SmartShift electromagnetic scroll wheel" gimicky crap. So now it looks like I can never buy another Logitech mouse again. I don't want to have to install an app to control how the scroll wheel works. These things always have bugs and stability issues. I just want a normal mouse with a normal scroll wheel.Good lord Logitech, why did you have to break something that was so good? Beyond frustrating. Now the hunt begins for a usable mouse. Ugh....

I ended up hating the Apple Magic Mouse 2 (most uncomfortable mouse I've ever used). This was its replacement. It has a decent weight which makes it flow well across the desk. The fact that it's rechargeable makes me feel like I'm doing something good for the environment. Setup was incredibly easy and the mouse is highly customizable. It has all the features I could want.

This mouse is it. This is it. I got one for work because I work at a computer most of the day. I loved using it so much that I was carrying it home with me every night after work so I could use it home.  I ended up getting a second one for home.  If you work with documents, or research on the internet, or work on more than one computer then you need to get this mouse.  This is not the gamer's mouse. This is a mouse for getting work done.  I use the customizable buttons on all the apps I use and it's awesome.  I fly through my work just by clicking buttons.  Everyone I show thinks it's magic that allows me to copy and paste, switch tabs, open new websites, turn up or down the volume, minimize windows, or switch desktops with my mouse.  Get this mouse.

I've had the MX Master 2, 2S and now the 3. There's a reason I keep coming back to this mouse. It's great for productivity. Every button is programmable and it has just enough buttons to be useful, but not so many that you'll forget which one does what. The ergonomics are much improved from the previous version.The construction of these mice is as good as mice come. It better be for the price. The texture is smooth with a subtle tooth to is so my hands rarely get sweaty when the gaming gets intense. Speaking of gaming, you can game on this mouse. It's a little on the heavy side but I've found the latency to be near zero for a wireless mouse so long as you stick to the dongle.Speaking of the dongle, the wireless reception can take some finessing. It can make it through your desk but I have found that it can suffer from interference if you have a computer or something in between the mouse and the dongle. Once you figure out your setup, it is as reliable as death & taxes. The tracking on this mouse is absolutely perfect. It even tracks on glass and although the sensitivity appears to take a slight hit, it is probably imperceptible for most people.As I mentioned before, I've been using some variant of this mouse for the past 4-5 years. I have found that it is very comfortable and ergonomic. I never feel any fatigue after using it even if I find myself playing video games for extended sessions.  The scroll wheel is great with the two modes. I find the clicked mode is more practical in everyday use. When you spin it quickly, it unclicks and rolls smoothly, perfect for long pages, PDF's, or timelines in your video editing program of choice, this can be switched back & forth on the fly.. While we're on the topic of configuration. every button can be changed to do whatever. I sort of wish there was one more button for the pinky, but that could screw up the ergonomics. The side scroll wheel on thumb is useful but not the most ergonomic. Not really sure how it can be improved as it its better than the previous version.Battery life is good, I don't find it annoying to plug it in about every 10 days to 2 weeks. The LED indicator let's you know at least 3-4 hours of constant use before you need to plug it in. I'll sometimes ignore the light and it'll keep chugging for another day.Lastly, it can be paired with multiple devices in one of two ways. Once you experience this level of convenience, you'll never want to go back. A simple button press on the bottom of the mouse (so you don't accidentally swap machines) and you are instantly paired with another machine. I use a PC workstation, a mac for work and an iPad as my laptop replacement. I have all 3 paired at once.Are you ready for the Caddy of wireless mice? You can't do much better than this guy.

Great mouse but Logitech's software for device switching is missing a key feature: you have to switch each device separately.So if you gave a Logitech keyboard like the K580 Ergo, you push a button to switch to device 2 AND you also have to pick up the mouse to separately switch the mouse to device 2.  It's not a huge deal but a use case that Logitech has really missed the mark to have truly great UX.
Fantastic in every measure I use to judge a mouse.
heavier than a gaming mouse but if if youre buying this then you probably already know that. perfect in every other way though

Do not trust the 4.5 stars this product has.Within 30 minutes of use I noticed issues when scrolling.  I thought it was an isolated issue, but a little searching shows this is a widespread recurring problem.  The mouse is unable to handle anything more than slow line by line speed.  Once you try to scroll several lines it lags and fails to register chunks of scrolls.  I am running this on a MacBook for reference.This is a total dealbreaker for anyone who plans to browse webpages, or documents.  From what I've seen, this is not being considered by Logitech as a bug to be fixed, but as a result of the hardware design, namely the new scroll wheel magnetic technology.  This is a huge disappointment, returning it right away.

This is an awesome mouse! I charged it when I installed it on December 3rd and it's been going strong since. (Today's December 28th) I spend way too much time on the computer - hey, I'm a workaholic and recreate with the box as well (if I'm not on the motorcycles - damned pandemic!) so every day's a long one. One of my hesitations about purchasing this mouse was the (stated) non-replaceable battery. But with cycles like this I can't see it wearing out all that soon. What's more, since Logitech provide instructions on LiPo battery recycling I wouldn't be surprised if a replacement can be sourced from a third-party when that becomes necessary. I came from a Logitech Performance MX so getting used to this mouse was a snap. The all-steel scroll wheel feels every bit as good as you might think it is, the electromagnetic detent system is just great, and already I can tell I'd sorely miss the side-scroll wheel if it were gone. All buttons are crisp and precise. Tracking is accurate and perfect on my glass desk. I'm using this with the dongle as opposed to Bluetooth so can't comment on that or tell you if using Bluetooth impact battery life. Likewise, I haven't tried using this mouse to control multiple computers at once, either. I dinged the mouse for gaming because - while I'm not a gamer - I realize that wireless mice as a whole are just too unresponsive for most gamers. Finally, the price. It's high. Worth it to me, though, for reasons given. Plus, it's Logitech - built like a tank and in my experience, they stand behind their gear. My Performance MX lasted more than 7 years.Edited to add that today, January 2, 2021, I received an alert that the mouse battery charge had dipped to 'critical' levels. One day short of a month of heavy use is double-plus excellent in my book.

Love the spinning wheel. Good heft and feel and of course i love the fact that it works across two or three computers and works with the mx dongle and bluetoothIt's just the best mouse i have ever used

I have been an avid fan of MX Master mice for years.  I still have an MX Master 1 that is amazing but started having microswitch issues after years of service.  This new one is horrendous.  The mouse wheel doesn't work after a couple scrolls.  Seems like it cannot decide whether you're going to be doing a fly-wheel scroll or a regular one and gives up doing either.  Basically unusable and going back.  I don't know what happened to Logitech.  First the Harmony has gone completely off the deep end.  Now their flagship mouse too?

I have to change my previous review of this item due to not working as intended... in fact, it doesn't work at all.It started with random disconnections, then it stopped working wirelessly, I changed drivers, tested on a different computer with no effect, the only way it kept working was plugged to the included cable but after just a couple of weeks it stopped working altogether, not connecting ever again.I tried to contact Logitech support and it was awful, you will not get a complete refund unless you leave on the US... avoid like the plague

As a programmer, I've been using the MX series since it first came out over a decade ago. I get a new mouse and mech keyboard (Das Keyboard) every year for Christmas (it's a thing for me) so this more than my tenth MX series mouse. It's all I use.Admittedly, I've owned this particular variation for only a day, but I see none of the problems some people here are complaining about. To me, so far, it's every bit as good as the MX carnations before it.  It feels better than the 2S (which this one is replacing) and the forward/back buttons are greatly improved over the 2S (I really hated those). The wheels work well, and feel heavier.So this is a vastly improved model from what I can tell. Rest assured, if I experience problems with it, I will be back immediately to edit this review. I don't know why people are experiencing these problems, perhaps a bad batch got out? I don't know.Is there a better mouse out there (at least for programmers)? I doubt it.
Great mouse, It works great and very precise. The scroll wheels are great both horizontal and vertical.
Amazing product, ergonomic, functional, hand and wrist rest while using, amazing battery life. Battery is replaceble in case you need it

I bought this mouse after reading several good reviews. To be honest, I like the mouse. It has compatibility with both Mac and Windows with several pre-programmed profiles. It’s ergonomic. Build Quality is very good. The only reason I gave it a 3 star was due to serious lag issues due to Bluetooth technology used in the unifying receiver (dongle). I don’t use it for gaming. But I would imagine that it would be an even bigger frustration for gamers.I was trying to open several email attachments. However, the lag and freeze of the mouse were so bad that it took me 10 mins just to click on 9 email attachments and download. And it was a time sensitive work email that I had to respond to. I was so frustrated that I was about to chuck the mouse at the monitor screen. Instead, I just ordered a Logitech G502 “Wired” mouse today on Amazon on sale for $40. Expecting to receive it in the next couple of days.
I like it very much. It feels good and has a lot of quick settings
I love it!!

While I love this mouse on my Macbook Pro, I have been getting into troubles with this mouse on the Windows. It does not run smoothly on the Windows operating system. It stopped working while I was taking the midterm exam for my graduate program. It is really great product in Mac OS. However, on the Windows, the experience was not the same. I tried to search for the solution online but there wasn't much troubleshooting procedures I could follow. I know the bluetooth can be flaky in Windows. However, I also bought a Keychron keyboard, which runs on bluetooth. I use both devices for my Macbook Pro and my Windows Desktop. It is the only the mouse that is having a problem with Windows. :( If there can be any solution to this, it would be fantastic.
The ergonomic is amazing

Picked this mouse up as soon as it was first released in September 2019 and have absolutely loved it ever since. The battery lasts forever, even with regular 40 hour a week use (about 3 months between charges). The button placement is all comfortable enough and feels so much nicer than cheap default mice in the hand. The left and right click are a little louder than I was hoping but it's not too much of a deal breaker. The advanced scroll wheel is very useful, so much so that I have a hard time using regular mice for any period of time since the free scrolling feature is very convenient, especially on win10 with Word documents.I use the three device feature very frequently, between personal computers and a work laptop while working from home. The Options software is great for expanding the usage of the mouse, especially reassigning functions or keypresses on the mouse, all on a per-program basis. Some light keyboard/mouse gaming is great with Options and this mouse to assign specific keypresses depending on the game.My work laptop doesn't allow for use of the Options software but despite that this mouse is still absolutely stellar for daily use. Sure, I can't use Options to allow me to use the side scroll wheel on Excel but that's not too big of a deal for me.Great mouse through and through, so much so that after using it for a year I decided to get MX Keys and the two together are amazing for work and personal use.Can't recommend this one enough. Just get it.

Very good mouse - ergonomic and long lasting battery.  Thumb-roller thing and other buttons appear to not function and there are no instructions on how to program them.  Very surprised that Logitech advertises the programmability of these devices (same for MX KEYS keyboard) but does not provide instructions for such programming.  Their links only go to sales promotions - not instructions.  Shame on Logitech.  Good mouse if you can afford it - it's overpriced.

Logitech used to sell larger mice with their keyboard and mouse bundles.  I have several older mice that fit great in my hand but are aging.  The newer mice that came with my most recent bundle purchases are too small for my hand and start to hurt after a while.  I don’t have carpal tunnel but am almost there due to many years of working on computers.  This mouse is exactly what I was looking for, it’s better for larger hands, it’s very smooth, has all of the buttons of a higher end mouse, and it connects via Bluetooth or Unifying Receiver.  I like the USB Unifying Receiver because I keep it plugged into a docking station that I use for 2 different laptops and they both recognize the mouse immediately after I plug in.  I also like the fact that it charges via USB rather than rechargeable batteries.  The only issue here is the price tag but should be worth it considering how long Logitech products last.
I tried a gaming mouse first, but that was just too clumsy for me. But this Logitech is just fine. Very comfortable.
very comfortable to use. battery lasts long.  clicks feel great. one down side is that the bottom surface  gets scratches pretty easily.
I like this mouse a lot and it works great across three devices with ease.  Ergonomic, looks good, and feels great.

I'm very disappointed. A mouse should be invisible, but this keeps freezing and locking up. Tech support recommends a USB extension due to USB noise. If that's the case, it should have been included.
The build quality and feel are great but mean nothing if it doesn't work.
The battery is soo good

I bought a new M1 Mac Mini and needed a new mouse and keyboard. I went for Logitech for both. I have the MX Master at the office and I got this for home to work remotely. I love this mouse. If you are having trouble deciding between this mouse and any other on the market, choose this one. You will not be disappointed.
Works well and fits my hand nicely.

Had this mouse now for a few months now, after using apple's magic mouse for quite a number of years. WHY did I not have this long time? Doing graphic design and photo editing....it's definitely definitely worth every penny.BUY IT! TRUST ME! YOU WON'T REGRET IT!!!!

I bought this one after giving up on my MX Vertical mouse, which was comfy but tends to get in the way and get knocked over on my desk a lot.I use my MX Master 3 with MacBook Pro (Big Sur) and also in Windows 10 via Parallels 16 virtual machine. My desktop is white laminate. No problems there. No issues with bluetooth connection or battery life. I don't use the USB. And I haven't been throwing it into my backpack to work remotely since the COVID lockdown. At least it's more portable than MX Vertical.I don't do gaming but I do a lot of architectural modeling with Revit. Precise control of the cursor and scroll wheel are essential. For me, the MX doesn't offer enough adjustment for the scroll wheel speed nor acceleration. In fact I had to uninstall the Logi software because the settings didn't have the same results in Mac and Win apps. Whether this is a Logi problem or Parallels, I don't know. It helps to simply use the Windows and Mac internal mouse drivers. So maybe their software could use improving?Ergonomically, it fits my average size male adult hand very well but I find the right button too easy to trigger by mistake. Tactile feedback seems better for left-click than right-click.I like the tactile feedback of the scroll wheel - and the smooth scroll feature. I don't use the additional wheel next to my thumb, nor the two adjacent buttons.Overall, it's pretty decent hardware. I think the biggest issue is Logi software.Hope this helps.

I had the original MX master and thoroughly wore that out, somehow ended up with a hole that kept growing near where the thumb sits so figured it was time for an upgrade.This one is just as good, nice metal scroll wheels feel more high end.  Ergonomics are perfect.I've been spoiled using logitechs for the past 20 years or so exclusively and had to use a crappy work mouse recently and that just helped me confirm why I need to stick with the logitechs ,they're the best.This one has a nice matte finish on it, just a subtle texture.It glides really easy.  Thumbs up all around.I use it for precise mouse work, illustrator, photoshop stuff and it has just the right weight to move easily, but not too flimsy where you throw it around too much like the cheapo mice.

I didn't buy from Amazon. But I wanted people to know that the horizontal scroll does not work 50% of the time. It is stupidly intermittent for no apparent reason. It's possibly a software bug because it starts to work when you scroll manually. I bought this mouse ONLY for horizontal scroll but now I'm terribly disappointed. Raised the issue with Logitech to no avail, but learned that this is a widespread issue. It's possible that many don't notice it, because they don't use horizontal scroll often. If you need horizontal scroll, look away, DONT BUY THIS MOUSE.

I have been using the MX family mouse (mice?) since they have been released.This continues the tradition of a solid mouse that is comfortable to use with all the functionality you will need.  Note, I do not game that much but when I do the mouse works fine, no noticeable lag.One mention that I didn't realize till after ordering is that the mouse comes with and charges with a USB to USB-C cable.  Just a heads up in case you didn't see it when looking through the descriptions.
