I'm not sure what the other reviewers are complaining about. The dongle is USB, not USB-C? OMG the world is falling apart!The scroll wheels are amazing - the main one has a cool ratchet feel that just stops when you tap it in motion. I can't imagine going back to regular scroll wheels. The horizontal wheel is also great for those long spreadsheets you need to scroll horizontally. I don't use it for gaming, but for desktop work, it's fantastic.The battery life is incredible. It tracks on glass. Works out of the box on Linux. What more do you want?
It's a great mouse that does nice mouse things. It's super comfortable too and the ability to connect and switch between multiple computers is a great feature!
This fits my hand really well and lets me maneuver with many customizable buttons. Works well navigating windows and apps in Windows 10.  I gave it 1 for gaming because i don't game!

-It might be ergonomic but it doesnt feel like it.-I know its more recommended for ppl that actually do work like editing, excel sheets or w/e but with such good reviews I thought I'd give it a try as a daily gaming mouse but it doesn't really work for me.-I mainly bought it because of carpal tunnel issues but even then It still drags my wrist and pinky (still get pain from carpal tunnel)
item returned due to incompatibility with Mac OS.

This Logitech MX Master 3 mouse is the latest iteration of several MC mice I've had over the past several years, for use with both Windows and Mac devices. I'm not a gamer and mostly use my PCs for running relatively standard office apps, specialized financial apps, managing my music and photo libraries, email, and surfing the Web. I recently purchased this mouse for use with my nearly "new" 2019 27" iMac, running Mac OS 11 ("Big Sur"). The mouse seems fine 80-90% of the time but periodically freezes up until I pick it up and fiddle with it. I've tried deleting and reinstalling the device, yet the issues quickly reappear. At least for now, I've put it away and reverted to my Apple "Magic Mouse," which doesn't display the same issues. Until I encounter a definite need I will probably stick with the Apple mouse because, as they say in the commercials, "It just works." I'll probably keep the MX Master 3 in reserve as a backup.
super  comfortable

Charge time last for weeks; and the included charging cable makes it easy. The sidescroll wheel has become a necessity for work, and I purchased a 2nd mouse for home. Will definitely buy again.Occasional connectivity issues while gaming, so I still use a wired mouse for that application. That is the only issue.

What can I say that hasn't already been said? I'm just here to basically confirm that what other people are saying about this mouse is true. The experience I've had using this mouse with Logitech Flow: seamless. I use it between my MacBook Pro and my Windows NUC. It makes the perfect pair to my MX keyboard, I had to buy both. Although I can't say the same for the keyboard, this mouse is everything I need it to be.

I'll start by saying I absolutely love the feel of this mouse and the ideas behind it. The customization is awesome. However, and it's a HUGE however, when I went to play Cyberpunk 2077 (basically the reason I chose this time to upgrade my mouse) the extra buttons do not register AT ALL! Even the middle mouse button does not register! Now you're thinking, well just assign them keystrokes. I thought the same... that doesn't work either. I am so, so disappointed that I can't use this wonderful looking/feeling mouse for what I intended. I've searched all over forums and don't see any fixes for this.
Great for most all tasks on a computer... it works okay for gaming but it isn’t really built specifically for that.

I want this mouse to be everything it promises to be. However, the back and forward buttons don't do anything on my mac. To solve this, I downloaded Logitech's control center software. The software gives no help on pairing the device. I have my mouse paired to my computer AND plugged in with the USB dongle. Still, the software says it's unable to find any Logitech devices. It's pretty bad when their own software can't even recognize their own devices. Naturally, Logitech's documentation online is abysmal, and so far after an hour of research, my buttons still don't work! For such an expensive mouse, this is a really terrible user experience. I will consider returning this item if I can't get this working like I want.

This was a wonderful mouse when it still worked.When you pick it up for the first time, you can really feel the eloquence of the MX Master 3. Using it as a productivity tool is a dream and you can easily tell how much effort Logitech put into the R&D of this mouse. So it’s really unfortunate that I have to write this and discourage others from buying it.Like some commenters have already expressed, there’s a defect with the magspeed scroll wheel that Logitech seemingly does not want to address. After using it for a little under a year, the scroll wheel started to get a bit loose and make an acute grating noise with each flick. This was only noticeable in ‘ratchet mode,’ but unfortunately that’s the only mode I use the mouse on. I reached out to Logitech customer service hoping to get a replacement since it was under their 1 year warranty.After talking with a rep and even sending them a video of the issue, they wrote back and said that it was not enough evidence provided to move forward with my claim. This was really surprising as I did not expect to get push back from a company as large as Logitech when there’s video evidence of the issue of their product.I bought this very early in its release and unfortunately I did not listen to the warnings other users gave. This is a great mouse, but it’s just not durable... for $100, I would have hoped that it would last me longer than a year. If you’re in the market for a mouse, I would stay away from the MX Master 3, or maybe even Logitech as a company...
I work in Photoshop and Premiere quite a bit and this mouse just makes my life easier. Thank you Logi. Thank you. Plus it works on my glass desk with no issues at all. I LOVE IT.

Update:I ordered a different Bluetooth dongle by Avantree as a last minute Hail Mary and it has resolved all my issues!!!!This is amazing to me because my other Bluetooth devices, ear buds etc worked fine with my previous adapter. I wish there was a better rating system or quality control on Bluetooth adapters. Reviews are deceiving, my first adaptor got good reviews as well.Old:It connects via Bluetooth straight away, but disconnects often.  I have to disable and re-enable my Bluetooth to get it to connect and work again.  Which means I have to keep a second mouse connected just so that I can reconnect this mouse when it fails.  I don't think it's worth it!!!!!  A mouse is only good if it actually works.I read one that said to disable the logitech download assistant which is loaded as a device.  When you do this the middle button no longer works - so for me that is not a solution.  LIke most big companies Logitech has gotten away from customer support in favor of letting their customers support each other.  So I will probably return this.  So sad.

When you have Logitech options software installed and when it is working, it's fanastic!  You can seamlessly switch from PC to PC by merely moving your mouse.  However, I found that it only works about 80% of the time.  The other 20%, you have to manually switch.  Why is the switch at the bottom of the mouse?  You now need to pick up the mouse and turn it over to switch it. I am constantly switching between the 2 PCs, so this is a hassle I don't want to deal with.  At least they could have included software to relocate the button.  If switching worked 95% of the time and the switch button was on top, I would give it 5 stars.
My definitely best choice for work.

The scroll wheel is awful.  A gentle touch spins it SO fast and it careens down the page at breakneck speed and you have no idea where you were or where you are.  And if you change the settings to "regular" scroll, it gets hung up and scatters all over the place.  It's a miserable experience.So here's my advice if you're considering buying this thing:Spend $99 on a bath of ice water and soak in it for 3 hours.  It would be less painful than using this awful mouse.

I was really looking forward to this mouse.  Unfortunately it's too small for my hand and I am starting to have hand and wrist pain since using it!  Wish I could return it for a larger mouse that is less painful.

I bought a cheap wireless mouse and it worked for less than a week before it just decided to stop.Finally I spent the money on a good mouse and I am really happy that I did. I use this mouse with a 2017 Macbook Air and the process has been seamless. The tracking is smooth and it feels comfortable in my hand. I can't remember if I had to setup some software after plugging in the dongle but either way the connection was relatively painless. I highly recommend it

I've tried several ergonomic mouses for my arthritic thumb joint.  This one feels great, no issues with prolonged use! I feels great in your hand - very natural. The horizontal scroll feature is cool. The vertical scroll is almost too fast.

I needed to replace my beloved Logitech MX1100, which gave up the ghost after 11 years of reliable service.  I was skeptical that the MX Master 3 would be a suitable replacement.  But, I've been very pleased.  Feels great in my hand.  Smooth on the pad.  Responsive controls.  Long battery life.  Accurate for pixel-by-pixel photo editing.  And very customizable too.
Pros: high ergonomics, flexible button settings. connection to 3 devices with seamless switching, rechargeable battery.Cons: not found during 2 months.

I have the previous model on my home computer, so naturally I needed to buy one for the office.  I do like this more then the old model because the wheel is better, the thumb buttons are easier to hit.  The "undo redo" buttons are great in word, but the thumb down will pull up all your windows (WINDOWS + TAB).  Really nice to have the more universal USB-C charging port.  I love how fast the mouse curser is, but somehow you still have the control you want.I'm more of a console gaming person, so I asked my snobby PC gaming buddy what he thinks; naturally he says the mouse isn't great for gaming.  Well I work in windows and spreadsheets all day and I think its fantastic.  Plus you have to factor in that he spends all his time watching twitch and not actually playing, so... well you know.
Really great mouse/keyboard combo for developers, lots of customization. I removed the auto scroll features because they were jaggy, responds nicely now

I've had and used this mouse for almost a year now for everything outside of gaming, and I'm pretty sure I've needed to charge it maybe 3 times? That alone is pretty incredible, but the scroll wheel is so satisfying that switching to any other mouse is so jarring. The rubberized finish is very comfortable, and definitely feels premium in a way that's hard to describe. This is not a gaming mouse by any means, nor was it intended to serve that function. It's too heavy for FPS titles, and the software is not geared towards gamers in any way. I intend on updating this review in a year or two if the battery life drastically decreases, but I consider this to be the best daily driver mouse for everyone that isn't primarily looking for something gaming-oriented. $100 is quite pricey, but if it lasts, then it's well worth the money.

Ive been using this thing for a month or so for just school work. Works awesome. Have not needed to charge it. The programmable buttons are WONDERFUL. I have the two thumb ones programed to copy and paste which saves so much time moving around notes and text. You can even program them to do different stuff in different apps. I use anki (Flashcard program) a-lot, specifically the cloze cards. So I have a button that I programed to do the key stokes to "cloze" a piece of text when using the anki app. But it will do the normal function I programed in all other apps.
I saw some people online say they didn't like how big and chunky it was and that it felt too big for their hand. but I have had no problem with that. (With my average sized female hands) Feels perfect to me, so maybe just a preference thing.Don't know anything about gaming so no idea how it works in that department!Only critique is that I feel like the sliding/switching windows gesture is not as smooth as I would wish. But it still works fine. I would also love to see them add a zoom wheel on the next version, but again, totally fine with out one. I just use my magic mouse pad for zooming into stuff.Anyways, 100$ is super expensive for a mouse, but its a solid buy if you are into having extra nice office gadgets with cool features! Logitech is always top notch.
I purchased this product to help me with pain in my wrist because I work all day on the computer. So far it is working well For me and I see a difference.

I bought this mouse partly because I had heard great things about the scroll wheel, but having tried it, I'm very confused.It's pretty neat that it can switch between modes, but the basic scrolling functionality is hopelessly unreliableAs I scroll up and down a web page, about 1 in 5 of my scrolls simply don't register, or are much smaller than the others. This is true even when I disable the "smart switch" feature, and try to mess with other settings. This erases pretty much all other advantages of the scrollwheel and mouse, because an unreliable scrollwheel is just maddening.I think Logitech tried hard here, but the tech isn't ready for prime-time. I'm sending mine back.

I expected this mouse to be great, as someone who has used Logitech mice forever. I have been using a wired G502 for years and wanted to go bluetooth, so this seemed like a good one to go for on my work computer. Problem is, this mouse's features apparently only work if you have the Logitech software. If you work for any competent org, installing third party software is a no go, thus I cannot install the Logitech software for this which controls all the functions of this mouse.On the very old G502, it has on board memory so you can set it on another computer and it retains the programming. I assumed it was a given this was a feature of the MX Master. It is not. It does not remember the sensitivity, programming, or anything from computer to computer (I put the software on my personal computer). Even after that software was installed, the gestures did not work, the horizontal scrolling did nothing anywhere I used it.Ergonomically, the mouse feels too tall. The scroll wheel has a weird electronic braking system that changes on the fly if it's click detent or free spinning which seems highly prone to failure. The forward/back buttons are very hard to press with the thumb. And the mouse feels way too heavy, and I usually never cared that much about the weight of a mouse.For the price I expected way better. I would not be happy with this at even half the price. Returning to get a wireless gaming mouse that retains the settings with onboard memory. Buyer beware on the MX Master.

Love this mouse. It fits your hand (no matter what grip style) like a glove. There are SO many features that you can customize - this mouse is a must for office workers looking for more productivity, swiftness, and ease of use in a mouse.I use with my laptop and it makes every task easier - whether it be done online, with excel, word... anything.Battery life is crazy long. Make sure to download the app and customize features for each app, depending on what works best and helps most for you.

I use this mouse for landscape drafting in an office setting. It works flawlessly and I suffer much less wrist and hand fatigue than I did with my former mouse (Logitech Anywhere MX). I would recommend this mouse to anyone who spend most of their workday on a computer.

I honestly loved this the first time I bought it in July 2020. It's now November 2020 and I'm having scrolling issues.Apparently, it happens with all the MX Mice through Logitech, eventually, the scrolling feels like it's catching on. something rather than that smooth fast scroll you felt when you first unbox it.

Does not work with latest iMac or macOS. Spent hours trying to troubleshoot but it is hopeless to get it to work reliably. A $100 mouse needs to work 100% of the time. Scrolling is completely unreliable and only works about 80% of the time. The fluid transition between computers is great in theory but only works about 50% of the time.

Pros: It has great ergonomic features, feels premium, and for developers the ability to scroll horizontally is fantastic.Con: For the price point, I expected it to last more than a year. After only 3 months, the mouse began to develop lagging issues. Tested it with both of my laptops (Mac & Windows), and it still lagged on both. The only way to get it to stop lagging was to plug it in with the wire. I'm assuming the bluetooth software for it is bad.
Super comfortable and worth the cost
It fits my hand also you don't have to charge it for long periods of time.
The gestures on the thumb are the best part, switching between windows and going into mission control is something I use a lot. The mouse is well built and feels good in my hand.

Just like the Logitech  MX Keys, this is very well built and has a premium feel and construction.  Not the cheapest, but you get what you pay for.  Not a cheap/plastic feeling mouse.  I like that it can also control multiple computers with the flip of a button.
Has more than enough controls and flexiblies to handle any job.
I am on a computer nearly 8+ hours a day for work and school and this mouse is everything I could've dreamed of.  I would recommend this mouse to anyone who values productivity.
Super ergonomic mouse.If you have big hands like me and work in the computer all day and/or design like me this is a great purchase

The front right lower corner, where your ring finger rests against the side, now slants upward. With their old designs, that front right corner plastic went all the way down to the table. Now my ring finger is uncomfortable as it rests against it. Fail. I'll bet the designers thought it looked cooler and edgier with that corner slanting up.

This mouse replaced the Logitech Performance MX that I had for many years. I don’t understand why Logitech would remove one programmable button in a new model like the MX Master 3, and also make the product less ergonomic.Now the MX Master 3 is fine enough, better than the competition. Mac owners should be aware that to program the buttons requires you to go to the Security preferences of the Mac OS and grant the Logitech Options permission to allow the programming. There is zero mention of this in the written materials and on-line, which makes me wonder if Logitech uses their own products. The good news is that the on-line product support chat rep figured this out, though it took a half hour of playing 20 questions to get there.The battery life of this mouse is significantly improved over the MX and that is what’s keeping the product on my desk instead of my ordering a same-priced unopened  MX. But I may still do that. . . .

Decent mouse, however the right click button is so sensitive that I find myself accidentally right clicking all the time. I have used it for about a month and I am having a hard time adjusting. I use it mainly for architectural modeling and drafting.

Coming to this from a couple pre-master equivalents, the most had good ergonomics, sitting a bit taller than my performance mouse MX and much taller than MX revolution. The mouse wheel is great.The logitech options software is a bit annoying to work with coming from their last generation software but seems to be slightly more capable.

I have carpal tunnel from working with mice in the IT Industry for years. I researched and found that this could (and later would) be a solution for my aching hands.1. It fits great in your palm, the ergonomics are fantastic.2. Works great on Mac, never had a problem where it didn't immediately connect to my Mac Device on boot. Even when I had a software upgrade to Big Sur, recognized it immediately. Didn't have to worry about having to find a wired mouse to connect to my CPU to get past the login screen at all.3. The scroll wheel on top can be adjusted via the Logi Options application to increase or decrease the scroll speed. Also, if you can unlock the click detent by pressing on the button behind the wheel. I hate detents when I scroll, so a freewheeling scroll wheel does away with the annoying clicking sound as you scroll back and forth.Notes:To really support your wrists, get a Belkin mouse pad with wrist rest and place it down, put the mouse on it to operate. Your wrists will thank you.Logi Options application needs to be downloaded from the web. Make sure it is the Mac version. Once you install go to your security settings and all the Logitech application to control your mouse. This allows all the customization functions, and there are many, to work with many 3rd party applications. You will learn all about this in the Logitech application.

Logitech ended support for the mouse I have used for years and years (MX500 corded mouse) with Big Sur. As I will eventually be forced to install that OS, I had to have an ergonomic mouse that had programmable buttons, and this one looked the best. Unfortunately, (and it doesn't say this in the docs anywhere) unlike the old Logitech system, the left and right switches on the top, which I had programmed the left as "single click" and the right as "double click", cannot be programmed. I. Am. Not. Happy. With. Logitech. I have no idea what the battery life will be like, I'll edit the review when I know more. But Logitech, your products rock, but guess which finger?

Do not know what happened to the Logitech I used to know.  No User Manual, minimal instruction in hieroglyphics I could not decipher, scrambled instruction on the webpage, software you are supposed to download not linked or easily found, searching for answers on website just results in no response or more questions as you enter a loop of selections taking you back the start.Regardless how good this product might be, it is not worth the struggle.  YouTube which normally provides good advice reaches the same conclusion.  They also suggest leaving the keyboard plugged in as it will only last a week on a fully charged battery. Going back to Logitech.
Once you get used to the momentum scroll you can't live without it, and this one does it better than any.

I've been a Logitech M705 mouse user for the last several years. I upgraded to this Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless Mouse based on a recommendation from a reputable computer company (System 76). The mouse fits my hand comfortably, is very smooth to use, and provides the optimal tactile response as far as buttons and scrolling. I use this mouse with a gel wrist pad and leather mouse pad.I also upgraded my keyboard from a Logitech K710 to an MX Keys Advanced Wireless Keyboard (and Logitech wrist pad for thin keyboards), and am also pleasantly surprised with the keyboard's solid metal construction, smooth and well-defined key response, and smart back lighting. Both the keyboard and mouse use a USB-C connected re-chargeable battery; haven't had them long enough to determine time between recharges.Both items were purchased as separate orders from Amazon direct (Amazon.com Services LLC), and both arrived on-time and in perfect condition.
I have one at work and one at home and this is the second one of these I purchased for use at work.  Used the first for several years until the batteries wouldn't hold a charge any longer.

Enjoyed it while it lasted, but after about a year it randomly loses connection or the cursor will jump around the screen between points instead of a smooth motion. Have to replace it now and absolutely not worth the price for only a year.

Ive had a MX master for several years and its a game changer. I love the mouse, have a travel case, and cant imagine using anything else. My issue comes from the fact that the dongle quit working out of nowhere and the bluetooth has to be reset almost everytime I use it. Luckily it pairs quickly but its annoying. It does stay charged forever and I probably only do it once every three months. Anyways, I am considering getting newest model to see if connections are fixed. The fact that its not usb-c boggles my mind though.

Coming from a standard wired mouse this was the perfect upgrade. I understand that those upgrading from prior versions may have their gripes and therefore provide a negative review, but trust me, do not let them allow you to miss out on this beauty.Connecting to the three devices via Bluetooth was a breeze, and switching between them is very simple. It does take some getting use to lifting and clicking, but not bad.I use Visual Studio Code a lot and was able to set the buttons to app specific shortcuts and that has been a navigation game changer.I personally would not recommend it for gaming, but you can set one of the buttons to change the dpi “similar” to the G502. I haven’t tested that yet but I did see the option.Finally the software is very user friendly and the scroll wheel is amazing. So if you are upgrading from a standard mouse I would highly recommend this mouse.
Best mouse ever.

I have used this mouse for few weeks now and love it except the plastic used on the main buttons is already showing significant wear. I wish they would have made those out of aluminum. For $100 it should be made out of better materials.

The mouse is feels really nice with the grip. I really like the wireless feature. The battery last pretty long. I haven’t charge it yet since my first charge. He scroll is very good. One of the best mouse I ever used.

Best mouse I have ever used. I use the mouse on ble and Mac in clamshell mode, and use this mouse along with a touch pad, ble headphones, and ble keyboard daily. Only quirk is that it cannot be used right when you turn your Mac on from being powered off (I think because ble is turned on only after your user is logged in), so now I just keep my Mac in sleep mode. Logitech also has an app that updates your mouse and loads custom profiles that customize what the side buttons do in different apps which is pretty sweet.
Battery keeps going flat.  After charging for hours the longest charge lasted 15 days.  Horizontal scroll is awkward (I think it's backwards)  Swing and a miss there Logitech!

Much more ergonomic than the MX anywhere (probably obviously). That extra space for ergonomics allows for the space needed for some extra buttons and wheels that are completely customizable. Works beautifully on my macbook pro. I did misunderstand the gesture button at first though, I thought it was intended to be used like a magic mouse where you swipe on the little marker on the mouse itself, but the intended use, is to press the button while gesturing with the mouse, so mac users be aware of that, or like me you'll think the gestures aren't working LOL ;)
The battery life is incredible. The bluetooth connectivity is fool-proof. Pointer accuracy is great. The only improvement I could offer would be adjustable weight. It's a bit light for my preference.

This mouse feels and works great. I transitioned from the Logitech MK550 so it’s definitely an improvement in ergonomics. The shape feels natural especially for a palm gripper like myself. I like that the right side is not pinched in like other devices so I don’t add strain to my ring and pinky fingers from pinching inward. The size is perfect for my medium sized hands as well. My really like the texture of the mouse. It’s not the standard super smooth plastic that most mouses are made with. The buttons are somewhat textured so your fingers grip them better and the whole palm section has a slight rubberized feeling. I especially like the thumb groove that has an obvious texture that not only looks neat, it feels nice. My favorite additions to this mouse are the forward/backward buttons and the left/right scroll. The scrolling wheel is super fast which a bit odd to get used to but it has a nice feel and it isn’t noisy like my old mouse, so that’s awesome. If you frequently do work in drafting/sketching programs like I do, you’ll definitely benefit from having a comfortable and efficient mouse like this one.

The Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless Mouse is pricey but it's a very good mouse.
It's more comfortable than my Logitech M720 Triathlon.PROS:Works on 3 different devices.Very comfortableWorks well on various surfaces.CONS:Rather Pricey.Battery Life could be longer.Button to switch between 3 different devices is inconveniently located on the bottom of the MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless Mouse. The M720 had the device selector button top left side and was a much more convenient.

I have used allot of different mice from many different companies, including Logitech.  This is in fact the best mouse I have ever used, period.  It fits my hand perfectly and almost seems like a natural extension.  The contour, button location and clicking all feel top notch.This mouse is a little pricey of others that are out there.  I thought long and hard about spending this much for a mouse, but I am glad I did as it was well worth it.

I like the fact is it BT and supported by Windows, MacOS and Linux.I'm using this on a Linux video editing computer. The mouse support is built ino the kernel, so it is fully supported. I like the fact that every feature is customizable and usable in Linux.I use it on Linux system for video editing, my wife presses the button on the bottom and it is paired on her Windows machine and another press is paired to her Mac in all cases the rollers and buttons are mapped differently and does not interfere if one of the other machines is in use as it is seen as a different BT device for all 3 devices due to the selector button.
Easy to connect, very easy to use, I recommend this mouse
The only thing I do not like is that the right and left click buttons are a little too easy to accidentally hit.
Forward and Back buttons don't work on Macintosh. Garbage product for $100.
Excellent functionality and ergonomics. Not for gaming.
Thanks Chris for the recommendation, I bought 2!
Always loyal to Logitech mouse
#NAME?

I was using the Mac Mouse for years and continued to be frustrated with recurring issues. I finally broke down and moved out of the Apple ecosystem and tried the MX Master 3. My only complaint- I didn’t switch years ago!

I read all the reviews and was really excited about getting this mouse, but ended up returning it after trying it out for 4 days.  I just couldn't get used to the size and way it felt in my hand.  My wrist also started hurting by day 3 after normal usage, which would only happen after VERY extended work sessions with my previous mouse.  I also hated the highly touted mouse wheel sensitive shift, or whatever it was they call it...Whenever I tried using the wheel, it just felt inaccurate and really laggy.  I played around with the settings quite a bit as well, trying pretty much every combination to make it work.  I REALLY wanted to like this mouse!  But after 4 days, I'm officially giving up on it.  I know it can take a few days to get used to a new mouse, but after switching back to my old one for a quick minute, I just don't see the point of suffering any longer.I don't doubt this is a perfectly good mouse for some people.  I'm sure some people absolutely love it.  It just wasn't for me...

It's still early days, but the MX mouse seens great. It fits my big hand beautifully and the scroll wheel works great. I love the accelerometer function so I can spin it slowely and the screen moves almost pixel by pixel and as I start spinning it faster, the screen moves much faster. It's much more precise than Apple's Magic Mouse 2 that I had been using. The Logitech driver/app seems to work seemlessly and I can program special functions in Photoshop that work with the extra keys and side wheel on the mouse. So far this is terrific.
I was having a number of problems with my logitech connections - mouse and keyborard.  This particular mouse eliminated all of my problems - likely with the new Logitech Receiver.

The "masters series" (and I include MX Master Keys keyboard as well) sound great. Lots of customizable buttons, able to control three screens and more. But only if they connect to your computer. Some days they do. More often they do not. I recently had a delightful stretch of about 8 days where they both remained connected and I love them. Then yesterday, nothing. Can't reconnect. Can't repair. Tried everything Logitech suggested (e.g., battery life, reinstalling LogiOptions, etc). -- nothing. Right now, both are unusable. I don't know if Apple changed something or if Logitech did, but a 50-50  connectivity likelihood has now dropped to 0-100 and I cannot devote more than 2 hours in a day to trying to connect my mouse and keyboard. I hate the result but have to tell the truth -- they are now both unusable. I will try again in a few weeks and hopefully somebody has updated the software on device or laptop to fix this problem. (and to prove the point, it happens on two different laptops so I know its not a problem with one of them). Logitech: HELP!
Use it across multiple devices and its fantastic.Couldn't get the transfer between computer feature to work but probably because of my network setup.
Battery life is incredibly long.  Matched it with MX Keys and that was the best tech upgrade I've made.

This mouse is extremely comfortable. I use it for work, I love the side scroll for spreadsheets navigation as I spend most of my day in them. This mouse can be used for gaming, but personally its too heavy for my liking. I like a very light mouse for fast paced games like FPS's. If you are a casual gamer, this is just fine and I did use it for a short time with no issues. Overall I have used this mouse for months, I do not regret paying the price. It feels of high quality, works of high quality, and is high quality. If you spend a lot of time using a mouse day to day, this is absolutely worth it.
so i dont know why it makes you think its quiet, its not quiet just fyi its a real loud click
Highly recommend for an ergonomic mouse that works well with Mac products. REALLY enjoy using this mouse.

The mouse is pretty expensive, but I finally made the decision to purchase this because I considered the number of times I use a mouse. It's really comfortable to use, and all the extra programmable buttons really make a difference, though it takes some time to adjust to using these instead of doing what you would normally do. The biggest difference is the infinite scroll wheel, it makes scrolling through pages is so effortless. Once you get used to it, it makes it difficult to use any other since most other mice are lacking in comparison.
This thing is fantastic. Love using it.
Love the MX Master 3.  Best one I the market now.  Expensive, yes but the features and the build quality is top-notch.  Pretty good investment for productivity gains.

I work across multiple computers and monitors, the Bluetooth connectivity and new SetPoint module with the new FLOW software allow me to work across 3 computers without having to push switches or buttons. Yes there is an option to work it that way, but FLOW in OPTIONS software is AWESOME. YOU NEED THIS MOUSE.

How are there reviews other than 5 stars on this mouse?  It is comfortable, premium feeling, and unbelievably customizable.  Bluetooth functions perfect as well as the unifying receiver.  I could not get the mouse to show up in Logitech Options when connected via Bluetooth for some strange reason.  And yes I had the most current version of Options downloaded, but it worked fine with the USB unifying receiver so oh well.  This thing could be $200 and it would be worth it.

Buggy. Horizontal scroll doesn’t work with all apps, and with the ones it does it can be intermittent. Switching between devices is super convenient but maybe once a month the connection drops and I have to reboot to get it working again. Save your money; not worth $100. At this price point it should be flawless.
I bought this mouse for photo editing, but it's also been great for general use. Very comfortable and very precise - I love it!
Fantastic mouse. Works excellently.  No complaints

This is a great mouse - comfortable, ergonomic, and has plenty of buttons.  The one downside is the default behavior of the scroll wheel sucks.  The weird hybrid "scroll fast enough to turn on free scroll" is too sensitive.  Fortunately you can disable this with Logitech's configuration software.  I would recommend the mouse, and also recommend installing Logitech's software to make it work like you'd expect.
This is the mouse to own for witless and wired combo . Also has click wheel action while scrolling or silence buttery smooth scrolling . Fit is really good and weighted
This mouse has given much relief to my hand...especially my thumb! So glad I purchased it.
Just amazing!

Ive been using Logitech mice for years & they've done the job no problem, but the more basic ones. I saw this mouse at my local Best Buy one day, put my hand on it & instantly loved the shape & comfort of it. My hand fits perfectly on it & just bought it last week. I love how it has a built-in rechargeable battery as all of my previous mice used two AA batteries. It's on the expensive side compared with most other mice, but totally worth it!
Super easy to setup.  It can be paired with 3 different devices and switching between them is super easy.  Great ergonomic design

I am a graphics designer and a photographer, so I went for this mouse the second I saw it advertised, since it's supposedly made specifically for Macs.
This mouse is horrendous. The Bluetooth connection abilities this mouse has in 2020 reminds me those days where Bluetooth started to appear in the scene.The main issue is that his mouse totally disrupts the Bluetooth connection on the mac. So, if I connect it directly to the Mac Bluetooth, it randomly drops, but it brings down every other thing that is connected to the Mac's Bluetooth... This lasts for around 30 seconds, and then everything comes back again to normal.This happens constantly. Randomly.Now, if I connect it to the Unifier (The Bluetooth Dongle that comes with the mouse), then the defect changes a bit. The randomness persists, but this time it doesn't drops, instead it jitters, have weird hiccups where the mouse stutters for around 30 seconds and then comes back to normal. In this case, the Mac Bluetooth is not affected and everything else keeps working just fine.It's extremely annoying to be working and having to randomly wait for 30 seconds for the thing to come back. Or having it stutter all over the place.Don't buy it. I've been in contact with Logitec for two months now, and they have no idea of what is going on with this item. They want me to return it and get a new one... that's after weeks dealing with them.Awful product

I'm using this mouse with an iMac and I can tell you, without doubt, this is the best mouse I've ever used. It's sturdy and well built and the scroll wheels work perfectly.The only slight complaint is the back and forward buttons are a bit hard to press but it doesn't bother me that much.All in all, a great mouse.

What else can be said?  Ive never had issues with the Logitech mice/keyboard combos I buy; this was no exception.It is the top of the line productivity and art mouse for this form-factor.  It is ergonomic and large enough for my hands.  The finish feels great, smooth and comfortable, yet grippy enough that it feels secured under your hand without holding tight at all. Aesthetically it looks fantastic, matches the MX Keys, obviously and they match myPD2700U DesignVue Designer Monitor perfectly, especially for a minimalist desk setup.As a digital artist/photographer I recommend this mouse for the enthusiasts who can afford the premium price to the professionals looking for an upgrade.

Let me start by saying that I am somewhat of a Logitech mouse fan boy. By far, I have yet to find a mouse that comes close to Logitech in terms of price and quality. I've owned an MX Master 2s for over 3 years and recently picked up a G305 for gaming purposes. I needed a new workstation mouse since after 3 years of use and abuse, the soft rubber exterior was starting to deteriorate.I really wanted to love the MX Master 3, the new scroll wheels are noticeably better than its predecessor, and I think it looks better as well. I wasn't crazy about the new shape of it (your palm will sit at about a 30 degree angle rather than flat.) but that was not a deal breaker to me.What was a deal breaker however was the terrible friction of the mousepads on the mouse. One of the things I love about my other Logitech mice is that they feel completely frictionless. The MX Master 3 was more comparable to a $20 mouse, which is a shame, since I truly liked the rework of the scroll wheels and buttons on the mouse. I'd like to believe that maybe my mouse is just defective, but based on some other reviews, I don't think that's the case. If you're looking for the ultimate workstation mouse, I'd save yourself 20 bucks and go with this mouse's predecessor. I hope in a future release they can fix this problem and keep the new scroll wheels, that'd be awesome!

I was so excited to get this and try out all of the features.  Unfortunately, it actually became painful to use because I learned I have "small hands".  My husband is using it now and loves it.  Wish it came in different sizes like some other brands.

After returning one and getting a second one with the same issue, I now believe that this mouse has a design flaw. When scrolling with the main mouse scroll wheel while it is in 'click' mode, scrolling up fast causes a slipping, making it frustratingly difficult to scroll quickly to the top of a long page. while spinning the wheel up, the page just sticks for moments then continues up a bit, then sticks again. Pretty frustrating and amazing that this snuck by their quality control. It works relatively well with the wheel in smooth-scroll mode so if that's the mode you prefer anyway, you might be fine with this mouse. I do enjoy the ergonomics (seems that it would be good for big hands as well as small) and it's cool that you can control 3 different computers with it and the programmable buttons are great. But for $100, the mouse needs to at least cover the basics well, and that scrolling issue is a deal breaker for me.

As of this morning, 7 days past Amazon's return window, this mouse started malfunctioning. The cursor jumps around randomly, quivers back and forth in one spot, "phantom clicks" things so things start opening by themselves, won't allow me to click on something as nothing happens when I do click, and the cursor resizes randomly as well, like it's magnified. The feel of the mouse is great and it's more accurate and faster, but it's rendered useless when this malfunction occurs. Amazon, of course, said "too bad pal - contact Logitech" and I will do that, but I anticipate little to no help from that giant corporation. We'll see. If I connect a corded USB mouse to the computer and use it, the MX3 starts working as it should again.

One of the outstanding qualities of the MX Master 2 was the ability to assign your own choice of functions to various parts you can press (wheel, moe button, etc.). This ability has been radically degraded in the MX M3 by substituting a bunch of Logitech-chosen! shortcuts specific to apps (e.g., Photoshop, Word) that are easily done, often with single keystrokes and CRIPPLED your chosen function assignment by requiring you to MOVE the mouse AFTER you press--for many uses totally eliminating the desired action. PRIME EXAMPLE: Custom assigned double-click WILL NOT WORK in dialog boxes and for other important needs. It's BACK TO THE MX M2 for sure. LESSON: DO NOT let your engineers change seriously useful capabilities just because the CAN.

I got no words to describe the satisfaction you feel when using this product, it might look pricey, but believe me when I say you won’t regret using this product. I was shocked by how well built this product is, from the design to the buttons till the way your work will improve while using it.
Ergonomically its great, I just wish it had better dpi. Compared to the g502, the mx 3 feels like a snails pace.
Ok

Honestly, I'm not trying to troll here.  This mouse is pretty good, but the wheel does not tilt left or right.  I bought this one to replace an MX Master 2S (also spent $ 100 on that one).  It is a huge improvement over the 2S simply because the 2S's forward and back buttons are scratching your thumb all the time.But, not this one, not the 2S or the previous one I forgot the name hold a candle to the Logitech MX Revolution [bluetooth].  I have both on my desk all the time, like right now, and all the time I start using the MX Master 3 and end up switching to the 10+year old Revolution.Not only it is a better mouse, the wheel tilts to the sides and is more comfortable, but how can a mouse with electromechanical parts last over 10 years?The quality of the MX Master 3 is great, not as good as the old ones, and the wheel doesn't tilt to the sides thats quite bad. The brichures don't mention that.If you can get ahold of an archaic MX Revolution in good shape, you will be better off.  I guess thats why they run up to $ 200 each :/
feels too heavy for gaming - amazing battery life
Perfect ergonomics, Perfect setup for audio/visual creation and gaming, Works on any surface, the battery lasts WEEKS on one charge. Worth every penny.

Bought this for my work machine and am so spoiled by it I just bought a 2nd one for my gaming laptop. Solid feel and the scroll wheel has to be experienced to understand why it's perfect. Really interesting magnetic clutch in there that gives you fine control and a "fast flick" spin that can zoom through to the end of a document almost instantly. Some really useful side-scrolling and other features as well. Highly recommend.

What an epic design failure. Received the mouse, paired it with my main computer and the other 2 downloaded the software and went looking for a button to switch from device to device. Guess what? The switch button is on the bottom of the mouse, if you want to switch from device to device you have to lift and push a small button each time. This is the worst design ever. Imagine working on 2 pc's and wanting to swap between them well you can't unless you stop pick it up and push a button. Who the hell does this?  Flow?? Well that doesn't work when you have a work computer not on the same network. All in all it is a major disappointment.
Period.

I was looking for a new mouse for my at home office set up, and have always went with Logitech for my needs. Have owned various mice from low end to high end, these were tough to find in stock at the time of purchase and are pretty pricy. I work in the architecture space drawing plans in 2d/3d, the more comfortable and efficient that a mouse can be is definitely a plus. So after seeing reviews on the multi task features and versatility I decided to buy it. In the past I  have used a Performance MX mouse and thought it may be an upgrade.After receiving it I was impressed with the feel and functionality. Very quick to set up and having Bluetooth is a huge plus as you don’t have to worry about a usb connection. However, after a few days I found it to be to bulky for me and I kept accidentally clicking the back button. Changing it in settings to have that button be no function didn’t help. It unfortunately wasn’t as ergonomic as expected and needs a few redesign touches, I ended up returning. Purchased the Performance MX instead, much more comfortable mouse for me, it may not have all the fancy bells and whistles but comfort is my #1 concern for a mouse.Overall Master 3, recommended for people with larger hands but not really great for users with average size hands.
feels awesome in the hand, heavier than gaming mice but smoother control. The scroll wheel is amazing, and the pan wheel and gesture button are going to be great!
One my best purchase! I love the options, feel, power and capabilities to connect to multiple devices! I have huge hands and this fits perfectly.
Great for programming
The mouse works fine but I was sent a clearly used mouse instead of new. The package was retaped and there were scratches on the bottom of the mouse.

I bought this mouse for work about a year ago and have maybe charged it 4 times. It’s absolutely incredible how long this mouse can go without even getting low on battery. Plus it’s so comfortable, and the side scrolling/magnetic scroll wheel is great if you do a lot of with with spreadsheets. I would highly recommend this mouse for anyone looking for a top notch daily driver.
What a piece of expensive garbage. The mousy is very unstable; doesn't move at all then suddenly starts to move. I used it for a day then returned it. It's not even worth $5.

After just 20 minutes of use, the side buttons started malfunctioning. Any action you assign to the side buttons, are doubled. No matter if you jus let press once. I bought this so I could copy and paste to reduce time for work and now it takes more time to delete the double pasted item than it does just to copy and paste via the keyboard. Apparently this is a known problem as multiple forums have mentioned this. I am disappointed...

This ergonomic design is by far the most comfortable mouse I've used. The feel is great and pointing is extremely smooth specially for gaming. I also love the wheel actions as well as all the customized actions that can be programmed. I don't have experience with battery life but I've only charged it once since I bought it which is couple of months ago.We bought a second mouse for my partner since we loved it so much.

My favorite part of using this mouse has to be its capability of switching seamlessly from one computer to another. It's especially useful when using my laptop with a mic and camera for my zoom class and my desktop for homework at the same time and not needing two mice. The built in and customizable buttons and side scroller are in very accessible positions and makes gaming better.

I had the mx first generation and the only reason I purchase this one is because someone took it. I would never use another mouse besides Logitech Mx line up. The ability to use this mouse on almost any surface is incredible. I have a laptop and many times I'm in places were the arm rest of a sofa is my mouse placement. The accuracy its amazing and for gaming it performs very good considering it's a mouse for everything. Highly recommend this product

I'm using this with the MX Keys keyboard and the mouse does fit comfortably in my hand but the only negative or con that I noticed right away is the top or page scroll wheel. The wheel is a little too far away and my index finger and I can barely reach the wheel which causes me to have to shift my palm up slightly in order to scroll. I suppose I'll get used to this eventually but it is a disappointment. Everything seems to be solid and the mouse integrates well with Windows 10 and Bluetooth.
Scroll issues

i like:
- Good design- Lots of features- Programable buttons- Great Qualitydon't like:- nothing for now

I use VSC for coding. Horizontal doesn't work most of the time. Only restarting the computer seems to have a chance at returning that functionality.. Switching between different computers using logitech "flow" has its good days and bad days. Not sure what causes the inconsistency. I also use the logitech MX keys with the the "flow" option, if one gets stuck they both do. Default programed keys and gestures hardly work.(update) software continues to get worse.
All features are useful, locations of all buttons are comfortable. Scroll wheel is very smooth.

i own mx, mx2s and now this mx3. I have to say this is the first one i am entirely satisfied with. I love logitech products they last forever and work great (use for pretty much everything). You can even find replaceable batteries and boots online for the mouse. just a great product.It a lot of money for a mouse, This one i intend to keep for years though.

I like the mouse idea, the app and how useful it is on specific apps, but i really hate the inconsistency on the scrolling wheel, it does a decent job when scrolling slow and down, but if i try to go up at the same speed i expect to go to the same places but the wheel just does not respond sometimes. :(

This is a great mouse! For me it's the free spin wheel that makes all the difference. Combined with the ergonomic shape of the body it's ideal for long hours working on the computer. Installation is as simple as plugging in the usb dongle. Unlike my logi keyboard this dongle has quite some range and never gives me any trouble. Battery charges last for a very long time. I recharge it every few weeks.
Excellent feeling mouse. Everything feels so good and smooth.

I have been an MX mouse user for the last 5 years. I need a new mouse for my remote office laptop and I transfter my 5 years old MX Master to that computer.  The mouse is very beautiful and ergonomic, but the scroll is not consistent, also the pointer jumps when you have it connected to the bluetooth of the Macbook Pro 2015. I had to exchange this for the Logi MX Master 3 for MAC.  That said, I have been extremely impressed with the mouse and how much time it saves.  This mouse is near perfect and comfortable with extended use.  I think it is a great value at $99.00.

This is hands-down the best mouse I've used... no... the best pointing device.  I've used all sorts of mice and trackpads including Apple but this is the most productive.  I had the MX 2S for over a year which was a good mouse although mine suffered from the "stuck gesttures button" syndrome and I had to open it up a few times to try to correct it. Also, the 2S wheel in ratched mode annoyed me with the sound but free spin was a little to free and I would scroll accidentally.  The MX 3, however, seems to fix both those issues with a better gesture button and the magnetic wheel.  I'm a software developer and I always have a crazy number of windows open and need to scroll through code and insanely long debug logs--this mouse is the cat's "meow." I like working with this Mouse because has a lot of Chins

The MX Master 2 was a game-changer for someone who spends a LOT of time in spreadsheets, CAD, and coding. Ratchet -> freewheel = awesome! Due to experiencing the known issue of the gesture button getting stuck, I ordered a MX3. Somehow it's better in almost every way.Pro: The wheel is heavier and more responsive. The thumb wheel likewise. USB-C is great (for me). The battery apparently draws energy from an alternate dimension. The app-specific button assignments are great (but not the defaults; you'll want to change those).Con: The back/forward buttons seem ill-placed (relative to MX2), but I have large hands, so maybe they're great for normal folks. Similarly, I wish it were bigger overall, with more force needed to click the main buttons. Sometimes the connection gets laggy, even with all the networking tweaks (ask Google) that make it tolerable. The Options software still wants to update too often, though has gotten better.Haven't tried Flow on it, but assume it's as good as the MX2. If you're deciding whether you need a fancy-pants mouse, you definitely do, and it's the best $100 you'll spend on an accessory.Bonus Pro: Easy fix for the MX2 (ask YouTube) put a great - if a little worn - mouse in my mobile office.

I have been loving this device, however recently the bottom of the mouse has worn the glue and caused the plastic contacting the mouse mat to start coming off, this has been a problem since it has started to wear at my mat and cause a scratching sound every time I use it.

It’s a great mouse. Replaced original MX mouse that used charging dock. This is far above.  I could not get the software to install to customize buttons but wasn’t necessary to use. I work from home and use this for 8 hrs a day.  Scrolls smoothly and comfortable
This mouse is amazing in everything except fitting wider palms. My pinky and ring fingers have no place on it, so end up dragging on the desk if relaxed. Not comfortable!
Has a nice heft to it, doesn't feel like a cheap mouse like many others can. Fits the hand nicely.

I have been suffering form logotic software as it is NOT detecting my mouse. I have called many times and exchanges verious emails with logotic support for the last 3 weeks. And thry still didn't fix the issue.
Poor support. I don't recommend it.

I primarily use this mouse for Mac, although it has the convenience to switch to up to 3 different devices.If you use Mac, and wish you didn't have to give up the 4 finger swipe gesture when you use a mouse, this has a button for it. The scrolling wheels are ridiculously smooth and the side scroll works flawlessly with apps such as Word or FCPX. Not too much resistance, just enough to not accidentally bump it. Feels like absolute luxury.Gaming? I think you can spend this money elsewhere on a product designed for wireless gaming. Workflow, school, etc,.. This is perfect.

Absolutely the best Mouse on the market period. Connects via Bluetooth to up 3 computers...I toggle between work and personal laptops with a press of a button. The MX Master is also very comfortable and fits well in your hand without any fatigue...highly recommended 5 stars.

This MX Master 3 mouse is amazing.  Well worth the extra money since I am using it +8 hours per day, every day.  Fits my medium large hand very nicely.  This is a replacement for a 10 year old Performance MX.  The roller ball is amazingly smooth and fun to use.  I access many large files and very nice to be able to hit the roller ball and see it fly through the pages as opposed to clicking through pages.  The sensing is very accurate for use in Revit and AutoCAD and does not require the use of a mouse pad.  The unifying dongle works great with an older Logitech ergonomic keyboard connected to a switch controlling two computers.
Good Product

I've owned all the mice in the MX Master line and this one is a solid contender for #1. Compared to the 2S, this mouse feels much better in the hand and the buttons feel much more solid. It has the sounds and feels of the door of an expensive luxury car, especially the scroll wheel which feels heavy and deep compared to the lighter and cheaper feel of the 2S wheel. However, the whole mouse is much lighter than the others in the line.It's way heavier and less precise than I would recommend for a gaming application, but it's easily the best mouse for productivity on the market today.
Fire, absolute fire! I was using the Magic Mouse 2 and it’s a good mouse but the configurations on this mouse make me feel I couldn’t go back to a regular mouse.
My pet cobra still has not digested this mouse. It is very durable! It is a heavy mouse, so my cobra has been a bit slower since consuming it.

The mouse is great, and the features are fantastic. If you're picking up an MX master it should be for the features.The main scroll wheel is great (but you have to tune the sensitivity just right for your hand)The side scroll wheel is great in excel (although I wish you could freely spin it like the main scroll wheel)The gesture button is a powerhouse that I use far more than I would have assumed.Program-specific gestures and buttons has been such a huge improvement.The polling rate is quite noticeable if you try and do anything more than business oriented work, but having the dongle does improve latency slightlyThis works flawlessly with my MacBook and windows pc. I would recommend this version to anyone with a Mac since the Mac version doesn't come with the dongle!Finally.. the ergonomics. Frankly my least favorite part. I find the MxMaster 2 far more comfortable because you can use it like a normal mouse. I think the problem is the thumb rest being too low compared to the MX master 2 that snugly fit your thumb.  the hump of this mouse is snug but I find myself struggling in the learning curve to get accustomed to it. It took a little while and I can now use it for long periods of time.
No issues with product, but didn't notice a huge different from prior mouse despite the hefty price.

I had the original MX Master for several years, in fact, I owned two. I used one for work and one for home and they both couldn't hold a charge for more than 2 weeks since the day I bought them. This mouse (again 2) is much better! Better feeling in my hand, better with the battery and works well with Bluetooth and wireless. Can't say enough good about it.

5-star mouse. 5-star scroll wheel. 0-star scroll wheel implementation. How Logitech could have gotten this so wrong is beyond me.If you loved the MX Master 2/S, then you'll love this mouse initially, but the scroll wheel will eventually drive you bonkers.The scroll wheel itself feels great -- even better than the 2S. It feels less plastic, less cheap and more high-end. It's also much less noisy. However the implementation of the scroll wheel -- well, let's say I won't be surprised if many customers return their mouse for a refund.As I research for solutions, I found there were originally a number of problems with the scrolling/scroll-wheel, some of which were fixed with software/firmware updates. However the primary issue still exists.This is the primary issue: the scrolling is inconsistent. There will be times where scrolling feels good, and times where the scroll barely happens at all. Of course it all depends on how you use the mouse, but in general when I'm browsing the web, I have to slow down and deliberately scroll the wheel in order to get anywhere.From what I can gather, this isn't fixable in software/firmware. It seems to be a hardware sensor issue.I requested a replacement thinking maybe this was simply a manufacturing defect. The replacement also had the same issue. Back to the 2S for me.

If you have shoulder pains or mouse shoulder, this mouse will only make it worse. The shape will help if you are having forearm and wrist pains though. The back and forward buttons are too stiff and still too small. It really takes a conscious effort to use. I have the MX Master 1 and the back/forward button on that is much harder to locate but way easier to push. Once you have muscle memory down, you can easily push the back and kind of push the forward buttons (forward button is too small so you still kind of have to feel for it). The gesture button on this version is also way too stiff. Having to push down on the gesture button and moving the mouse is just not a good experience.Pros:1. Great scroll wheel. The best I have ever used. Such a waste on this. I didn't have any issues like other users.2. USB-C connection. Good to have less cables around.3. Great battery life. At least from reported and my experience with the MX Master version 1.4. Horizontal scroll wheel. This is useful but I am starting to prefer the left and right tilts on the scroll wheel itself.5. Ergo is good for people with wrist or forearm pain.Cons:1. IMO this is bad for anyone with mouse shoulder or any kind of shoulder pain. After 15 mins of use on this and I had to tap out. The shape actually forces you to rotate your shoulder outward slightly. This is the motion you're trying to avoid if you have mouse shoulder.2. It is heavy for a mouse. Slightly better than the previous versions but still noticeable.3. Stiff back and forward buttons. Maybe it will soften up over time but I can see these buttons causing hand pain if you use them a lot.4. Gesture button too stiff. Using gesture button with movement is just not a fun experience.5. Horizontal scroll position seems off. Feels like it should be lower but that's where the back and forward buttons are. Maybe that was why the version 1 was designed with that layout.

I bought one to replace my Logitech MX Master X2 and it had tracking issues. OK fine, I had Amazon replace it, no big deal but then the second one came and had the same issue. Ok let's test it with the MX S2. Literally going from one mouse to another side by side I can see a huge difference in performance. WTF? I even ordered the MX keys because I'm a Logitech Fanboy and I had to return that keyboard also because It wasn't working properly. I really love Logitech and want them to succeed but these new products suck.

Summary: Mouse is twitchy, mis-clicks and has the worst software I've usedIt regularly causes me to click-drag-copy files in Windows and lowering it's sensitivity means I have to swipe too much, to get the mouse across my two screens.  No, I'm not new to using mice and I own a 10k dpi gaming mouse that I have no problems with.  And before you suggest I adjust the dpi, I should point out that "Options", the Logitech software for Windows (which has almost no options, ironically) doesn't allow the user to change the dpi or mouse polling rate.  There's only a sensitivity setting, like Windows 10 already has.But that's just a minor complaint.  The main problems are the mouse-wheel, which is touted as an improvement over normal wheels, but feels more like a really bad automatic transmission; always scrolling WAY to far, or not far enough.  And since they replaced the normal mechanism, you can't turn it off, but without the feature enabled, the wheel response is terribly sluggish.The biggest trigger for me, however, has to be the button design for the two main buttons.  The design flows over the front of the mouse, so that merely bumping into your coffee cup, or your keyboard will cause it to click the mouse!  We all have times in our computer use, where doing this would be disastrous.  If you have Windows 10 set to place your cursor above the "OK" button, whenever dialog windows come up, it's even more dangerous.I've been using a mouse with my computers since I was 8 years old; so 35 years.  Never have I had so many issues.  I never had a problem with a mouse being too sensitive or twitchy.  My G502 works great, but I need a wireless mouse.And if you're thinking of buying this mouse for the ability to use it on multiple desktops, I hope you don't use Linux, or you're in for a let-down.  I was hoping to use it with my Windows machine and one running Linux Mint Cinnamon 20, but Logitech doesn't develop for the Linux platform.I doubt anyone is going to see this review, without a lot of digging, but for those who do find it, check all the 5-star reviews, and 9 times, out of 10, you'll find that they are all affiliates for the product.  These people are literally just salesmen.  Don't trust a thing they say.  They get 10% or more from every sale.  Amazon allows this.  They might as well just let the companies make up completely fictional people and have sales people write the reviews.

Love this mouse's performance, was a user of the previous generation as well.  This is the most comfortable, customizable mouse ive ever used.  Build quality seems excellent.  Makes me feel baffled that i have to plug this in to charge, i have seen users comment on the usb-c to a cord and it totally is a bit silly, although im sure you could just use a usb c to c and it would still charge.  What i can't stand is that you even have to plug it in at all, these should wirelessly charge WITH the option to charge using a cord if need be, WITH an easily replaceable rechargable battery.  With the amount of tech this thing utilizes, it all goes out the window when it drops charge and i have to fish out an annoying cable.  Sure there is a pop up that shows you when its getting low in charge, but that makes it worse, nobody should have to look at a notification relating to their computer mouse, its tedious as hell.  TL:DR - Great mouse!.....but.....typical logitech product design follow through.

Logitech is like Apple in that they usually charge a premium for their devices. It's fair to say neither delivers all the time. The Logitech software is total garbage. The mouse cursor and scrolling work great when they work, but frequently they just stop working. Scrolling will randomly reverser. Cursor becomes unresponsive. From googling these appear to be common complaints and appear to stem from the Unify software. I've tested with multiple Logitech dongles and on both MacOS and Windows, with the same result. This mouse would be so great if they would fix these issues! I'm going back to my old MX Master (first gen) because it always works the way I expect it to.  I can not recommend the MX Master 3 at this time. Do not purchase.EDIT: It's not the software. I completely uninstalled it on both my mac and my pc. Same problems continue to exist. Got my old MX Master (original) back out of a drawer and it works flawlessly. This is an actual problem with the MXM3.

Like the title says, this is the best mouse I’ve ever used. Works over every surface I could find.

Amazing mouse! I had an older Logitech (10+ years) and it was starting to not register clicks so I splurged in the upgrade. SO glad I did! I have a large hand and this mouse fits perfectly. The thumb scroll is perfect for worksheet work, while the back/forward buttons and push able window select make this the perfect office mouse. Using it on my Mac has not been the best experience with the cursor acceleration as well as the scroll acceleration. Connecting it to my pc next week and will revisit if anything changes.

If you work 8+ hours a day in front of a computer, you owe it to yourself to invest in the tools you use for your craft.I cannot tell you how many mice I've gone through, thinking "this looks good, has the requisite buttons, and is wireless". Distractions equal wasted time to me and they add up. There's enough distractions at work everyday, don't let the things you can control be one of those distractions. Your hardware should not be one of those distractions. This mouse is creme de la creme and worth every cent.

This is the most comfortable ergonomic mouse I've ever owned. And, it works great too! After two different Corsair gaming mice died on me after a couple years use I decided to try another brand and purchased this one based on Amazon reviews. I'm glad I bought it...
