I have been struggling with a lot of Logitec items and Bluetooth connections on both my Windows 10 and Mac computers.  I finally got it connected using the uni-receiver, software download, and computer restart, and some setup time,+ some FAQ research to get it running.  I have had a similar experience with other Logitec items like their headsets. I switched to Mpow and their items connect flawlessly.  Logitech tech support was also useless. It seems that they have not mastered Customer support under Covid!

Pros:- The new mag scroll wheel is quite nice, much quieter than the older mechanical ones.- Uses USB C- Multi device supportCons:- The side buttons feel a bit mushy to my liking.- Can't login to my Logitech account on the Logitech Options software on Mac, works fine on Windows. This does not affect the flow feature however you can still go from one computer to the next, it auto switches Bluetooth/receiver to go to next computer, there is slight lag of a few seconds while it switches.- Gestures might take a while to get used to. It's similar to the sniper buttons or g toggle you have on some of the gaming mice, you hold it down and move the mouse in a direction to perform "gestures"- Needs extended pinky rest so that pinky finger isn't dragging or rubbing the surface.Overall, I specifically bought the mouse for the hyperscroll feature as it is very useful for going through documentation, USB C is a welcome expected upgrade, I have not experienced any of the scrolling issues others have mentioned.

Coming from a Logitech Performance MX, which for me was the ultimate productivity mouse for a decade (yes, I really held onto it that long), I finally found a worthy successor in the MX Master 3.For my hand, the ergonomics and layout of the Performance MX were excellent. I bought the MX 2S and gave it away because it was so uncomfortable and the layout of the back/forward buttons was borderline unusable.I decided to bite the bullet and give the MX 3 a try, and I'm not disappointed. It's almost as comfortable to hold as the Performance MX, and has a logical button layout. The USB Type C is a great addition (no more hunting for old micro USB cables), the side scroll is excellent, and the MagSpeed scroll wheel is so smooth and quiet.I just wish that the PC version was offered in more colours, like the Mac version is. Would also be nice to have a removable rechargeable battery like the Performance MX (replacing batteries is how it lasted for a decade), but I guess you can't have everything. Oh well. Not going to dock points for that.If you loved the Performance MX, definitely give the MX 3 a spin (pun intended)!

this mouse has made me lazy. its probably the best ergonomic mouse i have ever used. it allows for so much customization. and the best part is you can configure what each button does for each individual application. paired with mx keys this mouse  is a beast. so comfortable in the hand to use. scroll wheel is so good you can literally go through thousands of lines in a couple of seconds

So yes, this is my third of Logitech's full-sized mice, and I'm certain it won't be my list.I'm simply in love with the mice's "form factor", by that I mean it just fits perfectly in my hand.  I'm a desktop user only, so I don't take advantage of its ability to go from one screen to another, I just use the mouse primarily with Excel plus photoshop, as well as internet stuff.Don't get me wrong, I've tried many (MANY!!) much cheaper, supposedly full-sized mice over the years (yeah, I've been online since the early '90s), but it's both the Logitech's size as well as its weight that make it, especially in its current iteration (the MX Master 3) the best they've ever produced.If you haven't tried, and you enjoy the ergonomics of a full-sized mouse, this is definitely the one to get.
Unless you are serious working with this mouse, regular user won't probably get all the advantages of this mouse. If you do though, they are impressive. Very good product but xpensive

This mouse works great and precisely. Battery life is great, holding it is comfortable, it is big enough to rest my hand on.However, what frustrate me is the design of switch device button, the button is under the mouse! Unbelievable! If I want to switch device I have to lift the mouse, flip it over, and press the tiny button and wait to see the light on to know which device it connects to!!! What the design! Why not move the switch button to the top of the mouse?Don't say there is Flow function, it does not work, it requires all devices in the same network, normal it has hiccup already, and once the device connects to VPN the Flow is a joke.
Great mouse for streamlining my workflow.

The shape is not as ergonomic as it first appears, but I do have bigger hands. The mouse is a little too big for finger grip and too heavy for intense gaming, but it really works fine for anything else, like office work. The sensor can work on glass too, which is a big bonus.
class="cr-original-review-content">Pour l'instant je suis très satisfait. Je l'utilise principalement pour des logiciels de bureau, internet et Autocad.
A little pricey, but exactly as advertised.

In order to not have the side wheel cut in and out while using it as a volume control, you cant go wireless..it loses signal constantly,The mouse is cozy and fits my hand well, glides nicely, software is utter garbage though.The side scroll wheel fail is a total deal-breaker for me... would NOT recommend 2/10

 A REVIEW (over about a month of use):It's a really well-made mouse, even if it is all plastic with the exception of the scroll wheel and the thumb wheel. The contours for my thumb and my fingers are nicely well done, but I have medium-large hands, so if you have small hands, this may not be comfortable to use. As for day to day operation, it works incredibly well, and I have yet to experience any connectivity and latency issues, double-clicking, battery issues, etc. Then again, I may have gotten lucky and recieved a unit that didn't have these problems, so I can't speak for everyone who buys this mouse.NITPICKING TIME:I did have to go on Google and download the Logitech Options driver software (pretty much the first result when you Google it) so I can customize the button layout, sensitivity, etc, but that doesn't really count as an issue (just my lazy ass). What may be an issue for some is the fact that the Logitech Options app needs to run first in order to activate your custom settings, which can be a bit annoying if you're someone who frequently shuts down and boots up or restarts their computer. I got used to it, but I am pretty patient, so beware if you're impatient.I have also noticed that the infinite scroll can be a double-edged sword at times. When I have to click to select and option of if I have enter in a special character in Word or Docs and the scroll wheel is still moving, it'll pick up on it and accidentally do something else. For example, when copying and pasting a screen shot of enterting a hyphen shortly after scrolling, the document or page's magnification will change because the scroll wheel was still spinning. I'm pretty sure you fix this in the scrolling section of the Logitech Options application or just not flick the scroll wheel as intensely (still have to get used to that part), but I'll have to see if playing with those options will fix it.VERDICT:Although I have only had this mouse for a couple of weeks to a month, I am very pleased with it. I would definitely NOT use this mouse for gaming because there's no precise DPI adjuster (just a sensitivity slider), but I use this mainly for school and browsing the internet (I have a controller dedicated to gaming). I'll update my review if any issues arise, but everything is pretty much working as promised. Is this mouse pricey? Yes. But I think that you do get what you pay for, and what I got is a pretty damn good mouse, soo...you can come to your own conclusion on that.
Smooth and seamless, even without mouse pad. Big fan of the “Magspeed” wheel. Worth the investment.
class="cr-original-review-content">L'ergonomie pour moi est désastreuse. La souris est trop grosse pour mes mains (très inconfortable).
Awesome product! I simply love it!

Fantastic product. Does what is expected. Value for money.

GREAT:  Solid build & materials, feel, software integration and connectivity (USB C).GOOD:  Battery is good - full charge to depleted in just over a month using daily Monday to Friday for work, but hey, who wouldn't like more?BAD:  None... it's solid!ADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS:It's not cheap, but if you use it daily there is a payoff.  I'd strongly encourage you to buy from Logitech's website directly (so they realize a higher margin and continue to develop great products), or from a local vendor in your area.I also ended up buying the MX Keys to match and love the pair.  I work from home on a PC setup, but also have an iMac which is still my main personal computer.  The FLOW feature provides an understated benefit in this situation.  The combination of the MX Master 3 and MX Keys streamlined my cluttered desk with multiple keyboards and mouses (mice... I don't know the 'right' plural term in the case of a computer mouse, haha).  It's a little finicky to setup, but a joy once it is!

If you don't like the ergonomic shape or the extra buttons, than buy the MX Anywhere mouse. Either that one or this one, you're getting the best mouse on the market. Logitech has finally done it here. The MX keyboard and the MX mice are the best products you'll find. Unless you're needing a corded keyboard and you're in a whole different category.. this is the show stopper. For work, school, or just personal computer use.. this tops them all. Connect up to 3 devices via bluetooth SO easily! I have my Windows on 1, my Linux on 2.. and my iPad on 3. Perfect. Throw away the USB dongle and save yourself the port.There are sometimes a snag in the response, but that's only the bluetooth connection saving battery life. I hope there's a way you can adjust it.. either way its not annoying and it's normal.
Works great, very sensitive
Very good
Was recommended by a lot of my coworkers.But for some reason, this one does not work well with my mac.Returned.I think they now have a mac specific version now.
I don't understand people's complaints about the scroll wheel. It's a great mouse with endless amounts of macros you can put on it. BEST productivity mouse I have ever used.

Best mouse yet!

The scroll wheel is very imprecise. If you move the wheel up and down repeatedly a few times, the same amount in either direction such that the net movement is zero, your page will not be where it started. This is because the scroll tracking skips sometimes.Why would I spend $130 on a mouse whose main feature is its scroll wheel if the scroll wheel sucks?

This was very disappointing. I purchased the mouse along with a matching keyboard in March 2020. About a month ago the Bluetooth stopped working, so I switched to the dongle wifi. This worked well for a bit, but I then started experiencing lag and mouse jumping. Giving the mouse the benefit of the doubt I searched the internet for a solution. So far nothing has worked and I've exhausted my search after spending approx. 20 hours troubleshooting. I'm now sure it is the mouse as it starts working again after tapping the mouse against my desk. Bluetooth won't pick up even when the receiver is 3 inches from the mouse. I can't return to Amazon, so now I'll have to search for Logitech's warrantee return methodology. I wouldn't give this device any stars, but I think I'll be forced to give it one. DO NOT BUY.
Bought the first version Performance MX back in the day. Didn't change it for 12 years! Hopefully this one does the same.

Many years ago I bought a MX Master 2S for my MacBook Pro and absolutely loved it.  I wanted to buy a 2nd one so I didn't have to carry it back and forth from work to home all the time... So I bought the latest and greatest MX Master 3.  They changed the design a bit and improved on what was already a good mouse. It's super comfortable to use all day. The free scroll is awesome and the thumb button mapping I use saves me a ton of time when doing tasks.  The battery life is astounding.  I swear I've charged it less than a handful of times in the entire last year.. and that's with all day use at least 5 times a week!The only downside is that sometimes my custom settings don't seem to work. Things like button mappings and mouse sensitivity.  I usually fix this by turning off the mouse and turning it back on again.  I think it's more of a Logitech software issue and not the mouse itself because it still works when things act up.
Used a MX Master V1 for years till the battery started to die. Got this one for christmas and it feels as good as the original MX Master.

I had used a Logitech Performance MX mouse for the past 10 years, and I liked it.  I might have bought another if it was still available.  But the 10-year-old mouse seemed to be getting glitchy, so I considered options.  I bought my wife a MX Master 2S a couple of years ago, and it was an improvement over the Performance MX.  And now, in the evolution of the product, I have this MX 3, which I think is an improvement over the 2S.  The battery life seems excellent.  The scrolling wheels and the placement of the back and forward buttons are an improvement over previous generations.  I'm very pleased and would I buy another one of these if I needed to.

I am enjoying using this one, but if you have small hands and man. you will feel it's bit samll and too light.

If I rest my hand on the mouse it constantly right clicks. The right button is too loose and the ergonomic design of the mouse makes my hand fall on the right button. This is an extremely annoying design flaw that they would have spotted if they used human hands for their testing (assuming if any testing was done).

Bought this as I was looking for a good reliable cordless mouse.  What I got was a mouse that gets maybe 4 days on a charge (not the 70 in the sales blurb).  It's very jumpy.  Moves on it's own. For the price, I expected so very much more.

I am very pleased with this mouse. Feels comfortable in the hand and the free scrolling feature is quite cool. I love using the thumb buttons to navigate web pages. The thumb scroller and special thumb button at the base are not always easy to find, but this likely depends on the size of your hands. I got this with the Mx Keys keyboard for Mac/Linux workflow, and although I primarily still use my gen 1 Apple trackpad, I am very pleased with the purchase.

For all the price and features boasted, this device unfortunately don’t seem to work with smaller sized adult hands (effectively, cannot reach the middle scroll wheel without sacrificing comfort, and in my usage experience my hands hurt after several days of normal use compared to a regular USB mouse, which was both surprising and rather disappointing since this mouse had boasted its ergonomics features). The Triathlon, which is similarly shaped to the MX Master works perfectly and I would recommend smaller hands users to try that one instead.
Really love this mouse. The battery is stellar, it has good weight and excellent build quality. I switch between computers throughout the day and the quick switch button on the bottom is the best!

This is my third MX Master. I use one at my office, and I wore out the one I use at home (literally wore a hole under my thumb). Even broken, it still worked, but I decided to get a MX Master 3. By far, this is the most comfortable and precise mouse I have ever used. History: I have been using a mouse since the original Macintosh in 1984, and I have worn through many.Pros: precision, customization, comfortCons: battery life could be better for such a large mouse

It is definitely the best mouse I've tried so far. Sleek-looking ergonomic mouse with great battery life, high-quality rubberized coating and metal wheels. It's comfortable and brilliantly precise and the thumb wheel, which was one of my main reasons to get this mouse, is a new way of easing my workload while programming.USB-C, quick charge and above all MagSpeed are the cherries on top.
Excellent purchase!

The rubbery/soft-touch plastic that covers the entire palm and thumb area degraded in under 6 months of usage. No sweaty gaming was ever done with this mouse.Once it started degrading, the mouse became sticky to the touch and gets worse/slimy as it gets warm after even just light use. Suspect my grip style that has my entire palm and thumb in contact with the mouse has something to do with it as it gets warmer than I would like a mouse to be.Logitech has replaced it under warranty, but how long the replacement will last is what's keeping me from using it. Would have much preferred this to be all ABS plastic instead of the soft touch rubber material.
too small for large hands. old model fit better

I bought this mouse because I have two laptops on my desk and I wanted to be able to operate both with one mouse. I did some research and came across this one. It is truly almost perfect with one minor flaw. First of all, ergonomics and battery life are great. It also does do what it says that it will do in terms of switching from screen to screen between laptops. However, it seems that the mouse has a preference, or an easier time going in one direction. This could be due to different processing power in my laptops but when it switches to my left laptop, its almost too fast. If I even nick the edge of the screen it will go left but then going back to the right screen, I need to get the mouse to the edge and drag and drag to the right a couple of times to get the mouse to switch back to the right. Also the software (Logitech Flow) that allows this, won't work with my iPad.

This feels like a very refined mouse. I have had the MX Master (original) in the past, and this feels similar to that mouse, but more refined. The metal scroll wheels feel super nice and smooth. The one warning I would have is that connections via Bluetooth can be a bit spotty, so if you can, I would use the wireless receiver. Also, avoid having the wireless receiver behind a monitor or cabinet - ideally, it should be within a couple feet of the mouse and have a clear line-of-sight. If you work within these restrictions, the mouse works super reliably and has been my daily driver for several months now.

I have been using this mouse for 2 weeks and I want to say:JUST BUY ITPROS:1) very ergonomic to fit your hand2) very powerful programmed buttons for all functions of your daily use.3) the scroll is the most comfortable I have ever known.CONS:the mouse has a chance to be laggy some times. I don't know if that because I pair the mouse to my desktop by Bluetooth without dongle, but I believe it should be work as normal even without a dongle. hope Logitech may update the firmware to fix this issue later.Conclusion:for daily use, just buy it.

This mouse and I can't be together, I love everything about this mouse except it gave me pain in my wrist switching back to my old cheap vertical mouse, all the buttons are amazing if you are one of those people who never had any type of pain while using a regular mouse you'll be fine with this mouse. Is great I wish Logitech could make Vertical MX MASTER even if it cost 180 ill buys it. I know they have a vertical mouse but not with that scroll wheel and the extra buttons and gesture button.

It does require getting used to using this mouse.  It is heavy but grounded and firm.  The right way is to rest your hand right over it and move around by letting the mouse carry your hand weight.With my simple  (cheap)  Logitech mouse, I had to skip up and down often to get the cursor to the right point.  With this mouse, I have to change my habit of just keeping it grounded and sliding. It slides on any surface.The roll was initially tighter and one day it suddenly started just rolling loose, I had not realized that the button, just above is to switch between the controlled moving the cursor vs. the crazy spinning wheel that scrolls in a web page super fast up and down.  This is one of my favourite features about this Logitech.  The sideways spin is great too.Today, this mouse suddenly stopped working.  It turns out that my USB extension bar, where the mouse USB was attached, was faulty.  As soon as I attached it to the USB port on the computer, the mouse started working again.I purchased this about a month ago.  I use a mouse, on average, about 15 hours per day.  I work in design and web development.  This mouse is expensive, but you feel the quality right away.  As long as it keeps going, I will replace my other mice with same or a little cheaper variety.  I have difficulty using my previous mouse now, they rather feel flimsy and less controllable.  Once you use this mouse, you will not want to go back to a lesser quality mouse.

Excellent mouse... This is my 3rd MX Master mouse and was purchased for my new laptop.  They are all working, two on laptops and one on my one desktop.  I wanted a bluetooth mouse so I didn't use one of the 3 USB ports.  All the mice are excellent and hold a charge very well.  Very happy with Logitech products.Dik
sits well in my hand, takes a bit of time to get used to all the button positions, and after that you fly through your work.

It was never able to successfully connect to my work laptop and yes I tried everything. As far as ergonomics go it's good but not the best. The battery life is fantastic but other than that no point for me as I wanted a mouse to be able to switch between laptops and it doesn't do that.

I love Logitech cordless mice and will not use anything else, which is why I bought this mouse in the first place, so it came as no surprise that it is perfectly ergonomically designed, but the level of customization that is possible with it did surprise me. No matter how picky you are you can customize the settings to fit your demanding requirements. It is extremely comfortable to use and the battery life is amazing. I never turn mine off and it lasts for around two months between charges. I thoroughly recommend it to anyone who spends a lot of time mousing around!

I will also be purchasing a new notebook in the new year, and the ability to shift both devices on the click of a button to another system is something I am looking forward to. Upgraded from an MX 2 based on the reviews.PROSThe MX 3 has a steeper angle/slope that should make it more ergonomic, it's more comfortable than a MX 2, I was using a Contour Unimouse daily (using an MX 2 daily would cramp my hand), but now I have been using the MX 3 daily with no issues.CONSThe magnetic scroll wheel has some issues, kinda gimmicky. The Logitech MX Master 3 is one of the most comfortable mice I've ever used. I wear medium-sized gloves and my hands rest perfectly on the shape of the mouse. I was also impressed with its battery life. I use the mouse about 8 hours a day on average and I only need to charge once every 30 days or so. As someone who uses multiple computers (PC desktop and a Macbook Pro), this mouse allows me to connect both my computers and seamlessly move between them as if they were a single computer. It even lets you copy and paste from one machine to another, which is highly useful for me. The build quality is also top-notch. The metal scroll wheels make the product feel premium, and they're super smooth as well.There are 2 side buttons that you can configure and I initially found them to be too thin/small. I did get used to them after a while so it wasn't a big deal. As for the gesture button, I have personally never used it as a gesture. I personally found it kind of slow to press down and move the mouse a certain direction to do something and I just assigned the key as a shortcut when I press it instead of using gestures.Overall, this is a fantastic mouse; the best you can get if you want a productivity mouse. However, if you're someone who plays games a lot, there are better options out there. This is a big and heavy mouse and is a very poor choice for FPS games.

I bought this mouse to replace my aging Performance MX. This new one has some really nice features, and some real disappointments.
Pros:-I really like the shape, weight, and how this mouse fits in my hand (for the most part - see Cons section re thumbweel).-Love the new "MagShift" scroll wheel. Scrolling fills me with joy again.-New Logitech Flow feature, allowing me to use one mouse and keyboard with multiple computers absolutely seamlessly. Where has this feature been all my life? Absolutely wonderful.Cons:-Thumbwheel is a bit of a reach and has limited applicability, except in specific applications.-Gesture button (below the thumb) is difficult to reach, and impossible to press without accidentally moving the mouse as well.-New "Options" software lacks the ability to set pointer acceleration.-Application specific button setup doesn't seem to work in every application.-It took many attempts to get the mouse paired with receivers on multiple computers.Overall, if it weren't for the "Flow" functionality, I probably would have returned this mouse. But now that I've had a taste of that feature, I don't think I can live without it, and this is probably the best mouse I am going to find with that feature for now.

The mouse is GREAT. I love the ergonomics way better than the 2s, which I already loved. The buttons are even better than before, and the mouse is overall a great piece of technology.Except for one MAJOR flaw. Whenever you lift off the mouse from the mousepad, however how slightly, then it stops sending scrolling information to the computer, for some reason. That means that for people like me who are used to having fast workflows see CONSTANT issues in the way we browse application or the net, because scrolling stops regularly and seems to lag.People have reported it all over the net. It is an issue with the mouse itself, not a quality control issue. We know this because people have exchanged their mice for other ones and they demonstrated the same exact issue. It probably doesn't bother every user because not every user use their mouse in this way, but this is absolutely not a normal behavior for a mouse and the 2s didn't have that issue.What is really frustrating is that Logitech is once again simply ignoring the issue, just like they do with other design flaws plaguing some of their products. It's a shame because I love their products, when they work, but this kind of behavior demonstrates a huge lack of respect for their customers, and I'm beginning to think I should switch to another company for my mice...

Cons in comparison to the original Performance MX-Only 1 year warranty instead of 3.-SHORTER : if placed comfortably in the hand my 3 fingers are too far away to click... A huge issue.-Narrower I now have my fourth finger rubbing the mouse pad instead of resting on the side of the mouse.-Lighter, no so important but feel cheaper.-Even if you put the center scroll wheel to stepped mode it switch to free roll if you turn it to fast or long enough so this button is partially useless, at least it can be mapped to something else. (like switching mouse resolution)Pro-I love the horizontal scroll wheel-Button/wheels can be configured for each program which is greatSadly as I use my mouse sometime more then 12 hours per day if the comfort is not perfect I will injure myself. I already feel a slight pain and stiffness after only one short day !I will have to return this mouse and buy parts to repair my old Performance MX v1. An Omron mini switch cost a couple dollars!This is a shame since I found the horizontal scroll wheel very useful.

This mouse is replacing a Logitech MX Revolution which I have been using for the last 5 or so years. It has both a wireless mode (when used with the supplied USB dongle) and a Bluetooth mode.ConnectivitySince my motherboard has built-in Bluetooth, I am using this mode/option. Battery life when in Bluetooth mode is excellent. After two months of daily use the battery level dropped to 50% from fully charged.  This is definitely much better than the battery life of my MX Revolution which I typically had to recharge every 2 weeks.SoftwareThe supplied software is ok. It seems lighter in footprint than the old software that I was using with the MX Revolution. It basically allows you to configure the mouse the way you want it to work. There are default settings for various Apps like Chrome, MS Office, etc. The mouse is fully configurable if the software you are using is not in the default list. For example, I was able to configure the thumb scroll to switch between tabs when using the Firefox browser.FeaturesThe main reason I got this mouse is because of the notch-less scroll wheel which has become my favorite feature ever since I tried it on my older Logitech mice. This feature can still be switched on and off (I prefer it at notch-less most of the time) and I love how I can scroll through pages with just the flick. The wheel appear to be both heavier and smoother than ever. It does have a new mag-wheel mechanism whereby when in notch mode, it automatically switches to free-wheel or notch-less mode whenever the wheel is flicked hard enough... Going back to notch mode as the wheel slows down. I still prefer notch-less all the time but this is a nice feature for those who might want it.ErgonomicsThis is where I think my older MX Revolution beats the new MX Master 3. The MX Master 3 borders on becoming a little too big whereas the MX Revolution in my opinion is sized just right. It also takes getting used to when reaching for the back and forward buttons with your thumb. Those buttons were more readily accessible on the MX Revolution. However, the thumb scroller on the MX Master 3 is much better and more accessible than the thumb wheel on the MX Revolution. Overall I have a slight preference to the MX Master 3 over the MX Revolution mainly because of the smoother scroll wheel and also the more usable thumb scroller.Final wordsThis mouse would have been perfect if it were sized the same as my MX Revolution. However it is still an excellent mouse and I have no hesitation recommending it.

My hubby bought this mouse to replace our Logitech Performance MX from 2009. And now they have changed the software, it is now called Options (my hubby told me to write that its a mindless name for a software) Now the mouse software works on his account but doesn't work on mine.We love the mouse, it fits my small hand as well as our old Performance MX and fits as well my husband's hand. We both love the improved scrolling wheel and the long integrated battery life.
Paired with the MX Keys keyboard, makes a great combination. The new scroll wheel is such a joy to use! I highly recommend this mouse.

Designed with ergonomics in mind and extremely responsive, this mouse is a dream to use for both every day scrolling as well as gaming! My son uses this daily and we have yet to have one issue.The Bluetooth connectivity is impressive and battery life is considerable as well. For a mouse that performs this well we expected to have to change the batteries far more frequently than we have had to. So far, even with daily use, we have only replaced the batteries once.This is comfortable in our hand, even after several hours of consecutive use, and we did not find that this made our hands uncomfortable or stiff. We have no complaints about the tracking wheel and how well it works.This is quiet to operate and the clicking is comfortable. We are very happy with this and can whole- heartedly recommend this for everyday use.

This is a great mouse for professionals since you can customize the actions for all the buttons and create profiles for different programs and apps or games. This is the first mouse I’ve used that has TWO scroll wheels, not just the standard one. The thumb wheel is pretty neat although not entirely needed but you can set it to do some handy things like scroll between different browser tabs or control your music volume.PROS+ Customizable commands/actions for every button with specific profiles for different programs or games (Photoshop, Chrome, Safari, Fortnite, etc.+ Not only for gamer it’s actually a great mouse for computer productivity and professional work (photo editing, coding, etc.)+ Thumb wheel can be customized to easily control volume, switch between tabs, etc.+ Crazy electromagnetic scroll wheel! Scroll hundreds of lines in a split second or scroll with control+ Saves so much time with programmable buttons and seamless switching between up to three devices (so you can work on your PC, then work laptop or gaming laptop within seconds)+ Copy files or text from your PC then switch mouse over to laptop and paste seamlessly+ Ergonomically shaped makes it very comfortableCONS- The clicking sound is louder than I prefer, it would be nice if they made it silent or reduced it quite a bit- Wish it had battery indicator LED lights to easily keep track of when I should charge it

I was looking forward to a more ergonomic mouse and was hoping this would do the trick. So far after weeks of use I still can't get used to the way it handles and the mushy buttons. There are some good points but overall I don't like it.► I like the looks and appreciate the rubberized exterior which makes it easy to hang on to, I wish all mice were set up like this. I also like the weight, I prefer a mouse that feels like I'm actually holding onto something.► This is the first mouse I've got my hands on that uses a type C USB cable for charging (included) and I've not had any problems using it while connected to a USB cable for charging.► Forward/backward buttons are placed nicely and have decent action on them. They are also small enough to not get in the way or be activated when not desired but big enough to easily feel when running a thumb across them.For me, there was one thing that really stood out, the idea that this mouse could be used across different systems seamlessly. Yes software would need to be installed and connection would require both the dongle and Bluetooth but if it worked it could save me time and desk space as I could eliminate two other mice.The concept here is great, this could be a real bonus for those of us who do a lot of work between computers but while the concept is great the execution is not. I found that the software wasn't always working seamlessly. The idea is that you have one mouse that can be used across different systems. We would be able to copy files between different computers as well as use the mouse seamlessly between them. While this works it has it's flawed, primarily the problem is that it sometimes stops functioning without any apparent reason. I've also had issues where a file I was transferring didn't get copied over. Nothing out of the ordinary, things like 200kb PDF's.I was also intrigued to see how well the scroll wheel would work. It's touted as "Ultrafast Magspeed Electromagnetic Scrolling" but it results in sloppy performance. What's that supposed to mean anyway? Yes, there is the ability to scroll super fast through a long document or web page but when control is needed to stop, go backward, or back to a specific point that I just flew past the control isn't there. I don't immediately get the same speed backward and this then results in a lot of scrolling back up again.► The scroll wheel itself is decent, the metal has decent knurling which keeps it from being slippery and there are mild indents that you can feel when scrolling.► Left and right mouse buttons are too soft and give almost no tactile feedback that the button has been pressed.► The left/right scroll wheel located above the back/forward buttons is difficult to use, it sits recessed too far and offers a lot of resistanceUsing the software allows for some customization such as button actions and DPI settings but there is nothing spectacular.► On the upside like the other Logitech products, I own the battery life is great. This is one aspect of wireless products that the company is excellent at.► Pad's on the bottom are also good, the whole thing slides nicely over both metallic and neoprene based mousepads and the sensor tracks on any surface I've tried it on.If the tech inside worked as designed it would be worth the money but as it is I couldn't recommend spending this much for poor to wonky performance not to mention the poor action on the two main buttons.
The most comfortable mouse I've ever used. Expensive yes, but worth the investment if you sit at a desk for multiple hours a day.

WHAT I LIKE:- The battery lasts forever. It came partially charged, and I still have not recharged it after about 2 weeks of use. Although that could be because I only use this for about an hour each day. So, I am very happy with the battery life so far.- Very comfortable to hold and use. There are several buttons and controls if you are a techie or high volume user. I don't use those buttons much. But, they are there to make the use more comfortable.- Very accurate and fast response. There is almost no lag between the mouse and the computer. The connection is instant and I have not observed any lags yet. The mouse also has different dpi settings that you can change manually. So, the higher dpi setting will give you more accurate and minute level performance.- I absolutely love the fact that this mouse does not come with a dongle and is truly wireless. It has built-in bluetooth connection and simply connects to the computer through bluetooth. One reason why I love the dongle-free design is because I have lost at least 2-3 dongles of my wirelss mouse before, which makes the mouse useless. So, the dongle-free design is great for people like me who keep losing the dongles.WHAT I DON'T LIKE:- While the mouse is very easy to use, very comfortable and just glides through the screen, it is a little too large. It looks like it is built for people with very large hands. So, people with small hands may find this a little too big to use. Otherwise, this is an excellent wireless mouse.
Solid mouse. Has a nice weight to it.  Looks slick too. fit my hand perfectly and just works like a magic. This is the mouse to get.  It's so worth the price.

I was really looking forward to trying this mouse out! I always buy Logitech mice anyway (my last two have been M510s, best standard 5 button wireless mouse on the market in my opinion), but this MX Master 3 is not ideal for my usage. I will explain.My main issues are:#1 - One of the major functions touted for this mouse is the electromagnetic scroll wheel, which is supposed to go between standard scrolling and high speed "free-scrolling" by scrolling further and faster automatically. I find that is varies wildly whether this happens or not depending on what program you're using, and even in the same programs sometimes. I will intentionally try to make it high speed scroll, and sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. To be clear, it DOES work in every program I've tried it in, just the criteria and detection of these criteria seems to vary from moment to moment. Maybe this will "work in" as it loosens up with time.NOTE: This can be ameliorated by using the manual "mode switch" button behind the main scroll wheel, but it takes long to do that than to just keep scrolling until it works.#2 - My hands are on the small side for a man. Not ridiculously so, I wear medium-large gloves for example, but this mouse feels "too big" to be comfortable, or to reach all the buttons without changing hand position. The thumb buttons in particular suffer from this. Again, to clarify, I normally use a full sized mouse, not a laptop "portable" mouse, so this is not from being used to an unreasonably tiny mouse.OK, those are my only criticisms, and they are subjective, especially #2 which is completely negated if your hands are bigger than mine. :)Everything else is great! The build quality and materials are excellent. There are no rattles when you shake it, everything is put together tightly and solidly. The plastic of the body is a nice lightly textured plastic, with a soft, almost rubberized feel (though I believe it is not). The buttons are clicky in a positive engagement type of way without being obnoxious, the 4000 DPI sensor provides smooth and accurate tracking on any surface, the thumb wheel allows scrolling through tabs in your browser very easily (and any number of other functions in apps like Photoshop, Premiere, etc), and the battery life is excellent. I've been using it for 12+ hours a day every day for almost two weeks with no need for a charge yet.Overall, I am a fan, I just wish it were a tiny bit shorter in profile, because then it would fit my hand perfectly. In most ways, this is a top tier mouse, and someone who works in CAD or Photoshop or coding would get better functionality from it than I do. But if you have small hands, maybe try something else to prevent giving yourself hand cramps.
I charge it once a week, but battery might survive longer.Mouse is comfortable to hold.Unfortunately not many applications support horizontal scrolling for thumb wheel.

The Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless is a big, comfortable mouse that's intended for premium ergonomics and productivity. The first thing you will notice is that the mouse is pretty big. It covers my entire palm. My palm sits comfortably on it. My hands are on the smaller side so sometimes it does feel a little big and clunky. The scroll wheel is massive and feels very heavy duty and premium. It provides smooth and fast scrolling with an amazing feel. Having said that, some websites like Twitter don't play nicely when scrolling up because it's much slower than scrolling down. I would prefer scrolling up was just as smooth as scrolling down, but I do feel that this is the websites' fault since in programs like Word and Adobe scrolling up is just as fast. I love the side scroll wheel. On Chrome it switches fast from window to window, making productivity and multi-tasking much faster.  The forward and backward buttons are also very useful.Overall, the mouse feels very precise with the 4000DPI sensor. I do not need any special surface as my desk is sufficient. Using it for a month, I've had to recharge it just once using the micro USB. I think I would prefer batteries instead because they last a lot longer and are not expensive to swap out. However, they would make this mouse heavier. One of the best features of this mouse is the Flow technology that allows the cursor to move seamlessly across three computer screens and copy and paste files from one to the other. I use this almost every day as its simple to use and saves lots of time. No more USB sticks or clunky Windows One Drive that doesn't work half the time.  Overall, I think this mouse is amazing if you're looking for a heavy-duty, comfortable mouse with increased functionality and premium features.
Great for office work. Comfortable for long use, make sure your arm is parallel to the floor while using and adjust chair accordingly.
Great mouse

I have been using MX mouse since they came out. It is a generally good product but i don't think it justifies the price. Ordered this product and it came in an open box with an old mouse inside. I had to get it replaced.
Excellent and simply amazing to work seamlessly with up to 3 computers using the  Flow feature.Love the product that provides critical functionality and efficiency in my daily office work.

I have been an exclusive MX Master mouse user since the first version came out and I tend to wear out my mouse and keyboard every 2 years.Deciding whether to upgrade to version 3 or just get another 2S for half the price was a toss up this year.The deciding factor for me was the claim that it is silent when scrolling with scroll wheel click enabled.I have been using it for two days and must say that the upgrade was well worth the price. Not only is it silent when scrolling with clicks, it has a much smoother vertical and horizontal wheel scrolling. It is noticeably lighter than Master 2S.Overall I am extremely satisfied with its performance and ergonomics. Battery life will take a while to confirm but if it is anything like Master 2S, I will forget when I charged it last.

This is simply one of the best mice you can buy. Full stop.From a build quality standpoint, this is as close to tank-like as you can get. It feels incredibly solid and well made. The two scroll wheels are both made of metal which gives this mouse an especially premium feel. The main body is made with soft-touch plastic. The buttons are very clicky and give great tactile feedback. There are exceptionally large low friction pads on the bottom resulting in very smooth and effortless movement over your desk surface. The only thing with the physical design some people might not like is the positioning of your hand. Yes, it is ergonomic. However, if you like to have your hand positioned horizontally instead of at about a 35-degree angle, this might take a bit to get used to. Another positive is USB-C charging. It's 2019, EVERYTHING should have USB-C at this time.The setup is easy. You have a choice to use either Bluetooth or the USB receiver to connect it to your computer. I tried both and there were no issues with the setup or use of either. With most mice, I don't recommend installing any special software. It just creates bloat on your PC and they typically add very little to the functionality of the mouse. That is not the case for this mouse. By installing the software you unlock two incredibly powerful features: contextual actions and the ability to use one mouse across several computers.The contextual actions are something that makes so much sense, you wonder why it hasn't been done for decades. Depending on what program you are doing, you can have buttons perform different actions. Different buttons can even perform actions depending on what you have your mouse hovering over.The less useful (for most people) feature the software has is the ability to use the mouse across different computers. If you have a laptop and a desktop beside each other, you can use the same mouse to control both, moving the cursor from one to another seamlessly as if they were two screens attached to the same computer. You can also cut, copy, and paste between the two as well. Although this is more of a niche use, it is incredibly powerful.Overall, if you are looking for a new mouse, don't hesitate to get this one.

This is probably the best wireless mouse I’ve ever used. It has a ton of additional features, and on top of that it handles the basic stuff better than any mouse I’ve ever owned. It looks great, it’s extremely intuitive, and it works flawlessly on just about any surface. Once you get used to it, you’ll also find that it has a wealth of features and additional functions that you can put to great use.The overall shape and feel of the mouse is extremely comfortable. The curved design is easy on the wrist and there’s a groove where your thumb naturally rests. On top of being comfortable, there are also several additional buttons and controls that are placed in just the right way to make them easy to reach if you know how to use them. For example the horizontal scroll wheel is located on the side of the mouse, right above the thumb, making it extremely simple to use. Right below that are two more buttons which can be used for many things, but by default they can be used (for example) with your web browser to go forward or backwards. The scroll wheel is probably the best I’ve ever seen, with two different modes you can choose from: either a totally smooth scroll, or a “Ratchet” mode where you can feel slight bumps to help you scroll line-by-line. If you want to switch modes, just press the button below the scroll wheel to flip back and forth between the two.Speaking of those extra buttons, you can get a lot more out of them if you choose to download the Logitech program that is partnered with this device. It’s called Logitech Options, and it’s free and simple to install. Once you have it set up, it allows you to adjust lots of little things on your mouse, including choosing what all the extra buttons do. For example, if you don’t need to change your scroll wheel mode, you can instead program that button to change your mouse speed, which is what I did. There’s many ways you can customize all the buttons on your mouse using this program, and on top of that certain programs can be set up to use certain buttons in certain ways, such as Microsoft Word or your web browser using the buttons to do things like “Undo” or zoom in or out.One feature that this mouse boasts, and which it absolutely lives up to, is the claim that it works accurately on virtually any surface. Anyone who has used a wireless mouse knows that sometimes these kinds of devices don’t work well on some surfaces, such as glass tables. This mouse works absolutely perfectly on any surface I tried, no matter what it was made of or how reflective it was. It was always smooth and accurate no matter what, which is a huge relief if you find yourself working on your computer in different places as I do.The battery life on this mouse is also really impressive. It boasts 70 days of use on a single charge, and based on my use of it the past few weeks, I believe it. I’m careful to turn off my mouse when I’m not using it, and as a result I’ve barely used 15% of the battery and have yet to recharge it despite weeks of frequent use. It also charges via a USB-C cable, which is much faster than the usual micro-USB cables, though they are still a lot less common.One final feature I want to mention, which most users probably won’t need, is the ability to connect to multiple devices by bluetooth and USB, and switch between three devices with the press of a button on the bottom of the mouse. If you happen to be working on two different computers and switching back and forth between them, just connect both via bluetooth and you can easily switch from one to the other while still using the same mouse. It’s a feature only a few people would use regularly, but if you are one of those people it’s extremely useful!Overall this is a fantastic mouse. It’s comfortable, it lasts a very long time, and it has a ton of features that are helpful and easy to learn. It works on any surface and can be tweaked to your liking for work, for video games, and for multimedia work like video and photo editing. It’s extremely versatile, but still simple enough for anyone to use it. Though this mouse is designed for a certain type of career, regular people will also love it, the long battery and ergonomic design simply can’t be beat!

Much improved compared to the MX Master 2 in regards to scroll wheel/thumb button. Easier to spin.  Nativation buttons are better positioned.Pretty good battery life if their claims are true.  Haven't used it long enough to say yet.Bluetooth, USB Dongle

This Logitech mouse works very well! It’s been used for routine computer work & games. It’s worked perfectly on every surface it’s been used on. Very responsive. A great change from using a laptop touch pad.

I gave this mouse a solid 3 weeks of testing and I'm not switching to anything else.I love it. The MX master 3 seems to be made for my large hands (6'3" dude).It's superbly smooth, I work across 3 monitors all day and draw for most of it. The mouse is my bread and butter tool.The software is an executable that I was able to install at work - even with our super-tight security settings- so that's a HUGE plus. You can configure the buttons and scroll wheels to what you like. For me that means complex bind-keys on my keyboard for my cad software can now be one click...I haven't figured out what to configure the thumb wheel yet, I tried volume, but it can go up when you least expect it if you brush the wheel by mistake with your thumb.The main scroll wheel is divine. If you give it a rapid spin, the magnetic mechanism releases it and it free spins, so you want to scroll down to page a million in some code, no problem.It's great that it's wireless, and I use the dongle it comes with since my pc has no bluetooth (yea, I design parts of phones for next year with old computers, go figure).Did I mention the mouse accuracy is amazing?Give this mouse a go if you work with the mouse ALL day and want extra comfort with amazing precision and customizable buttons.I have nothing bad to say and only excellent experience with it so far.
I like this mouse, it works perfectly with mac.Unfortunately you can't customize the mouse on Linux :(

I have two of the previous generation and this is an improvement in every way.- Wheel moves easier, and the magnetic lock on this one seems to actually work, as opposed the previous gen that would release the lock after some period of time- Slightly smaller than the previous one, no real opinion on that for me, but those with smaller hands will like it better- Side-scrolling wheel actually useful now. Previous one was too hard to use, and I just ignored it.- Somehow the clicks feel better too. Can't articulate how, but they feel nicer.

Review update: Every now and again the mouse will decide to start lagging and jumping across the screen. This is very annoying and I do not know why it does this since it is random. Other than this, it functions great!So I've never used a mouse beyond the basic design and I must say I love the feel of this mouse. I find most mice are too small and don't feel well designed, but this one is almost perfect for me. I say almost because my ring finger and pinky kind of hang off the side of the mouse, I feel like it could have been extended slightly to accommodate for this. The application that it asks you to download (not required) is very user friendly as it let's you reprogram every button and wheel on the mouse to whatever you want! The downside is that I noticed the app runs in the background and uses some RAM. The wheels are very smooth and noiseless while the buttons don't have a cheap press to them. I would for sure consider this mouse if you're looking for something more ergonomic.

The scroll wheel has a manufacturing defect that Logitech refuses to acknowledge, the scrolling is inconsistent and does not work half the time when you use it. For such a high priced mouse this is not acceptable. I upgraded from a Master Mouse 2S and the same mouse works fine in my computer. I have replaced the Master Mouse 3, three times now and they all exhibit the same problem.Stay away from this product until Logitech figures out QA. The Master Mouse 2S is still a great mouse and has no issues.

This mouse has to be close to the perfect shape that a mouse could ever be. If you reach out with your hand like you are reaching for a mouse, that's the shape it is.  It feels perfectly natural in your hand. It also feels sturdy and very well made. The mouse wheel has just the right amount of resistance when scrolling (line by line precise clicks) but give it a flick and it automatically goes into freewheeling mode (very cool feature). The left and right mouse buttons are long so they can accommodate a wide variety of finder lengths. The thumb rest is great and keep you from dragging your thumb all over the pad. The thumb wheel on the side scrolls left and right (test it out in a spread sheet). Under the thumb wheel is the back and forward buttons and below that under your thumb on the thumb rest there is another button (changes desktops etc). on the under side the 123 switch changes the monitor.It has very long battery life between charges (maybe three to four weeks).On the down side the only thing I could think of to complain about is the size of the power button. It is smaller than I like. I hate messing with a mini buttons although it's not as small as most. Put a power button on top or a larger slider on the bottom.The price is slightly excessive but you get what you pay for.

By just looking at the price, it is such an expensive computer mouse. However, it does have a lot of nice features. The ergonomic design makes it very comfortable to hold and use. The thumb wheel and controls are placed strategically. The scrolling is super fast and precise. Another important feature is the fast charging and long battery life. This is an impressive computer mouse. If you do a lot of gaming and extensive work on a computer, it is for you.

Nice mouse but useless software. Stay away.Last 2 versions of the Logitech Options (v7.x and v8.x) can pair the mouse but then can’t detect it. There is no way to configure or activate the advanced features of the mouse.A real pain as I’m on a managed computer and have to deal with IT to try different versions of the software in order to troubleshoot.

Very comfortable, intuitive interface and high quality components here!  Very pleased to see the USB C charge port.  Surfing and word processing right out of the box, I look forward to using this mouse for some video editing.
This mouse is super comfortable - the ergonomic features are awesome! I do a lot of scrolling and it's so easy with this mouse, it's really responsive.
I like the comfort of this mouse, button placement and overall usability. However, it has a terrible tracking. It skips all over the screen. Not smooth at all.

Fantastic. Overall easy to setup once you download the logitech software. I love how well it tracks on all surfaces verse my older logitech mx1100 (RCR147) mouse that now freezes and skips like crazy.

I love the way the Logitech MX Master 3 Advanced Wireless Mouse - Graphite looks and works. The mouse is smooth and the keys are thoughtfully placed. The only thing I don't like about it is that it is a bit too tall for my hand (I have relatively smallish hands). It think it is a great product, but not necessarily for small hands.

This mouse is SUPER comfortable to use; it's very ergonomic. It's simple plug & play and the software is pretty straightforward to use. I really enjoy the magnetic scroll wheel. That wheel should be a standard. It tracks smooth and does its job perfectly. So far so good.

Excellent ergonomics, improved thumb button layout and wheel, suitable for medium to large hands, USB-c, tracks on glass, 4000 dpi, 1 minute fast charge will provide three hours of use, and thumb button activates a nice window tiling feature.  Nothing not to like about this mouse, and a defiantly improvements over the original MX in terms of thumb button layout with now has no obvious criticisms imo.  However, people with small hands might feel more comfortable with a slightly smaller mouse.Longer review: Big fan of Logitech's MX series mice.  I’ve had several and the original MX Master was my current daily driver at work, so I jumped at the chance to review the MX Master 3.  My initial observation suggested I wouldn't find much of a differences, however, after spending a couple days with it, I’m pleasantly surprised, and can say that it’s worthy upgrade over the original MX master, and an excellent mouse overall. It really is a big improvement over the original.  First, the sensor has been upgraded.  You can physical tell that it’s different, and it had no issues tracking over glass and shiny surfaces, which is super handy (The manual says the glass must be at least 4mm thick)The layout of the thumb buttons has also been improved. Now the back and forward buttons are nicely raised and spaced out better allowing for easy access.  The horizontal thumb wheel is also bigger and more comfortable to uses.  The main right and left mouse buttons feel the same, and have a nice tactile click.  The fit and finish is excellent as is to be expected from Logitech.  As for fit, the mouse has a slightly smaller palm rest then the original MX, and has a little less pronation caused by a slight increased angle of the palm rest.  I also noticed that the thumb rest button activates a different windows tile feature then the original, which is actually very useful if you often have varies apps and windows open, particularly when dealing with multiple windows, without the need to install any additional software – really handy when you using it on a work computer that doesn’t allow additional software to be installed.  The electromagnetic scroll wheel is very nice and feels  similar to the original MX master which I’ve been using for years without issue.  You can also connect up to three devices, and select them via the hardware switch on the button of the mouse, similar as the previous master. Works really well if you have to switch between computers, or devices.  It also has USB-C charging, which will give you three hours of uses for 1 minute of charging – that’s pretty amazing.  A full charge will power the mouse for up to 70 days, though your millage may vary.  Really happy to see usb-c over the older micro usb connection.  All in all, this is a worthy successor.  Only quibble I have, is that the original had a three LED status light re battery power, and this one only has one.

The MX Master 3 Mouse is truly a beautiful ergonomic mouse.  It has all the functions of a regular mouse and  much more.The scroll wheel has two modes.  A precise mode for slow accurate line by line scrolling and a fast mode to scroll through lines in record speed.  The mouse has a side scroll wheel which is great to use for spreadsheets that go off screen as well as back and forward buttons just below it.  On the right side where your thumb will rest if you press down once it will show everything that is open on your desktop.  Keep it pressed and you can open a second or third desktop on you laptop or PC (I am using Windows 10).Underneath the mouse you have the on/off switch and a another switch to switch between paired devices.  I was able to switch between my Android Tablet to my laptop with ease.  What surprised me most is that it actually even worked on the Tablet since there was no indication that it would other than it works with Linux so I gave it a try.The battery charge is amazing.  Three minutes will give you a day's worth of charge and on a full charge it can last up to 70 days.To pair, turn it on, press the 1,2,3 button to the number of your choice, from your device's BT find the MX Master and pair it.  It is that easy.  To add more do the same thing but choose a different number.  It also comes with a dongle.  Unfortunately, the mouse does not appear to have onboard storage for the dongle.  The only minor con I could find.This is the most ergonomic and  comfortable mouse I have ever used.  Movements are precise.  There are good tutorial videos on how to get the most of this mouse.  I am torn between using it at work for for home use, so I will likely have to purchase another one as I like it that much.
Works just as well as advertised. I wish it had a dedicated battery indicator so that I would not have to open the desktop app every time I wanted to check remaining battery life!
Loved the MX Master 2s, and Logitech managed to make it even better, Love this mouse, it is great for productivity.
Scroll wheel magnetically locked up and broke within the first 3 hours of use. Not enough buttons for professional use, which is a real shame as it's one of the few good ergonomic mice.

I had the MX Master and then the MX Master 2 and then this one. This is the best series of mice, they feel very confortable and a must if you do a lot of scrolling. This version fixes all the little annoyances of the MX Master 2. Great job Logitech!
